You cannot, however, build a film out of nothing but changes in weather—although there are those who have tried. Story Events are meaningful, not trivial. To make change meaningful it must, to begin with, happen to a character. If you see someone drenched in a downpour, this has somewhat more meaning than a damp street.

故事事件会对人物的生活状况产生有意义的变化，这种变化以价值观的形式表达和体验。

A STORY EVENT creates meaningful change in the life situation of a character that is expressed and experienced in terms of a VALUE.

要使改变有意义，你必须用价值观来表达它，观众也必须对此作出反应。我说的价值观不是指美德，也不是指狭隘的、道德化的“家庭价值观”。相反，故事价值观指的是最广泛的概念。价值观是讲故事的灵魂。归根结底，我们的艺术是向世界表达价值观的艺术。

To make change meaningful you must express it, and the audience must react to it, in terms of a value. By values I don’t mean virtues or the narrow, moralizing “family values” use of the word. Rather, Story Values refers to the broadest sense of the idea. Values are the soul of storytelling. Ultimately ours is the art of expressing to the world a perception of values.

故事价值是人类经验的普遍品质，它可能会从积极转变为消极，或从消极转变为积极，从一个时刻转变为下一个时刻。

STORY VALUES are the universal qualities of human experience that may shift from positive to negative, or negative to positive, from one moment to the next.

例如：生/死（正面/负面）是一种故事价值，爱/恨、自由/奴役、真相/谎言、勇气/懦弱、忠诚/背叛、智慧/愚昧、力量/软弱、兴奋/无聊等等也是一种故事价值。所有这些随时可以逆转其作用的二元体验品质都是故事价值。它们可能是道德的、善/恶的；伦理的、对/错的；或者只是充满价值。希望/绝望既不是道德的也不是伦理的，但我们当然知道我们何时处于体验的一端或另一端。

For example: alive/dead (positive/negative) is a story value, as are love/hate, freedom/slavery, truth/lie, courage/cowardice, loyalty/betrayal, wisdom/stupidity, strength/weakness, excitement/boredom and so on. All such binary qualities of experience that can reverse their charge at any moment are Story Values. They may be moral, good/evil; ethical, right/wrong; or simply charged with value. Hope/despair is neither moral nor ethical, but we certainly know when we are at one end of the experience or the other.

想象一下，窗外是 20 世纪 80 年代的东非，一片干旱之地。现在我们面临一个关键价值：生存、生死。我们从负面开始：这场可怕的饥荒夺走了成千上万的生命。如果那时下雨，一场季风让大地恢复绿色，动物回归牧场，人们恢复生存，这场雨将具有深远的意义，因为它将价值从负面转变为正面，从死亡转变为生命。

Imagine that outside your window is 1980s East Africa, a realm of drought. Now we have a value at stake: survival, life/death. We begin at the negative: This terrible famine is taking lives by the thousands. If then it should rain, a monsoon that brings the earth back to green, animals to pasture, and people to survival, this rain would be deeply meaningful because it switches the value from negative to positive, from death to life.

然而，尽管这一事件很有影响力，但它仍然不符合故事事件的条件，因为它是偶然发生的。东非终于下雨了。虽然讲故事时有巧合的成分，但故事不可能完全由偶然事件构成，无论偶然事件的价值有多大。

However, as powerful as this event would be, it still does not qualify as a Story Event because it happened by coincidence. Rain finally fell in East Africa. Although there’s a place for coincidence in storytelling, a story cannot be built out of nothing but accidental events, no matter how charged with value.

故事事件会对人物的生活状况产生有意义的变化，这种变化以价值观的形式表达和体验，并通过冲突实现。

A Story Event creates meaningful change in the life situation of a character that is expressed and experienced in terms of a value and ACHIEVED THROUGH CONFLICT.

再次，这是一个干旱的世界。一个想象自己是“雨人”的人进入了这个世界。这个角色内心深处存在着矛盾，一方面他坚信自己可以带来雨水，尽管他从来没有做到过，另一方面他又非常害怕自己是个傻瓜或疯子。他遇见了一个女人，坠入爱河，然后痛苦地看着她试图相信他，但却转身离开，相信他是个骗子或更糟的人。他与社会有着强烈的冲突——一些人追随他，好像他是救世主；另一些人想用石头把他赶出城。最后，他面临着与物质世界的无情冲突——炎热的风、空旷的天空、干涸的土地。如果这个人能够克服内心和个人的所有冲突，对抗社会和环境力量，最终从万里无云的天空中哄出雨水，那么这场风暴将是宏伟而意义非凡的——因为它是通过冲突引发的变化。我所描述的是《雨人》，由理查德·纳什根据自己的剧本改编成电影。

Again, a world of drought. Into it comes a man who imagines himself a “rainmaker.” This character has deep inner conflict between his passionate belief that he can bring rain, although he has never been able to do it, and his terrible fear that he’s a fool or mad. He meets a woman, falls in love, then suffers as she tries to believe in him, but turns away, convinced he’s a charlatan or worse. He has a strong conflict with society—some follow him as if he’s a messiah; others want to stone him out of town. Lastly, he faces implacable conflict with the physical world—the hot winds, empty skies, parched earth. If this man can struggle through all his inner and personal conflicts, against social and environmental forces and finally coax rain out of a cloudless sky, that storm would be majestic and sublimely meaningful—for it is change motivated through conflict. What I have described is THE RAINMAKER, adapted to the screen by Richard Nash from his own play.

场景

Scene

对于一部典型的电影，编剧会选择 40 到 60 个故事事件，也就是通常所说的场景。小说家可能需要超过 60 个，而剧作家很少会选择多达 40 个。

For a typical film, the writer will choose forty to sixty Story Events or, as they’re commonly known, scenes. A novelist may want more than sixty, a playwright rarely as many as forty.

场景是在或多或少连续的时间和空间中通过冲突而发生的行动，它将角色生活中充满价值的状况转变为至少一个具有一定程度可感知意义的价值。理想情况下，每个场景都是一个故事事件。

A SCENE is an action through conflict in more or less continuous time and space that turns the value-charged condition of a character’s life on at least one value with a degree of perceptible significance. Ideally, every scene is a STORY EVENT.

仔细查看你写的每个场景，并问自己：此刻我的角色生活中有什么价值？爱？真相？什么？这个价值在场景的开头是如何体现的？正面的？负面的？两者兼而有之？记下来。接下来转到场景的结尾，问自己：这个价值现在在哪里？正面的？负面的？两者兼而有之？记下来并进行比较。如果你在场景结尾写下的答案与你在开头做的笔记相同，那么你现在要问另一个重要问题：为什么这个场景会出现在我的剧本中？

Look closely at each scene you’ve written and ask: What value is at stake in my character’s life at this moment? Love? Truth? What? How is that value charged at the top of the scene? Positive? Negative? Some of both? Make a note. Next turn to the close of the scene and ask, Where is this value now? Positive? Negative? Both? Make a note and compare. If the answer you write down at the end of the scene is the same note you made at the opening, you now have another important question to ask: Why is this scene in my script?

如果角色生活中的价值状态从场景的一端到另一端保持不变，则不会发生任何有意义的事情。场景中有活动 — 谈论这个，做那个 — 但价值没有任何变化。这是一个非事件。

If the value-charged condition of the character’s life stays unchanged from one end of a scene to the other, nothing meaningful happens. The scene has activity—talking about this, doing that—but nothing changes in value. It is a nonevent.

那么，为什么故事中会有这个场景呢？答案几乎肯定是“展示”。它的作用是向偷听的观众传达有关人物、世界或历史的信息。如果展示是场景的唯一理由，那么训练有素的作家会将其丢弃，并将其信息编织到电影的其他地方。

Why then is the scene in the story? The answer is almost certain to be “exposition.” It’s there to convey information about characters, world, or history to the eavesdropping audience. If exposition is a scene’s sole justification, a disciplined writer will trash it and weave its information into the film elsewhere.

没有一个场景是没有转折的。这是我们的理想。我们努力将角色生活中的某个价值从正面转变为负面，或从负面转变为正面，从而使每个场景从头到尾都圆满。坚持这一原则可能很难，但绝非不可能。

No scene that doesn’t turn. This is our ideal. We work to round every scene from beginning to end by turning a value at stake in a character’s life from the positive to the negative or the negative to the positive. Adherence to this principle may be difficult, but it’s by no means impossible.

《虎胆龙威》、《亡命天涯》和《稻草狗》显然符合这一标准，但《长日留痕》和《意外的旅客》也以更微妙但同样严格的方式保留了这一理想。不同之处在于，动作片关注的是自由/奴役或正义/不公正等公共价值观；教育片关注的是自我意识/自我欺骗或生命有意义/无意义等内在价值观。无论类型如何，原则都是普遍适用的：如果一个场景不是真实事件，就删掉它。

DIE HARD, THE FUGITIVE, and STRAW DOGS clearly meet this test, but the ideal is also kept in subtler, though no less rigorous ways, in REMAINS OF THE DAY and THE ACCIDENTAL TOURIST. The difference is that Action genres turn on public values such as freedom/slavery or justice/injustice; the Education genre turns on interior values such as self-awareness/self-deception or life as meaningful/meaningless. Regardless of genre, the principle is universal: If a scene is not a true event, cut it.

例如：

For example:

克里斯和安迪相爱并住在一起。一天早上，他们醒来后开始争吵。他们在厨房里匆忙做早餐时争吵加剧。在车库里，当他们钻进车里一起开车去上班时，争吵变得更加激烈。最后，在高速公路上，争吵演变成暴力冲突。安迪把车撞到路肩，跳下车，结束了他们的关系。这一系列动作和地点创造了一个场景：它将这对情侣从积极的（相爱和在一起）带到了消极的（仇恨和分离）。

Chris and Andy are in love and live together. They wake up one morning and start to squabble. Their spat builds in the kitchen as they hurry to make breakfast. In the garage, the fight becomes nastier as they climb into their car to drive to work together. Finally words explode into violence on the highway. Andy wrenches the car to the shoulder and jumps out, ending their relationship. This series of actions and locations creates a scene: It takes the couple from the positive (in love and together) to the negative (in hate and apart).

四个地点的转换——从卧室到厨房到车库再到高速公路——是摄影机的设置，但不是真实的场景。虽然它们强化了行为并使关键时刻变得可信，但它们确实不会改变所涉及的价值观。上午的争吵中，这对情侣仍然在一起，想必他们也相爱。但当情节发展到转折点时——车门砰地关上，安迪宣布“结束了！”——这对情侣的生活发生了翻天覆地的变化，活动变成了行动，小品变成了一个完整的场景，一个故事事件。

The four shifts of place—bedroom to kitchen to garage to highway—are camera setups but not true scenes. Although they intensify behavior and make the critical moment credible, they do not change the values at stake. As the argument moves through the morning, the couple is still together and presumably in love. But when the action reaches its Turning Point—a slamming car door and Andy’s declaration, “It’s over!”—life turns upside down for the lovers, activity changes to action, and the sketch becomes a complete scene, a Story Event.

通常，判断一系列活动是否构成真实场景的标准是：它能否“一气呵成”地写成，在时间和地点上保持一致？在这种情况下，答案是肯定的。他们的争吵可能在卧室里开始，在卧室里建立关系，并在卧室里结束关系。无数的关系都以卧室结束。或者在厨房。或者车库。或者不是在高速公路上，而是在办公室电梯里。剧作家可能会“一气呵成”地写出这个场景，因为剧院的舞台限制常常迫使我们保持时间和地点的统一；另一方面，小说家或编剧可能会游历这个场景，在时间和空间上对其进行解析，以确定未来的地点、克里斯对家具的品味、安迪的驾驶习惯——出于各种原因。这个场景甚至可以与另一个场景交叉剪辑，也许涉及另一对情侣。变化无穷，但在所有情况下，这都是一个单一的故事事件，“恋人分手”场景。

Generally the test of whether a series of activities constitutes a true scene is this: Could it have been written “in one,” in a unity of time and place? In this case the answer is yes. Their argument could begin in a bedroom, build in the bedroom, and end the relationship in the bedroom. Countless relationships have ended in bedrooms. Or the kitchen. Or the garage. Or not on the highway but in the office elevator. A playwright might write the scene “in one” because the staging limitations of the theatre often force us to keep the unities of time and place; the novelist or screenwriter, on the other hand, might travel the scene, parsing it out in time and space to establish future locations, Chris’s taste in furniture, Andy’s driving habits—for any number of reasons. This scene could even cross-cut with another scene, perhaps involving another couple. The variations are endless, but in all cases this is a single Story Event, the “lovers break up” scene.

打

Beat

场景中存在着最小的结构元素，即节拍。（不要将其与对话栏中的“节拍”相混淆，后者表示“短暂的停顿”。）

Inside the scene is the smallest element of structure, the Beat. (Not to be confused with [beat], an indication within a column of dialogue meaning “short pause”.)

节拍是动作/反应中的行为交换。节拍中这些变化的行为塑造了场景的转变。

A BEAT is an exchange of behavior in action/reaction. Beat by Beat these changing behaviors shape the turning of a scene.

仔细看看“恋人分手”的场景：闹钟响起。克里斯调侃安迪，安迪也做出同样的反应。当他们穿衣服时，调侃变成了讽刺，他们互相辱骂。现在在厨房里，克里斯威胁安迪：“如果我离开你，宝贝，你会很痛苦……”但他揭穿了她的虚张声势，“那是我会喜欢这种痛苦。”在车库里，克里斯担心她会失去他，恳求安迪留下来，但他却大笑着嘲笑她的恳求。最后，在飞驰的汽车里，克里斯挥起拳头，打了安迪一拳。一场打斗，一阵刹车声。安迪鼻子流血地跳了出来，关上车门，喊道：“结束了”，让她震惊不已。

Taking a closer look at the “lovers break up” scene: As the alarm goes off. Chris teases Andy and he reacts in kind. As they dress, teasing turns to sarcasm and they throw insults back and forth. Now in the kitchen Chris threatens Andy with: “If I left you, baby, you’d be so miserable …” but he calls her bluff with “That’s a misery I’d love.” In the garage Chris, afraid she’s losing him, begs Andy to stay, but he laughs and ridicules her plea. Finally, in the speeding car, Chris doubles her fist and punches Andy. A fight, a squeal of brakes. Andy jumps out with a bloody nose, slams the door and shouts, “It’s over,” leaving her in shock.

这个场景围绕六个节奏、六种截然不同的行为、六种明显的动作/反应变化展开：互相戏弄，然后是互相辱骂，然后是互相威胁和挑衅，接下来是恳求和嘲笑，最后是暴力交换，最终导致最后的节奏和转折点：安迪结束关系的决定和行动，以及克里斯的震惊。

This scene is built around six beats, six distinctively different behaviors, six clear changes of action/reaction: teasing each other, followed by a give-and-take of insults, then threatening and daring each other, next pleading and ridiculing, and finally exchanges of violence that lead to the last Beat and Turning Point: Andy’s decision and action that ends the relationship, and Chris’s dumbfounded surprise.

顺序

Sequence

节拍构建场景。场景构建故事设计中第二大动作，即序列。每个真实场景都会改变角色生活中充满价值的状况，但不同事件之间的变化程度可能大不相同。场景会造成相对较小但意义重大的变化。然而，序列的结束场景会带来更强大、更决定性的变化。

Beats build scenes. Scenes then build the next largest movement of story design, the Sequence. Every true scene turns the value-charged condition of the character’s life, but from event to event the degree of change can differ greatly. Scenes cause relatively minor yet significant change. The capping scene of a sequence, however, delivers a more powerful, determinant change.

序列是一系列场景（通常为两到五个），其最终效果比任何先前的场景都更具影响力。

A SEQUENCE is a series of scenes—generally two to five—that culminates with greater impact than any previous scene.

例如，这个三场景序列：

For example, this three-scene sequence:

设置：一位在中西部有着显赫职业生涯的年轻女商人被猎头公司联系，并参加了纽约一家公司的职位面试。如果她赢得这个职位，这将是她职业生涯的一大进步。她非常想得到这份工作，但还没有得到（负面）。她是六名决赛选手之一。公司负责人意识到这个职位具有重要的公共意义，因此他们希望在做出最终决定之前，在非正式的场合看看这些申请人的表现。他们邀请这六人参加曼哈顿东区的一场派对。

Setup: A young business woman who’s had a notable career in the Midwest has been approached by headhunters and interviewed for a position with a New York corporation. If she wins this post, it’ll be a huge step up in her career. She wants the job very much but hasn’t won it yet (negative). She is one of six finalists. The corporate heads realize that this position has a vital public dimension to it, so they want to see these applicants on their feet in an informal setting before making the final decision. They invite all six to a party on Manhattan’s East Side.

第一幕：我们的主角在西区酒店为晚上做准备。这其中的价值在于自信/自我怀疑。她需要所有的自信才能成功度过这个夜晚，但她心中充满了怀疑（消极的）。她在房间里踱步时感到恐惧，她告诉自己来东部是个傻瓜，这些纽约人会把她活活吃掉的。她从行李箱里拿出衣服，试穿这件，试穿那件，但每一套衣服看起来都比之前的更糟糕。她的头发乱糟糟的，乱糟糟的。当她努力整理衣服和头发时，她决定收拾东西，以免蒙受羞辱。

Scene One: A West Side Hotel where our protagonist prepares for the evening. The value at stake is self-confidence/self-doubt. She’ll need all her confidence to pull off this evening successfully, but she’s filled with doubts (negative). Fear knots her middle as she paces the room, telling herself she was a fool to come East, these New Yorkers will eat her alive. She flings clothes out of her suitcase, trying on this, trying on that, but each outfit looks worse than the one before. Her hair is an uncombable tangle of frizz. As she grapples with her clothes and hair, she decides to pack it in and save herself the humiliation.

突然，电话铃响了。是她妈妈打来的，她一边祝她好运，一边抱怨自己孤独和害怕被抛弃。芭芭拉挂断了电话，意识到曼哈顿的食人鱼根本无法与家里的大白鲨相提并论。她需要这份工作！然后，她用一套从未尝试过的衣服和配饰组合让自己大吃一惊。她的头发神奇地整齐了。她站在镜子前，看起来很棒，眼睛明亮，充满自信（积极）。

Suddenly, the phone rings. It’s her mother, calling to lace a good-luck toast with guilt trips about loneliness and her fear of abandonment. Barbara hangs up, realizing that the piranhas of Manhattan are no match for the great white shark at home. She needs this job! She then amazes herself with a combination of clothes and accessories she’s never tried before. Her hair falls magically into place. She plants herself in front of the mirror, looking great, eyes bright, glowing with confidence (positive).

第二幕：在酒店的帐篷下。雷鸣电闪，倾盆大雨。因为芭芭拉来自特雷霍特，所以她登记时不知道要给门卫五块钱小费，这样他就不会冒着暴风雨出去为客人找出租车了。此外，纽约下雨时没有出租车。所以她研究了游客地图，思考该怎么办。她意识到如果她试图从西八十街跑到中央公园西街，然后一路沿着中央公园西街跑到五十九街，穿过中央公园南街到公园大道，再跑到东八十街，她就永远无法准时到达聚会地点。所以她决定做他们警告过永远不要做的事情——晚上跑过中央公园。这个场景有了新的价值：生死。

Scene Two: Under the hotel marquee. Thunder, lightning, pelting rain. Because Barbara’s from Terre Haute, she didn’t know to tip the doorman five bucks when she registered, so he won’t go out into the storm to find a cab for a stiff. Besides, when it rains in New York there are no cabs. So she studies her visitors’ map, pondering what to do. She realizes if she tries to run from the West Eighties over to Central Park West, then all the way down CPW to Fifty-ninth Street, across Central Park South to Park Avenue, and up into the East Eighties, she’ll never get to the party on time. So she decides to do what they warn never, ever to do—to run through Central Park at night. This scene takes on a new value: life/death.

她用报纸盖住头发，冲进夜色中，冒着死亡的危险（负面）。一道闪电，砰的一声，她被那群总是在那里的人包围了，雨或者闪耀光芒，等待晚上在公园里跑来跑去的傻瓜。但她上空手道课不是白上。她一路踢打着这帮人，打断他们的下巴，把牙齿散落在水泥地上，直到她跌跌撞撞地走出公园，活着（积极）。

She covers her hair with a newspaper and darts into the night, daring death (negative). A lightning flash and, bang, she’s surrounded by that gang that is always out there, rain or shine, waiting for the fools who run through the park at night. But she didn’t take karate classes for nothing. She kick-fights her way through the gang, breaking jaws, scattering teeth on the concrete, until she stumbles out of the park, alive (positive).

第三幕：镜子大厅——帕克大道公寓大楼。现在，价值转向社交成功/社交失败。她幸存了下来。但随后，她看着镜子，看到了一只溺毙的老鼠：头发里夹着碎报纸；衣服上沾满了血——帮派的血——但无论如何都是血。她的自信心一落千丈，怀疑和恐惧不断加深，直到她因个人失败（负面）而屈服，被社交灾难（负面）压垮。

Scene Three: Mirrored lobby—Park Avenue apartment building. The value at stake now switches to social success/social failure. She’s survived. But then she looks in the mirror and sees a drowned rat: newspaper shredded in her hair; blood all over her clothes—the gang’s blood—but blood nonetheless. Her self-confidence plummets past doubt and fear until she bows in personal defeat (negative), crushed by her social disaster (negative).

出租车停在了其他应聘者旁边。大家都找到了出租车，下车时都打扮得像个纽约人。他们可怜这个来自中西部的可怜的失败者，把她领进了电梯。

Taxis pull up with the other applicants. All found cabs; all get out looking New York chic. They take pity on the poor loser from the Midwest and usher her into an elevator.

在顶楼公寓，他们用毛巾擦干她的头发，为她找来不相配的衣服穿，因为她现在这个样子，整个晚上的聚光灯都聚焦在她身上。因为她知道自己无论如何都输了，所以她放松下来，恢复自然的自我，从内心深处流露出一种她从未意识到的厚颜无耻；她不仅告诉他们她在公园里的战斗，还拿它开玩笑。人们惊愕得张大嘴巴，或者大笑起来。晚上结束时，所有的高管都清楚地知道他们想要谁来做这份工作：任何能在公园里经历那种恐惧并表现出这种冷静的人显然就是他们想要的人。晚上以她个人和社交上的胜利结束，因为她得到了这份工作（双重积极）。

In the penthouse they towel off her hair and find mismatched clothes for her to wear, and because she looks like this, the spotlight’s on her all night. Because she knows she has lost anyway, she relaxes into her natural self and from deep within comes a chutzpah she never knew she had; she not only tells them about her battle in the park but makes jokes about it. Mouths go slack with awe or wide with laughter. At end of the evening, all the executives know exactly who they want for the job: Anyone who can go through that terror in the park and display this kind of cool is clearly the person for them. The evening ends on her personal and social triumphs as she is given the job (doubly positive).

每个场景都围绕着自己的价值观展开。场景一：自我怀疑到自信。场景二：死亡到生命；自信到失败。场景三：社会灾难到社会胜利。但这三个场景变成了另一个更大的价值观的序列，它凌驾于其他价值观之上并从属于其他价值观，那就是工作。在序列的开头，她没有工作。第三个场景成为序列的高潮，因为在这里，社会成功使她这份工作。从她的角度来看，这份工作具有巨大的价值，她愿意为之冒生命危险。

Each scene turns on its own value or values. Scene One: self-doubt to self-confidence. Scene Two: death to life; self-confidence to defeat. Scene Three: social disaster to social triumph. But the three scenes become a sequence of another, greater value that overrides and subordinates the others, and that is THE JOB. At the beginning of the sequence she has NO JOB. The third scene becomes a Sequence Climax because here social success wins her THE JOB. From her point of view THE JOB is a value of such magnitude she risked her life for it.

给每个片段都加上标题，可以让你清楚地明白为什么这个片段会出现在电影中。这个“获得工作”片段的故事目的是让她从没有工作到有工作。这本来可以在一个人事官员的单一场景中完成。但为了表达比“她有资格”更多的东西，我们可以创建一个完整的片段，不仅让她获得了工作，还戏剧化地展现了她的内在性格和与母亲的关系，以及对纽约市和公司的见解。

It’s useful to title each sequence to make clear to yourself why it’s in the film. The story purpose of this “getting the job” sequence is to take her from NO JOB to JOB. It could have been accomplished in a single scene with a personnel officer. But to say more than “she’s qualified,” we might create a full sequence that not only gets her the job but dramatizes her inner character and relationship to her mother, along with insights into New York City and the corporation.

行为

Act

场景以次要但重要的方式转变；一系列场景构建出一个以适度、更有影响力的方式转变的序列；一系列序列构建出下一个最大的结构，即幕，这一运动以角色生活中充满价值的状态的重大逆转为转折点。基本场景、序列高潮场景和幕高潮场景之间的区别在于变化的程度，或者更准确地说，变化对角色（角色的内心生活、个人关系、世事或所有这些的组合）产生的影响程度，无论是好是坏。

Scenes turn in minor but significant ways; a series of scenes builds a sequence that turns in a moderate, more impactful way; a series of sequences builds the next largest structure, the Act, a movement that turns on a major reversal in the value-charged condition of the character’s life. The difference between a basic scene, a scene that climaxes a sequence, and a scene that climaxes an act is the degree of change, or, more precisely, the degree of impact that change has, for better or worse, on the character—on the character’s inner life, personal relationships, fortunes in the world, or some combination of all these.

ACT 是一系列在高潮场景中达到顶峰的序列，它会导致价值观的重大逆转，其影响力比任何先前的序列或场景都更为强大。

An ACT is a series of sequences that peaks in a climactic scene which causes a major reversal of values, more powerful in its impact than any previous sequence or scene.

故事

Story

一系列幕构成了最大的结构：故事。故事就是一个巨大的主事件。当你在故事开始时观察人物生活中充满价值的情况，然后将其与故事结尾处的价值情况进行比较时，你应该看到电影的弧线，即生活从开头的一种状态转变为结尾的一种变化状态的巨大变化。这个最终状态，这个最终变化，必须是绝对的和不可逆转的。

A series of acts builds the largest structure of all: the Story. A story is simply one huge master event. When you look at the value-charged situation in the life of the character at the beginning of the story, then compare it to the value-charge at the end of the story, you should see the arc of the film, the great sweep of change that takes life from one condition at the opening to a changed condition at the end. This final condition, this end change, must be absolute and irreversible.

场景引起的变化可以逆转：前一小品中的恋人可以重新在一起；人们每天都会坠入爱河，分分合合，然后又重新相爱。一个序列可以逆转：中西部女商人可能赢得了工作，却发现自己向一位她讨厌的老板汇报工作，她希望自己回到特雷霍特。一幕高潮可以逆转：一个角色可能会死去，就像《外星人》第二幕高潮中那样，然后复活。为什么不呢？在现代医院里，让死人复活是常有的事。因此，一个场景一个序列一个幕，作者创造了小的、中等的和大的改变，但可以想象，每个改变都可以逆转。然而，最后一幕的高潮并非如此。

Change caused by a scene could be reversed: The lovers in the previous sketch could get back together; people fall in and out and back in love again every day. A sequence could be reversed: The Midwest businesswoman could win her job only to discover that she reports to a boss she hates and wishes she were back in Terre Haute. An act climax could be reversed: A character could die, as in the Act Two climax of E.T., and then come back to life. Why not? In a modern hospital, reviving the dead is commonplace. So, scene by sequence by act, the writer creates minor, moderate, and major change, but conceivably, each of those changes could be reversed. This is not, however, the case in the climax of the last act.

故事高潮：故事是由一系列的行为构成，最终达到最后一幕的高潮或故事的高潮，带来绝对的、不可逆转的变化。

STORY CLIMAX: A story is a series of acts that build to a last act climax or story climax which brings about absolute and irreversible change.

如果你让最小的元素发挥作用，那么讲述的深层目的就会实现。让每句对话或每行描述都转变行为和动作，或为改变设置条件。让你的节奏构建场景，场景构建序列，序列构建动作，动作构建故事直至高潮。

If you make the smallest element do its job, the deep purpose of the telling will be served. Let every phrase of dialogue or line of description either turn behavior and action or set up the conditions for change. Make your beats build scenes, scenes build sequences, sequences build acts, acts build story to its climax.

这些场景将特雷霍特女主人公的生活从自我怀疑转变为自信，从危险转变为生存，从社会灾难转变为成功，这些场景组合成一个序列，将她从失业转变为有工作。为了将讲述引向故事高潮，也许这个开场序列设置了一系列序列，将她从失业转变为第一幕高潮中的公司总裁。第一幕的高潮为第二幕做了铺垫，在第二幕中，公司内部的战争导致她被朋友和同事背叛。在第二幕的高潮中，她被董事会解雇并流落街头。这个重大逆转将她送到了一家竞争对手公司，在那里，她凭借担任总裁期间收集的商业机密，迅速再次登上顶峰，以便享受摧毁前任雇主的乐趣。这些表演使她从影片开头勤奋、乐观、诚实的年轻职业人士，转变为影片结尾冷酷、愤世嫉俗、腐败的企业战争老兵——绝对的、不可逆转的变化。

The scenes that turn the life of the Terre Haute protagonist from self-doubt to self-confidence, from danger to survival, from social disaster to success combine into a sequence that takes her from NO JOB to JOB. To arc the telling to a Story Climax, perhaps this opening sequence sets up a series of sequences that takes her from NO JOB to PRESIDENT OF THE CORPORATION at the Act One climax. This Act One climax sets up an Act Two in which internecine corporate wars lead to her betrayal by friends and associates. At the Act Two climax she’s fired by the board of directors and out on the street. This major reversal sends her to a rival corporation where, armed with business secrets gleaned while she was president, she quickly reaches the top again so she can enjoy destroying her previous employers. These acts arc her from the hardworking, optimistic, and honest young professional who opens the film to the ruthless, cynical, and corrupt veteran of corporate wars who ends the film—absolute, irreversible change.

故事三角

THE STORY TRIANGLE

在某些文学圈，“情节”已经成为一个贬义词，带有商业主义的意味。这是我们的损失，因为情节是一个准确的术语，它指的是随着时间的推移形成和设计故事的内在一致、相互关联的事件模式。虽然没有一部优秀的电影是没有偶然灵感的闪现而创作出来的，但剧本并不是偶然的。随意冒出来的素材不能随意保留。作家一次又一次地重新起草灵感，让它看起来像是本能的自发性创造了这部电影，但他知道要让它看起来自然而毫不费力需要付出多少努力和不自然的努力。

In some literary circles “plot” has become a dirty word, tarred with a connotation of hack commercialism. The loss is ours, for plot is an accurate term that names the internally consistent, interrelated pattern of events that move through time to shape and design a story. While no fine film was ever written without flashes of fortuitous inspiration, a screenplay is not an accident. Material that pops up willy-nilly cannot remain willy-nilly. The writer redrafts inspiration again and again, making it look as if an instinctive spontaneity created the film, yet knowing how much effort and unnaturalness went into making it look natural and effortless.

情节意味着在故事的危险地带中穿行，并在面临十几个分支可能性时选择正确的路径。情节是作家对事件的选择及其时间设计。

To PLOT means to navigate through the dangerous terrain of story and when confronted by a dozen branching possibilities to choose the correct path. Plot is the writer’s choice of events and their design in time.

再说一遍，要包括什么？排除什么？在什么之前和之后放什么？必须对事件做出选择；作家要么选择好，要么选择坏；结果就是情节。

Again, what to include? Exclude? Put before and after what? Event choices must be made; the writer chooses either well or ill; the result is plot.

《温柔的怜悯》首映时，一些评论家将其描述为“没有情节”，然后又因此称赞它。《温柔的怜悯》不仅有情节，而且情节精妙，贯穿了所有电影中最难的部分：故事情节发生在主人公的内心。在这里，主人公对生活和/或对自己的态度经历了一场深刻而不可逆转的革命。

When TENDER MERCIES premiered, some reviewers described it as “plotless,” then praised it for that. TENDER MERCIES not only has a plot, it is exquisitely plotted through some of the most difficult film terrain of all: a story in which the arc of the film takes place within the mind of the protagonist. Here the protagonist experiences a deep and irreversible revolution in his attitude toward life and/or toward himself.

对于小说家来说，这样的故事是自然而轻松的。无论是第三人称还是第一人称，小说家都可以直接侵入思想和情感，将故事完全戏剧化，展现主人公的内心生活。对于编剧来说，这样的故事是最脆弱和最困难的。我们无法将镜头对准演员的前额，拍摄他的想法，尽管有些人会尝试。我们必须以某种方式引导观众从外在行为中解读内心生活，而不会给观众带来负担电影配乐中充满了解说性的叙述，或者角色的口中充满了不言自明的对话。正如约翰·卡朋特所说：“电影就是把精神的东西变成物质的东西。”

For the novelist such stories are natural and facile. In either third-person or first-person, the novelist can directly invade thought and feeling to dramatize the tale entirely on the landscape of the protagonist’s inner life. For the screenwriter such stories are by far the most fragile and difficult. We cannot drive a camera lens through an actor’s forehead and photograph his thoughts, although there are those who would try. Somehow we must lead the audience to interpret the inner life from outer behavior without loading the soundtrack with expositional narration or stuffing the mouths of characters with self-explanatory dialogue. As John Carpenter said, “Movies are about making mental things physical.”

为了开始描写主人公内心的巨大变化，霍顿·福特在《温柔的怜悯》的开头就以斯莱奇沉溺于无意义的生活为开端。他用酒精慢慢自杀，因为他不再相信任何东西——无论是家庭、工作、这个世界还是来世。随着电影的推进，福特避免了从伟大的爱情、辉煌的成功或宗教灵感等压倒性的经历中寻找意义的陈词滥调。相反，他向我们展示了一个男人用爱、音乐和精神等许多微妙的线索编织出简单而有意义的生活。最后，斯莱奇经历了一次安静的转变，找到了值得过的生活。

To begin the great sweep of change within his protagonist, Horton Foote opens TENDER MERCIES with Sledge drowning in the meaninglessness of his life. He is committing slow suicide with alcohol because he no longer believes in anything—neither family, nor work, nor this world, nor the hereafter. As Foote progresses the film, he avoids the cliché of finding meaning in one overwhelming experience of great romance, brilliant success, or religious inspiration. Instead he shows us a man weaving together a simple yet meaningful life from the many delicate threads of love, music, and spirit. At last Sledge undergoes a quiet transformation and finds a life worth living.

我们只能想象霍顿·福特为策划这部岌岌可危的电影付出了多少汗水和心血。一个小小的失误——一个缺失的场景、一个多余的场景、事件顺序的轻微错误——就像一座纸牌城堡，麦克·斯莱奇引人入胜的内心旅程就崩塌成了一幅肖像画。因此，情节并不意味着笨拙的曲折，或高压悬念和令人震惊的惊喜。相反，必须选择事件并随着时间的推移展示它们的模式。从这种构图或设计的意义上讲，所有故事都是有情节的。

We can only imagine the sweat and pains Horton Foote invested in plotting this precarious film. A single misstep—one missing scene, one superfluous scene, a slight misordering of incident—and like a castle of cards, the riveting inner journey of Mac Sledge collapses into portraiture. Plot, therefore, doesn’t mean ham-handed twists and turns, or high-pressure suspense and shocking surprise. Rather, events must be selected and their patterning displayed through time. In this sense of composition or design, all stories are plotted.

大情节、小情节、反情节

Archplot, Miniplot, Antiplot

尽管事件设计的变化数不胜数，但它们并非没有限制。艺术的各个角落形成了一个形式可能性的三角形，映射了故事的世界。这个三角形内是作家的宇宙观、他们对现实的众多看法以及他们在现实中的生活。要了解你在这个宇宙中的位置，请研究这张地图的坐标，将它们与你正在进行的工作进行比较，并让它们引导你到达与有类似愿景的其他作家共享的那个点。

Although the variations of event design are innumerable, they are not without limits. The far corners of the art create a triangle of formal possibilities that maps the universe of stories. Within this triangle is the totality of writers’ cosmologies, all their multitudinous visions of reality and how life is lived within it. To understand your place in this universe, study the coordinates of this map, compare them to your work-in-progress, and let them guide you to that point you share with other writers of a similar vision.

故事三角的顶部是构成经典设计的原则。这些原则是真正意义上的“经典”：永恒而跨文化，是地球上每个社会（无论是文明社会还是原始社会）的基础，通过数千年的口头讲述追溯到时间的阴影。4000 年前，当史诗《吉尔伽美什》以楔形文字刻在十二块泥板上时，首次将故事转化为书面文字，古典设计的原则已经完全而优美地存在了。

At the top of the story triangle are the principles that constitute Classical Design. These principles are “classical” in the truest sense: timeless and transcultural, fundamental to every earthly society, civilized and primitive, reaching back through millennia of oral storytelling into the shadows of time. When the epic Gilgamesh was carved in cuneiform on twelve clay tablets 4,000 years ago, converting story to the written word for the first time the principles of Classical Design were already fully and beautifully in place.

古典设计是指围绕一个积极的主角展开的故事，主角主要与外部的对抗力量作斗争，追求自己的愿望，穿越连续的时间，在一致且因果相连的虚构现实中，到达绝对、不可逆转的变化的封闭结局。

CLASSICAL DESIGN means a story built around an active protagonist who struggles against primarily external forces of antagonism to pursue his or her desire, through continuous time, within a consistent and causally connected fictional reality, to a closed ending of absolute, irreversible change.

我将这组永恒原则称为“大情节” (Archplot)：Arch（发音为“ark”，如同大天使 (archangel) 中的“ark”），字典中的意思是“优于同类事物”。

This collection of timeless principles I call the Archplot: Arch (pronounced “ark” as in archangel) in the dictionary sense of “eminent above others of the same kind.”

然而，大情节并不是叙事形态的极限。在左上角，我列出了所有极简主义的例子。顾名思义，极简主义意味着作家从经典设计的元素开始，然后减少它们——缩小或压缩、修剪或截断大情节的突出特征。我将这组极简主义变体称为迷你情节。迷你情节并不意味着没有情节，因为它的故事必须像大情节一样精美。相反，极简主义力求简单和经济，同时保留足够的经典元素，使电影仍然能够让观众满意，让他们走出电影院时会想：“真是个好故事！”

The Archplot, however, is not the limit of storytelling shapes. In the left corner, I place all examples of minimalism. As the word suggests, minimalism means that the writer begins with the elements of Classical Design but then reduces them—shrinking or compressing, trimming or truncating the prominent features of the Archplot. I call this set of minimalist variations Miniplot. Miniplot does not mean no plot, for its story must be as beautifully executed as an Archplot. Rather, minimalism strives for simplicity and economy while retaining enough of the classical that the film will still satisfy the audience, sending them out of the cinema thinking, “What a good story!”

右上角是反情节，这是反小说或新小说和荒诞派戏剧的电影对应物。这组反结构变体不会降低古典主义，而是将其颠倒过来，与传统形式相矛盾，加以利用，或许还嘲笑形式原则的概念本身。反情节制作者很少对低调或安静的朴素感兴趣；相反，为了明确他的“革命”野心，他的电影倾向于奢华和有意识的夸张。

In the right corner is Antiplot, the cinema counterpart to the antinovel or Nouveau Roman and Theatre of the Absurd. This set of antistructure variations doesn’t reduce the Classical but reverses it, contradicting traditional forms to exploit, perhaps ridicule the very idea of formal principles. The Antiplot-maker is rarely interested in understatement or quiet austerity; rather, to make clear his “revolutionary” ambitions, his films tend toward extravagance and self-conscious overstatement.

大情节是世界电影的灵魂。在过去一百年里，它影响了绝大多数受到国际观众喜爱的电影。如果我们回顾一下这几十年——《火车大劫案》（美国/1904 年）、《庞贝末日》（意大利/1913 年）、《博士的内阁》。 《卡里加利》（德国/1920 年）、《贪婪》（美国/1924 年）、《战舰波将金号》（苏联/1925 年）、《M》（德国/1931 年）、《高顶礼帽》（美国/1935 年）、《大幻觉》（法国/1937 年）、《育婴奇谭》（美国/1938 年）、《公民凯恩》（美国/1941 年）、《相见恨晚》（英国/1945 年）、《七武士》（日本/1954 年）、《马丁》（美国/1955 年）、《第七封印》（瑞典/1957 年）、《骗子》（美国/1961 年）、《2001：太空漫游》（美国/1968 年）、《教父（下）》（美国/1974 年）、《弗洛尔小姐和她的两个丈夫》 （巴西/1978）、《一条叫旺达的鱼》（英国/1988）、《飞越未来》（美国/1988）、《菊豆》（中国/1990）、《末路狂花》（美国/1991）、《四个婚礼和一个葬礼》（英国/1994）、《闪亮的风采》（澳大利亚/1996）——我们瞥见了大情节所包含的惊人的故事多样性。

The Archplot is the meat, potatoes, pasta, rice, and couscous of world cinema. For the past one hundred years it has informed the vast majority of films that have found an international audience. If we skim through the decades—THE GREAT TRAIN ROBBERY (USA/1904), THE LAST DAYS OF POMPEII (Italy/1913), THE CABINET OF DR. CALIGARI (Germany/1920), GREED (USA/1924), THE BATTLESHIP POTEMKIN (USSR/1925), M (Germany/1931), TOP HAT (USA/1935), LA GRANDE ILLUSION (France/1937), BRINGING UP BABY (USA/1938), CITIZEN KANE (USA/1941), BRIEF ENCOUNTER (UK/1945), THE SEVEN SAMURAI (Japan/1954), MARTY (USA/1955), THE SEVENTH SEAL (Sweden/1957), THE HUSTLER (USA/1961), 2001: A SPACE ODYSSEY (USA/1968), THE GODFATHER, PART II (USA/1974), DONA FLOR AND HER TWO HUSBANDS (Brazil/1978), A FISH CALLED WANDA (UK/1988), BIG (USA/1988), JU DOU (China/1990), THELMA & LOUISE (USA/1991), FOUR WEDDINGS AND A FUNERAL (UK/1994), SHINE (Australia/1996)—we glimpse the staggering variety of story embraced within the Archplot.

小情节虽然种类较少，但同样具有国际性：《北方的纳努克》（美国/1922 年）、《圣女贞德受难记》（法国/1928 年）、《行为零点》（法国/1953 年）、《战火》（意大利/1946 年）、《野草莓》（瑞典/1957 年）、《音乐室》（印度/1964 年）、《红色沙漠》（意大利/1964 年）、《五首歌谣》（美国/1970 年）、《克莱尔的膝盖》（法国/1970 年）、《感官世界》（日本/1976 年）、《温柔的怜悯》（美国/1983 年）、《德克萨斯巴黎》（西德/法国/1984 年）、《牺牲》（瑞典/法国/1986 年）、《征服者佩尔》 （丹麦/1987）、《偷来的小孩》（意大利/1992）、《大河恋》（美国/1993）、《活着》（中国/1994）和《我们跳舞吧》（日本/1997）。小情节还包括叙事纪录片，例如《福利》（美国/1975）。

Miniplot, though less various, is equally international: NANOOK OF THE NORTH (USA/1922), LA PASSION DE JEANNE D’ARC (France/1928), ZERO DE CONDUITE (France/1953), PAISAN (Italy/1946), WILD STRAWBERRIES (Sweden/1957), THE MUSIC ROOM (India/1964), THE RED DESERT (Italy/1964), FIVE EASY PIECES (USA/1970), CLAIRE’S KNEE (France/1970), IN THE REALM OF THE SENSES (Japan/1976), TENDER MERCIES (USA/1983), PARIS, TEXAS (West Germany/France/1984), THE SACRIFICE (Sweden/France/1986), PELLE THE CONQUEROR (Denmark/1987), STOLEN CHILDREN (Italy/1992), A RIVER RUNS THROUGH IT (USA/1993), TO LIVE (China/1994), and SHALL WE DANCE (Japan/1997). Miniplot also embraces narrative documentaries such as WELFARE (USA/1975).

反情节的例子并不常见，主要出现在欧洲和二战后：《一条安达鲁狗》（法国/1928 年）、《诗人之血》（法国/1932 年）、《午后的迷惘》（美国/1943 年）、《奔跑、跳跃和静止的电影》（英国/1959 年）、《去年在马里昂巴德》（法国/1960 年）、《81/2》（意大利/1963 年）、《假面》（瑞典/1966 年）、《周末》（法国/1967 年）、《绞刑》（日本/1968 年）、《小丑》（意大利/1970 年）、《巨蟒与圣杯》（英国/1975 年）、《那朦胧的欲望对象》（法国/西班牙/1977 年）、《不合时宜》 （英国/1980）、《天堂奇缘》（美国/1984）、《不夜城》（美国/1985）、《A ZED & TWO NOUGHTS》（英国/荷兰/1985）、《韦恩的世界》（美国/1993）、《重庆森林》（香港/1994）、《迷失公路》（美国/1997）。反情节还包括纪录片兼拼贴片，如阿伦·雷乃的《夜与雾》（法国/1955）和《失落的大陆》（美国/1983）。

Examples of Antiplot are less common, predominantly European, and post-World War II: UN CHIEN ANDALOU (France/1928), BLOOD OF THE POET (France/1932), MESHES OF THE AFTERNOON (USA/1943), THE RUNNING, JUMPING AND STANDING STILL FILM (UK/1959), LAST YEAR AT MARIENBAD (France/1960), 81/2 (Italy/1963), PERSONA (Sweden/1966), WEEKEND (France/1967), DEATH BY HANGING (Japan/1968), CLOWNS (Italy/1970), MONTY PYTHON AND THE HOLY GRAIL (UK/1975), THAT OBSCURE OBJECT OF DESIRE (France/Spain/1977), BAD TIMING (UK/1980), STRANGER THAN PARADISE (USA/1984), AFTER HOURS (USA/1985), A ZED & TWO NOUGHTS (UK/ Netherlands/1985), WAYNE’S WORLD (USA/1993), CHUNGKING EXPRESS (Hong Kong/1994), LOST HIGHWAY (USA/1997). Antiplot also includes the documentary-cum-collage such as Alain Resnais’s NIGHT AND FOG (France/1955) and KOYAANISQATSI (USA/1983).

故事三角内的正式差异

FORMAL DIFFERENCES WITHIN THE STORY TRIANGLE

封闭结局与开放式结局

Closed Versus Open Endings

大情节结局是封闭的——故事提出的所有问题都得到了回答；所有引发的情感都得到了满足。观众留下的是圆满、封闭的体验——没有任何疑问，没有任何不满足。

The Archplot delivers a closed ending—all questions raised by the story are answered; all emotions evoked are satisfied. The audience leaves with a rounded, closed experience—nothing in doubt, nothing unsated.

另一方面，小情节往往让结局有些悬而未决。大部分由讲述引发的问题都得到了解答，但电影中可能留下一两个未解答的问题，让观众在观看后提出这些问题。电影引起的大部分情感都会得到满足，但可能会留下一些情感残留，让观众去满足。虽然小情节可能以思想和情感的问号结束，但“开放”并不意味着电影在中间结束，让一切都悬而未决。问题必须是可以回答的，情感是可以解决的。之前发生的一切导致了明确而有限的替代方案，从而使得一定程度的结局成为可能。

Miniplot, on the other hand, often leaves the ending somewhat open. Most of the questions raised by the telling are answered, but an unanswered question or two may trail out of the film, leaving the audience to supply it subsequent to the viewing. Most of the emotion evoked by the film will be satisfied, but an emotional residue may be left for the audience to satisfy. Although Miniplot may end on a question mark of thought and feeling, “open” doesn’t mean the film quits in the middle, leaving everything hanging. The question must be answerable, the emotion resolvable. All that has gone before leads to clear and limited alternatives that make a degree of closure possible.

故事高潮是绝对的、不可逆转的变化，它回答了讲述过程中提出的所有问题，并满足了观众的所有情感，这就是封闭式结局。

A Story Climax of absolute, irreversible change that answers all questions raised by the telling and satisfies all audience emotion is a CLOSED ENDING.

故事高潮时如果留下一两个问题没有得到解答，一些情感也没有得到满足，那么这就是开放式结局。

A Story Climax that leaves a question or two unanswered and some emotion unfulfilled is an OPEN ENDING.

在《得克萨斯州巴黎》的高潮部分，父子和好如初；他们的未来已定，我们对他们幸福的期望也得到了满足。但丈夫/妻子、母亲/儿子的关系却没有得到解决。“这个家庭会有共同的未来吗？如果有，那会是什么样的未来？”这些问题尚未解决。答案可以在观影后的私下思考中找到：如果你希望这个家庭团聚，但你的内心告诉你他们不会成功，那么这将是一个悲伤的夜晚。如果你能说服自己他们会从此过上幸福的生活，你就会心满意足地离开。这位极简主义的讲故事者故意将这最后的关键部分交给观众。

At the climax of PARIS, TEXAS father and son are reconciled; their future is set and our hope for their happiness satisfied. But the husband/wife, mother/son relationships are left unresolved. The questions “Will this family have a future together? If so, what kind of future will it be?” are open. The answers will be found in the privacy of postfilm thoughts: If you want this family to get together, but your heart tells you they aren’t going to make it, it’s a sad evening. If you can convince yourself that they will live happily ever after, you walk out pleased. The minimalist storyteller deliberately gives this last critical bit of work to the audience.

外部冲突与内部冲突

External Versus Internal Conflict

大情节强调外部冲突。虽然人物往往有强烈的内心冲突，但重点在于他们的与个人关系、社会制度或物质世界力量的斗争。在小情节中，相反，主人公可能与家庭、社会和环境有强烈的外部冲突，但重点将落在他自己思想和感情中的斗争上，无论是有意识的还是无意识的。

The Archplot puts emphasis on external conflict. Although characters often have strong inner conflicts, the emphasis falls on their struggles with personal relationships, with social institutions, or with forces in the physical world. In Miniplot, to the contrary, the protagonist may have strong external conflicts with family, society, and environment, but emphasis will fall on the battles within his own thoughts and feelings, conscious or unconscious.

比较一下《公路战士》和《意外的旅客》中主人公的旅程。在前者中，梅尔·吉布森饰演的疯狂麦克斯经历了从自给自足的孤独者到自我牺牲的英雄的内心转变，但故事的重点在于家族的生存。在后者中，威廉·赫特饰演的旅行作家的生活随着他再婚并成为一个孤独男孩急需的父亲而发生了变化，但电影的重点在于这个男人精神的复活。他从一个情感麻痹的人转变为一个可以自由去爱和感受的人，这是电影中主要的变化弧线。

Compare the journeys of the protagonists in THE ROAD WARRIOR and THE ACCIDENTAL TOURIST. In the former, Mel Gibson’s Mad Max undergoes an inner transformation from self-sufficient loner to self-sacrificing hero, but the emphasis of the story falls on the survival of the clan. In the latter, the life of William Hurt’s travel writer changes as he remarries and becomes the much-needed father to a lonely boy, but the emphasis of the film falls on the resurrection of this man’s spirit. His transformation from a man suffering a paralysis of emotions to a man free to love and feel is the film’s dominant arc of change.

单一主角与多主角

Single Versus Multiple Protagonists

经典故事通常以一个主角（男人、女人或孩子）为故事的核心。一个主要故事占据了银幕时间，主角是主角。然而，如果编剧将电影分成几个相对较小的、次要情节的故事，每个故事都有一个单独的主角，结果就会最大限度地减少大情节的过山车动态，并创造出自 1980 年代以来越来越受欢迎的小情节的多情节变体。

The classically told story usually places a single protagonist—man, woman, or child—at the heart of the telling. One major story dominates screentime and its protagonist is the star role. However, if the writer splinters the film into a number of relatively small, subplot-sized stories, each with a separate protagonist, the result minimalizes the roller-coaster dynamic of the Archplot and creates the Multiplot variation of Miniplot that’s grown in popularity since the 1980s.

在《亡命天涯》充满张力的大情节中，镜头始终聚焦哈里森·福特的主角：没有斜视，甚至没有暗示任何次要情节。另一方面，《为人父母》则由六位主角的六个故事组成。就像大情节一样，这六个角色的冲突主要是外部冲突；他们中没有一个人像《意外的游客》一样遭受了深刻的痛苦和内心的改变。但是，由于这些家庭斗争将我们的感情引向了如此多的方向，而且每个故事的屏幕时间只有短短的十五到二十分钟，因此它们的多重设计软化了讲述的力度。

In THE FUGITIVE’s highly charged Archplot the camera never loses sight of Harrison Ford’s protagonist: no glances sideways, not even a hint of a subplot. PARENTHOOD, on the other hand, is a tempered weave of no fewer than six tales of six protagonists. As in an Archplot, the conflicts of these six characters are predominantly external; none of them undergoes the deep suffering and inner change of THE ACCIDENTAL TOURIST. But because these family battles draw our feelings in so many directions and because each story receives a brief fifteen or twenty minutes of screentime, their multiple design softens the telling.

多情节电影起源于《党同伐异》（美国/1916 年）、《大饭店》（美国/1932 年）、《透过玻璃看黑暗》（瑞典/1961 年）和《愚人船》（美国/1965 年），一直到如今的常见电影——《捷径》、《低俗小说》、《为所应为》和《饮食男女》。

The Multiplot dates from INTOLERANCE (USA/1916), GRAND HOTEL (USA/1932), THROUGH A GLASS DARKLY (Sweden/1961), and SHIP OF FOOLS (USA/1965) to its common use today—SHORT CUTS, PULP FICTION, DO THE RIGHT THING, and EAT DRINK MAN WOMAN.

主动与被动主角

Active Versus Passive Protagonist

大情节的单一主角往往是活跃和动态的，通过不断升级的冲突和变化来任性地追求欲望。小情节设计的主角虽然不是惰性的，但相对来说是反应性和被动的。通常，这种被动性的补偿要么是赋予主角强烈的内心斗争，如《意外的旅客》中那样，要么是让主角周围充满戏剧性事件，如《征服者佩尔》中的多情节设计。

The single protagonist of an Archplot tends to be active and dynamic, willfully pursuing desire through ever-escalating conflict and change. The protagonist of a Miniplot design, although not inert, is relatively reactive and passive. Generally this passivity is compensated for either by giving the protagonist a powerful inner struggle as in THE ACCIDENTAL TOURIST or by surrounding him with dramatic events as in the Multiplot design of PELLE THE CONQUEROR.

积极的主角为了追求欲望，会采取与周围的人和世界直接冲突的行动。

An ACTIVE PROTAGONIST, in the pursuit of desire, takes action in direct conflict with the people and the world around him.

被动主角外表不活跃，内心却追求欲望，与其自身天性的某些方面相冲突。

A PASSIVE PROTAGONIST is outwardly inactive while pursuing desire inwardly, in conflict with aspects of his or her own nature.

《征服者佩尔》的主角是一个被成人世界控制的青少年，因此别无选择，只能被动应对。然而，作家比利·奥古斯特利用佩尔的疏离感，让他成为周围悲剧故事的被动观察者：不正当的情人杀婴，女人因通奸而阉割丈夫，工人起义的领袖被打成白痴。由于奥古斯特从孩子的角度控制叙事，这些暴力事件被置于屏幕外或远处，因此我们很少看到原因，而只能看到后果。这种设计软化或最小化了原本可能夸张甚至令人反感的内容。

The title character of PELLE THE CONQUEROR is an adolescent under the control of the adult world and therefore has little choice but to be reactive. Writer Bille August, however, takes advantage of Pelle’s alienation to make him the passive observer of tragic stories around him: Illicit lovers commit infanticide, a woman castrates her husband for adultery, the leader of a workers’ revolt is bludgeoned into a cretin. Because August controls the telling from the child’s point of view, these violent events are kept offscreen or at a distance, so that we rarely see the cause, only the aftermath. The design softens or minimalizes what could have been melodramatic, even distasteful.

线性与非线性时间

Linear Versus Nonlinear Time

大情节始于某个时间点，在或多或少连续的时间中省略地移动，并在稍后的某个日期结束。如果使用倒叙，则处理方式是让观众能够按时间顺序排列故事中的事件。另一方面，反情节通常是不连贯的，打乱或分割时间，使人们很难甚至不可能将发生的事情按任何线性顺序排列。戈达尔曾经说过，在他的美学中，一部电影必须有开头、中间和结尾……但不一定按这个顺序。

An Archplot begins at a certain point in time, moves elliptically through more or less continuous time, and ends at a later date. If flashbacks are used, they are handled so that the audience can place the story’s events in their temporal order. An antiplot, on the other hand, is often disjunctive, scrambling or fragmenting time to make it difficult, if not impossible, to sort what happened into any linear sequence. Godard once remarked that in his aesthetic a film must have a beginning, middle, and end … but not necessarily in that order.

无论是否有倒叙，只要按照观众可以跟踪的事件时间顺序排列，故事都是以线性时间讲述的。

A story with or without flashbacks and arranged into a temporal order of events that the audience can follow is told in LINEAR TIME.

故事要么杂乱无章地跨越时间，要么模糊时间连续性，使观众无法理清在“非线性时间”中讲述的内容之前和之后发生的事情。

A story that either skips helter-skelter through time or so blurs temporal continuity that the audience cannot sort out what happens before and after what is told in NONLINEAR TIME.

在恰如其名的反情节电影《坏时机》中，一位心理分析师（亚特·加芬克尔饰）在奥地利度假时遇到了一位女士（特蕾莎·拉塞尔饰）。影片的前三分之一包含的场景似乎来自这段恋情的早期阶段，但在这些场景之间闪进，跳转到了这段恋情的中期和后期阶段。影片的中间三分之一散布着我们认为是中期阶段的场景，但穿插着闪回开头和闪进结尾的场景。最后三分之一主要是一些似乎来自这对情侣最后几天的场景，但这些场景与闪回中间和开头的场景交织在一起。影片以恋尸癖结束。

In the aptly titled Antiplot BAD TIMING a psychoanalyst (Art Garfunkel) meets a woman (Theresa Russell) while vacationing in Austria. The first third of the film contains scenes that seem to come from the early going of the affair, but between them flash-forwards leap to scenes from the relationship’s middle and late stages. The center third of the film is spattered with scenes that we assume are from their middle period, but interspersed with flashbacks to the beginning and flash-forwards to the end. The last third is dominated by scenes that seem to come from the couple’s final days but are spliced with flashbacks to middle and beginning. The film ends on an act of necrophilia.

《不合时宜》是对“性格即命运”这一古老观念的现代诠释——你的命运等于你是谁，你生命的最终结果将由你独特的性格决定，而不是其他——不是家庭，社会、环境或机会。《坏时机》的反结构设计将时间像沙拉一样搅乱，将人物与周围的世界分开。他们一个周末去萨尔茨堡还是下一个周末去维也纳；他们在这里吃午饭还是在那里吃晚饭；为这事吵架还是不吵架，这有什么区别？重要的是他们性格中的毒药。这对情侣一见面就踏上了通往悲惨命运的子弹列车。

BAD TIMING is a contemporary reworking of the ancient idea of “character as destiny”—the notion that your fate equals who you are, that the final consequences of your life will be determined by the unique nature of your character and nothing else—not family, society, environment, or chance. By tossing time like a salad, BAD TIMING’s antistructure design disconnects the characters from the world around them. What difference does it make whether they went to Salzburg one weekend or Vienna the next; whether they had lunch here or dinner there; quarreled over this or that or didn’t? What matters is the poisonous alchemy of their personalities. The moment this couple met they stepped on a bullet train to their grotesque fate.

因果关系与巧合

Causality Versus Coincidence

大情节强调世界上的事情是如何发生的，一个原因如何产生一个结果，这个结果如何变成一个原因，进而引发另一个结果。经典的故事设计描绘了生活中从显而易见到难以理解、从亲密到史诗、从个人身份到国际信息圈的广泛相互联系。它揭示了连锁因果关系的网络，一旦理解了这些因果关系，生活就会变得有意义。另一方面，反情节经常用巧合代替因果关系，强调宇宙中事物的随机碰撞，这些碰撞打破了因果关系的链条，导致分裂、无意义和荒谬。

The Archplot stresses how things happen in the world, how a cause creates an effect, how this effect becomes a cause that triggers yet another effect. Classical story design charts the vast interconnectedness of life from the obvious to the impenetrable, from the intimate to the epic, from individual identity to the international infosphere. It lays bare the network of chain-linked causalities that, when understood, gives life meaning. The Antiplot, on the other hand, often substitutes coincidence for causality, putting emphasis on the random collisions of things in the universe that break the chains of causality and lead to fragmentation, meaninglessness, and absurdity.

因果关系推动着故事的发展，在故事中，有动机的行为会导致一些结果，而这些结果又会成为其他结果的原因，从而将各个层次的冲突通过连锁反应联系在一起，达到故事的高潮，表达了现实的相互联系。

CAUSALITY drives a story in which motivated actions cause effects that in turn become the causes of yet other effects, thereby interlinking the various levels of conflict in a chain reaction of episodes to the Story Climax, expressing the interconnectedness of reality.

“巧合”驱动着一个虚构的世界，在这个世界里，无动机的行为会引发不会造成进一步影响的事件，因此将故事分割成不同的情节和开放式的结局，表达了存在的脱节性。

COINCIDENCE drives a fictional world in which unmotivated actions trigger events that do not cause further effects, and therefore fragment the story into divergent episodes and an open ending, expressing the disconnectedness of existence.

在《下班后》中，一位年轻男子（格里芬·邓恩饰）与他在曼哈顿一家咖啡店偶然遇到的一位女士约会。在去她位于 Soho 的公寓的路上，他身上的最后二十美元被从出租车窗户里吹了出去。然后他似乎在她阁楼里发现了他的钱被钉在一座正在制作的奇怪雕像上。他的约会对象突然实施了一次精心策划的自杀。他被困在 Soho 区，没有钱坐地铁，被一群自发组织暴徒误认为是小偷，并被追捕。疯子和满溢的马桶挡住了他的逃跑路线，直到他藏在一座雕像里，被真正的小偷偷走，最后从他们的逃跑卡车上掉了下来，摔在他工作的大楼的台阶上，正好赶上他去处理文字处理器的一天。他是上帝桌上的一颗台球，随意地弹来弹去，直到他落入口袋。

In AFTER HOURS a young man (Griffin Dunne) makes a date with a woman he meets by chance in a Manhattan coffee shop. On the trip to her Soho apartment his last twenty bucks is blown out the taxi window. He then seems to find his money stapled to a bizarre statue-in-progress in her loft. His date suddenly commits a well-planned suicide. Trapped in Soho without money for the subway, he’s mistaken for a burglar and hunted by a vigilante mob. Lunatic characters and an overflowing toilet block his escape, until he’s hidden inside a statue, stolen by real burglars, and finally falls out of their getaway truck, smack onto the steps of the building where he works, right on time for his day at the word processor. He’s a pool ball on the table of God, randomly bouncing around until he drops into a pocket.

一致与不一致的现实

Consistent Versus Inconsistent Realities

故事是生活的隐喻。它让我们超越事实，直达本质。因此，将现实的一对一标准应用于故事是错误的。我们创造的世界遵循其自身的因果关系规则。大情节在一致的现实中展开……但在这种情况下，现实并不意味着事实。即使是最自然的“生活如实”小情节也是一种抽象而稀薄的存在。每个虚构的现实都独特地确定了其中发生的事情。在大情节中，这些规则是不能被打破的——即使它们很奇怪。

Story is a metaphor for life. It takes us beyond the factual to the essential. Therefore, it’s a mistake to apply a one-for-one standard from reality to story. The worlds we create obey their own internal rules of causality. An Archplot unfolds within a consistent reality … but reality, in this case, doesn’t mean actuality. Even the most naturalistic, “life as lived” Miniplot is an abstracted and rarefied existence. Each fictional reality uniquely establishes how things happen within it. In an Archplot these rules cannot be broken—even if they are bizarre.

一致的现实是虚构的设定，它建立了人物和他们所处世界之间的互动模式，并在整个讲述过程中保持一致，以创造意义。

CONSISTENT REALITIES are fictional settings that establish modes of interaction between characters and their world that are kept consistently throughout the telling to create meaning.

例如，几乎所有奇幻类作品都是大情节，严格遵守“现实”的奇思妙想规则。假设在《谁陷害了兔子罗杰》中，一个人类角色追赶卡通人物罗杰，把他逼向一扇锁着的门。突然，罗杰变成了二维平面，滑到窗台下，逃走了。人类猛地撞上门，没事。但现在这成了一个故事规则：没有人能抓住罗杰，因为他可以切换到二维空间并逃脱。如果作者想让罗杰陷入未来的场景中，他就必须设计一个非人类特工或回头重写之前的追逐。在创建了因果关系的故事规则后，大情节的作者必须在他自己创造的纪律内工作。因此，一致的现实意味着一个内部一致的、忠于自身的世界。

Virtually all works in the Fantasy genre, for example, are Archplots in which whimsical rules of “reality” are strictly obeyed. Suppose that in WHO FRAMED ROGER RABBIT a human character were to chase Roger, a cartoon character, toward a locked door. Suddenly Roger flattens into two dimensions, slides under the sill, and escapes. The human slams into the door, Fine. But now this becomes a story rule: No human can catch Roger because he can switch to two dimensions and escape. Should the writer want Roger caught in a future scene, he would have to devise a nonhuman agent or go back to rewrite the previous chase. Having created story rules of causality, the writer of an Archplot must work within his self-created discipline. Consistent Reality, therefore, means an internally consistent world, true to itself.

不一致的现实是指混合了各种互动模式的设定，使得故事情节从一个“现实”不一致地跳转到另一个“现实”，从而产生一种荒诞感。

INCONSISTENT REALITIES are settings that mix modes of interaction so that the story’s episodes jump inconsistently from one “reality” to another to create a sense of absurdity.

然而，在反情节中，唯一的规则就是打破规则：在让-吕克·戈达尔的《周末》中，一对巴黎夫妇决定谋杀一位年迈的姑姑，以骗取她的保险金。在去姑姑乡间别墅的路上，一场事故毁掉了他们的红色跑车，这场事故更像是幻觉，而不是真实。后来，当这对夫妇沿着一条美丽的林荫小路跋涉时，艾米莉·勃朗特突然出现，她从十九世纪的英国被带到了二十世纪的法国小路上，正在读她的小说《呼啸山庄》。巴黎人一见到艾米莉就恨之入骨，掏出 Zippo 打火机，点燃了她的裙撑裙，把她烧得焦黑……然后继续走。

In an Antiplot, however, the only rule is to break rules: In Jean-Luc Godard’s WEEKEND a Parisian couple decides to murder an elderly aunt for her insurance money. On the way to the aunt’s country home an accident, more hallucinatory than real, destroys their red sports car. Later, as the couple trudges on foot down a lovely shaded lane, Emily Bronte suddenly appears, plucked out of nineteenth-century England and dropped onto a twentieth-century French path, reading her novel Wuthering Heights. The Parisians hate Emily on sight, whip out a Zippo lighter, set her crinoline skirts on fire, burn her to a crisp … and walk on.

这是对古典文学的侮辱？也许吧，但不会再发生了。这不是一部穿越电影。没有其他人从过去或未来出现；只有艾米丽；只有一次。这是一条注定要被打破的规则。

A slap in the face for classical literature? Perhaps, but it doesn’t happen again. This isn’t a time-travel movie. Nobody else shows up out of the past or future; just Emily; just once. A rule made to be broken.

颠覆大情节的愿望始于本世纪初。奥古斯特·斯特林堡、恩斯特·托勒、弗吉尼亚·伍尔夫、詹姆斯·乔伊斯、塞缪尔·贝克特和威廉·S·巴勒斯等作家都认为有必要切断艺术家与外部现实之间的联系，从而切断艺术家与大部分观众之间的联系。表现主义、达达主义、超现实主义、意识流、荒诞派戏剧、反小说和电影反结构可能在技巧上有所不同，但结果却相同：退回到艺术家的私人世界，观众是否进入由艺术家决定。在这些世界中，不仅有事件发生，还有事件发生。非时间性的、巧合的、支离破碎的、混乱的，但人物的心理特征并不明显。他们既不理智也不疯狂，要么故意前后矛盾，要么过于象征化。

The desire to turn the Archplot on its head began early in this century. Writers such as August Strindberg, Ernst Toller, Virginia Woolf, James Joyce, Samuel Beckett, and William S. Burroughs felt the need to sever the links between the artist and external reality, and with it, between the artist and the greater part of the audience. Expressionism, Dadaism, Surrealism, Stream of Consciousness, Theatre of the Absurd, the antinovel, and cinematic antistructure may differ in technique but share the same result: a retreat inside the artist’s private world to which the audience is admitted at the artist’s discretion. These are worlds in which not only are events atemporal, coincidental, fragmented, and chaotic, but characters do not operate within a recognizable psychology. Neither sane nor insane, they are either deliberately inconsistent or overtly symbolic.

这种模式的电影不是“生活本身”的隐喻，而是“思考生活”的隐喻。它们反映的不是现实，而是电影制作人的唯我论，从而将故事设计的极限延伸到说教和观念结构。然而，像《周末》这样的反情节的不一致现实具有某种统一性。如果做得好，它会被认为是电影制作人主观心理状态的表达。这种单一感知的感觉，无论多么不连贯，都能让愿意冒险进入其扭曲的观众将作品凝聚在一起。

Films in this mode are not metaphors for “life as lived,” but for “life as thought about.” They reflect not reality, but the solipsism of the filmmaker, and in doing so, stretch the limits of story design toward didactic and ideational structures. However, the inconsistent reality of an Antiplot such as WEEKEND has a unity of sorts. When done well, it’s felt to be an expression of the subjective state of mind of the filmmaker. This sense of a single perception, no matter how incoherent, holds the work together for audiences willing to venture into its distortions.

上面列出的七种形式矛盾和对比并非一成不变。开放/封闭、被动/主动、一致/不一致的现实等都有无限的层次和程度。所有讲故事的可能性都分布在故事设计三角形内，但很少有电影的形式如此纯粹，以至于它们都停留在三角形的两端。三角形的每一边都是结构选择的光谱，作家们沿着这些线滑动他们的故事，融合或借鉴每个极端。

The seven formal contradictions and contrasts listed above are not hard and fast. There are unlimited shades and degrees of open-ness/closedness, passivity/activity, consistent/inconsistent reality, and the like. All storytelling possibilities are distributed inside the story design triangle, but very few films are of such purity of form that they settle at its extreme corners. Each side of the triangle is a spectrum of structural choices, and writers slide their stories along these lines, blending or borrowing from each extreme.

《神奇的面包师男孩》和《哭泣的游戏》介于大情节和小情节之间。这两部电影都讲述了一个相当被动的孤立者的故事；两部电影的结局都悬而未决，因为次要情节的爱情故事的未来没有答案。这两部电影的设计都不像《唐人街》或《七武士》那样经典，也不像《五件轻松的事》或《青木瓜的香味》那样简约。

THE FABULOUS BAKER BOYS and THE CRYING GAME fall halfway between Archplot and Miniplot. Each tells the tale of a rather passive isolate; each leaves its ending open as the future of the subplot’s love story goes unanswered. Neither is as classically designed as CHINATOWN or THE SEVEN SAMURAI, nor as minimalistic as FIVE EASY PIECES or THE SCENT OF GREEN PAPAYA.

多情节电影也并非经典之作，而是极简主义。罗伯特·奥特曼是这种形式的大师，他的作品涵盖了各种可能性。多情节作品可能是“硬”的，倾向于大情节，因为个别故事经常以强烈的外部后果为转折（《纳什维尔》），也可能是“软”的，倾向于小情节，因为情节线节奏缓慢，行动变得内化（《三个女人》）。

Multiplot films are also less than classical and more than minimal. The works of Robert Altman, a master of this form, span a spectrum of possibilities. A Multiplot work may be “hard,” tending toward Archplot, as individual stories turn frequently with strong external consequences (NASHVILLE), or “soft,” leaning toward Miniplot, as plot lines slow their pace and action becomes internalized (3 WOMEN).

一部电影可以成为准反情节。例如，当诺拉·艾弗隆和罗伯·莱纳在《当哈利遇见莎莉》中插入伪纪录片场景时，他的电影的整体“真实性”就受到了质疑。纪录片风格的采访中，老年夫妇回顾了他们如何相遇，而这些场景实际上是精心编排的，演员们也以纪录片风格演绎。这些夹在传统爱情故事中的虚假现实，将电影推向了反结构和自我反思讽刺的不一致现实。

A film could be quasi-Antiplot. When, for example, Nora Ephron and Rob Reiner inserted scenes of Mockumentary into WHEN HARRY MET SALLY, his film’s overall “reality” came into question. The documentary-styled interviews of older couples looking back on how they met are in fact delightfully scripted scenes with actors working in a documentary style. These false realities sandwiched inside an otherwise conventional love story pushed the film toward the inconsistent reality of antistructure and self-reflexive satire.

像《巴顿·芬克》这样的电影处于中心位置，汲取了三个极端的特质。它以一位年轻的纽约剧作家（单一主角）的故事开始，他试图在好莱坞崭露头角（与外部力量的积极冲突）——大情节。但芬克（约翰·特托罗饰）变得越来越孤僻，遭受了严重的写作障碍（内心冲突）——小情节。当逐渐发展为幻觉，我们越来越不确定什么是真实的，什么是幻想的（不一致的现实），直到什么都不能相信（破碎的时间和因果顺序）——反情节。结局相当开放，芬克凝视着大海，但可以肯定的是，他再也不会在那个小镇写作了。

A film like BARTON FINK sits at the center, drawing qualities from each of the three extremes. It begins as the story of a young New York playwright (single protagonist) who’s trying to make his mark in Hollywood (active conflict with external forces)—Archplot. But Fink (John Turturro) becomes more and more reclusive and suffers a severe writer’s block (inner conflict)—Miniplot. When that progresses into hallucination, we grow less and less sure of what’s real, what’s fantasy (inconsistent realities), until nothing can be trusted (fractured temporal and causal order)—Antiplot. The ending is rather open, with Fink staring out to sea, but it’s fairly certain he’ll never write in that town again.

变革与停滞

Change Versus Stasis

在小情节和反情节之间的界线之上是生活明显发生变化的故事。然而，在小情节的极限处，变化可能几乎看不见，因为它发生在内心冲突的最深层：丈夫。在反情节的极限处的变化可能会爆发成一个宇宙笑话：《蒙蒂·派森和圣杯》。但在这两种情况下，故事情节和生活都会变好或变坏。

Above the line drawn between Miniplot and Antiplot are stories in which life clearly changes. At the limits of Miniplot, however, change may be virtually invisible because it occurs at the deepest level of inner conflict: HUSBANDS. Change at the limits of Antiplot may explode into a cosmic joke: MONTY PYTHON AND THE HOLY GRAIL. But in both cases stories arc and life changes for better or worse.

低于这条线的故事保持停滞状态，没有弧线。故事结束时人物生活的充满价值的状态影片与开头的影片几乎一模一样。故事融入肖像画，要么是逼真的肖像画，要么是荒诞的肖像画。我将这些电影称为非情节电影。虽然它们告诉我们、触动我们，并且有自己的修辞或形式结构，但它们并没有讲述故事。因此，它们不属于故事三角，而属于一个可以笼统地称为“叙事”的领域。

Below this line stories remain in stasis and do not arc. The value-charged condition of the character’s life at the end of the film is virtually identical to that at the opening. Story dissolves into portraiture, either a portrait of verisimilitude or one of absurdity. I term these films Nonplot. Although they inform us, touch us, and have their own rhetorical or formal structures, they do not tell story. Therefore, they fall outside the story triangle and into a realm that would include everything that could be loosely called “narrative.”

在《UMBERTO D》、《FACES》和《NAKED》等反映现实生活的作品中，我们发现主角过着孤独、烦恼的生活。他们经受着更多的苦难考验，但在影片结尾，他们似乎已经对生活的痛苦认命，甚至准备好承受更多。在《SHORT CUTS》中，个人生活在众多故事情节中发生了改变，但一种没有灵魂的萎靡不振贯穿了整部影片，并渗透到一切事物中，直到谋杀和自杀似乎成为影片中自然而然的一部分。尽管在非情节的世界中什么都没有改变，但我们获得了清醒的洞察力，希望我们内心有所改变。

In slice-of-life works such as UMBERTO D, FACES, and NAKED, we discover protagonists leading lonely, troubled lives. They’re tested by even more suffering, but by the film’s end they seem resigned to the pain of life, even ready for more. In SHORT CUTS, individual lives are altered within its many story lines, but a soulless malaise bookends the film and permeates everything, until murder and suicide seem a natural part of the landscape. Although nothing changes within the universe of a Nonplot, we gain a sobering insight and hopefully something changes within us.

反结构非情节也追踪了一种循环模式，但将其转变为一种超非自然主义风格的荒诞和讽刺。《男性女性》（法国/1966 年）、《资产阶级的谨慎魅力》（法国/1972 年）和《自由幻影》（法国/1974 年）串连了嘲笑资产阶级滑稽动作（性和政治）的场景，但开场场景中的盲目傻瓜在片尾滚动时也同样盲目和愚蠢。

Antistructured Nonplots also trace a circular pattern but turn it with absurdity and satire done in an supra-unnaturalistic style. MASCULINE FEMININE (France/1966), THE DISCREET CHARM OF THE BOURGEOISIE (France/1972), and PHANTOM OF LIBERTY (France/1974) string together scenes that ridicule bourgeois antics, sexual and political, but the blind fools of the opening scenes are just as blind and foolish when the closing titles roll.

故事设计的政治

THE POLITICS OF STORY DESIGN

在理想世界中，艺术和政治永远不会接触。但现实中，它们无法放手。因此，正如所有事物一样，政治潜伏在故事三角中：品味政治、节日和奖项政治，以及最重要的，艺术与商业成功之间的政治。正如所有政治事物一样，真相在极端情况下被扭曲得最严重。我们每个人都在故事三角的某个地方拥有一个自然的地址。危险在于，出于更多是意识形态而非个人原因，你可能会被迫离开家，去一个遥远的角落工作，陷入设计你的故事的陷阱中。心里不相信。但如果你诚实地看待电影中那些常常似是而非的争论，你就不会迷失方向。

In an ideal world art and politics would never touch. In reality they can’t keep their hands off each other. So as in all things, politics lurks inside the story triangle: the politics of taste, the politics of festivals and awards, and, most important, the politics of artistic versus commercial success. And as in all things political, the distortion of truth is greatest at the extremes. Each of us has a natural address some-where on the story triangle. The danger is that for reasons more ideological than personal, you may feel compelled to leave home and work in a distant corner, trapping yourself into designing stories you don’t in your heart believe. But if you take an honest look at film’s often specious polemics, you won’t lose your way.

多年来，电影界的主要政治问题是“好莱坞电影”与“艺术电影”。尽管这些术语似乎有些过时，但它们的拥护者却非常现代，而且直言不讳。传统上，他们的论点都是从大预算与小预算、特效与绘画构图、明星制度与集体表演、私人融资与政府支持以及导演与雇佣兵的角度来阐述的。但这些争论背后隐藏着两种截然相反的人生观。关键的边界横跨故事三角的底部：静止与变化，这是一个对作家具有深远影响的哲学矛盾。让我们从定义术语开始：

Over the years the primary political issue in cinema has been “Hollywood film” versus “art film.” Although the terms seem dated, their partisans are very contemporary and vocal. Traditionally, their arguments have been framed in terms of big budget versus low budget, special effects versus painterly composition, the star system versus ensemble acting, private finance versus government support, and auteurs versus guns-for-hire. But hiding inside these debates are two diametrically opposed visions of life. The crucial frontier stretches across the bottom of story triangle: stasis versus change, a philosophical contradiction with profound implications for the writer. Let’s begin by defining terms:

“好莱坞电影”这个概念并不包括《时来运转》、《问答》、《药店牛仔》、《边缘明信片》、《萨尔瓦多》、《油尽灯枯》、《蓝丝绒》、《鲍勃·罗伯茨》、《刺杀肯尼迪》、《危险关系》、《渔王》、《为所应为》或《人人都说我爱你》。这些电影以及许多类似的电影都是好莱坞电影公司制作的享誉国际的成功之作。《意外的旅客》在全球获得了超过 2.5 亿美元的票房，超过了大多数动作片，但它并不属于这个定义。“好莱坞电影”的政治含义被缩小到好莱坞每年制作的三四十部以特效为主的电影和同样数量的闹剧和爱情片，远远少于该城电影产量的一半。

The concept “Hollywood film” does not include REVERSAL OF FORTUNE, Q & A, DRUGSTORE COWBOY, POSTCARDS FROM THE EDGE, SALVADOR, RUNNING ON EMPTY, BLUE VELVET, BOB ROBERTS, JFK, DANGEROUS LIAISONS, THE FISHER KING, DO THE RIGHT THING, or EVERYBODY SAYS I LOVE YOU. These films, and many more like them, are acclaimed international successes produced by Hollywood studios. THE ACCIDENTAL TOURIST made more than $250 million worldwide, surpassing most Action films, but doesn’t fall within the definition. The political meaning of “Hollywood film” is narrowed to thirty or forty special effects—dominated flicks and an equal number of farces and romances that Hollywood makes each year—far less than half of the town’s output.

“艺术电影”在最广泛的意义上是指非好莱坞电影，更具体地说是外国电影，甚至更具体地说是欧洲电影。西欧每年制作的电影超过四百部，通常比好莱坞多。然而，“艺术电影”并不是指欧洲制作的大量血腥动作片、硬核色情片或闹剧。在咖啡馆评论的语言中，“艺术电影”（一个愚蠢的短语——想象一下“艺术小说”或“艺术剧院”）仅限于那些成功跨越大西洋的优秀电影，如《巴贝特的盛宴》、《邮差》或《人咬狗》。

“Art film,” in the broadest sense, means non-Hollywood, more specifically foreign film, even more specifically European film. Each year western Europe produces over four hundred films, generally more than Hollywood. “Art film,” however, doesn’t refer to the large number of European productions that are blood-spattered action, hard-core pornography, or slapstick farce. In the language of cafe criticism “art film” (a silly phrase—imagine “art novel” or “art theatre”) is restricted to that trickle of excellent films, like BABETTE’S FEAST, IL POSTINO, or MAN BITES DOG, that manage to cross the Atlantic.

这些术语是在文化政治战争中产生的，它们指向截然不同的，甚至相互矛盾的现实观点。好莱坞电影制作人往往对生活变化的能力过于乐观（有些人会说是愚蠢的乐观），尤其是对生活向好变化的能力。因此，为了表达这种观点，他们依赖大情节和极高的积极结局比例。非好莱坞电影制作人往往对变化过于悲观（有些人会说是时髦的悲观），声称生活变化越多，生活就越保持不变，或者更糟的是，变化会带来痛苦。因此，为了表达变化的徒劳、无意义或破坏性，他们倾向于制作静态的、非情节的肖像或带有负面结局的极端小情节和反情节。

These terms were coined in the wars of cultural politics and point to vastly different, if not contradictory, views of reality. Hollywood filmmakers tend to be overly (some would say foolishly) optimistic about the capacity of life to change—especially for the better. Consequently, to express this vision they rely on the Archplot, and an inordinately high percentage of positive endings. Non-Hollywood filmmakers tend to be overly (some would say chicly) pessimistic about change, professing that the more life changes, the more it stays the same, or, worse, that change brings suffering. Consequently, to express the futility, meaninglessness, or destructiveness of change, they tend to make static, Nonplot portraiture or extreme Miniplots and Antiplots with negative endings.

当然，这些都是趋势，大西洋两岸也有例外，但这种分歧是真实存在的，比分隔新旧世界的海洋还要深。美国人逃离了停滞不前的文化和僵化的阶级牢笼，渴望变革。我们不断改变，试图找到行之有效的方法。在编织了“大社会”的万亿美元安全网之后，我们现在正在将其撕碎。另一方面，旧世界通过几个世纪的艰苦经历学会了害怕这种变革，社会变革不可避免地会带来战争、饥荒和混乱。

These are tendencies, of course, with exceptions on both sides of the Atlantic, but the dichotomy is real and deeper than the seas that separate the Old World from the New. Americans are escapees from prisons of stagnant culture and rigid class who crave change. We change and change again, trying to find what, if anything, works. After weaving the trillion-dollar safety net of the Great Society, we’re now shredding it. The Old World, on the other hand, has learned through centuries of hard experience to fear such change, that social transformations inevitably bring war, famine, chaos.

结果是我们对故事的态度两极分化：好莱坞天真乐观（不是对变化天真，而是对其积极变化的坚持），而艺术电影同样天真悲观（不是对人类状况天真，而是对其消极或停滞不前的坚持）。好莱坞电影常常出于商业原因而非真实原因强行反转结局；非好莱坞电影常常出于时尚原因而非真实原因而坚持黑暗面。真相总是介于两者之间。

The result is our polarized attitude toward story: The ingenuous optimism of Hollywood (not naive about change but about its insistence on positive change) versus the equally ingenuous pessimism of the art film (not naive about the human condition but about its insistence that it will never be other than negative or static). Too often Hollywood films force an up-ending for reasons more commercial than truthful; too often non-Hollywood films cling to the dark side for reasons more fashionable than truthful. The truth, as always, sits somewhere in the middle.

艺术电影对内心冲突的关注吸引了那些高学历人士的兴趣，因为内心世界是受过高等教育的人花费大量时间的地方。然而，极简主义者往往高估了即使是最自我陶醉的人对内心冲突的胃口。更糟糕的是，他们还高估了他们在银幕上表现看不见的事物的能力。同样，好莱坞的动作电影制作人也低估了观众对角色、思想和情感的兴趣，更糟糕的是，他们高估了自己避免动作片陈词滥调的能力。

The art film’s focus on inner conflict draws the interest of those with advanced degrees, because the inner world is where the highly educated spend a large amount of time. Minimalists, however, often overestimate the appetite of even the most self-absorbed minds for a diet of nothing but inner conflict. Worse, they also overestimate their talent to express the unseeable on screen. By the same token, Hollywood’s action filmmakers underestimate the interest of their audience in character, thought, and feeling, and, worse, overestimate their ability to avoid Action genre clichés.

由于好莱坞电影中的故事情节往往是牵强附会和老套的，导演必须用其他东西来弥补，以吸引观众的注意力，于是便诉诸变形效果和不和谐的冒险：《第五元素》。同样，由于艺术电影中的故事情节往往单薄或缺失，导演也必须弥补。在这种情况下，有两种可能：信息或感官刺激。要么是对话丰富的政治争论场景、哲学沉思和人物对自己情绪的自我意识描述；要么是华丽的制作设计和摄影或音乐来取悦观众的感官：《英国病人》。

Because story in Hollywood film is often forced and clichéd, directors must compensate with something else to hold the audience’s attention, resorting to transformation effects and cacophonous derring-do: THE FIFTH ELEMENT. In the same vein, because story is often thin or absent in the art film, again, directors must compensate. In this case, with one of two possibilities: information or sensory stimulation. Either dialogue-heavy scenes of political argument, philosophical musing, and characters’ self-conscious descriptions of their emotions; or lush production design and photography or musical scores to pleasure the audience’s senses: THE ENGLISH PATIENT.

当代电影政治战争的悲哀事实是，“艺术电影”和“好莱坞电影”的过度行为互为镜像：叙事被迫成为奇观和声音的耀眼表面，以分散观众对故事空洞和虚假的注意力……而在这两种情况下，无聊都如黑夜取代白天。

The sad truth of the political wars of contemporary cinema is that the excesses of both “art film” and “Hollywood film” are the mirror images of each other: The telling is forced to become a dazzling surface of spectacle and sound to distract the audience from the vacancy and falsity of the story … and in both boredom follows as night the day.

在关于资金、发行和奖项的政治争吵背后，存在着深刻的文化鸿沟，这反映在大情节、小情节和反情节的对立世界观中。从一个故事到另一个故事，作家可能会在三角关系中的任何位置移动，但我们大多数人在某个地方会感觉更自在。你必须做出自己的“政治”选择，决定你在哪里安身立命。在你这样做的时候，让我提出以下几点供你权衡：

Behind the political squabbling over finance, distribution, and awards lies a deep cultural divide, reflected in the opposing world-views of Archplot versus Miniplot and Antiplot. From story to story the writer may move anywhere within the triangle, but most of us feel more at home in one place or another. You must make your own “political” choices and decide where you reside. As you do, let me offer these points for you to weigh:

作家必须靠写作谋生

The Writer Must Earn His Living Writing

一边工作一边写作是可能的。成千上万的人都做到了。但随着时间的推移，你会精疲力竭，注意力不集中，创造力崩溃，你会想放弃。在你放弃之前，你必须找到一种靠写作谋生的方法。一个有才华的作家在电影和电影的现实世界中的生存电视、戏剧和出版始于他对这一事实的认识：随着故事设计远离大情节并沿着三角走向小情节、反情节和非情节的远端，观众就会减少。

Writing while holding down a forty-hour-a-week job is possible. Thousands have done it. But in time, exhaustion sets in, concentration wanders, creativity crumbles, and you’re tempted to quit. Before you do, you must find a way to earn your living from your writing. A talented writer’s survival in the real world of film and television, theatre, and publishing begins with his recognition of this fact: As story design moves away from the Archplot and down the triangle toward the far reaches of Miniplot, Antiplot, and Nonplot, the audience shrinks.

这种萎缩与品质或缺乏品质无关。故事三角的三个角落都闪耀着世界珍视的杰作，为我们这个不完美的世界带来了完美。相反，观众萎缩的原因在于：大多数人认为生活带来的是绝对、不可逆转变化的封闭体验；他们最大的冲突源在他们自己之外；他们是自己存在的唯一和积极的主角；他们的存在在连续的时间中在一个一致的、因果相连的现实中运作；在这个现实中，事件的发生是有可解释和有意义的原因的。自从我们的第一个祖先凝视着自己制造的火并想到“我是”以来，这就是人类看待世界和自己的方式。古典设计是人类思想的一面镜子。

This atrophy has nothing to do with quality or a lack of it. All three corners of the story triangle gleam with masterworks that the world treasures, pieces of perfection for our imperfect world. Rather, the audience shrinks for this reason: Most human beings believe that life brings closed experiences of absolute, irreversible change; that their greatest sources of conflict are external to themselves; that they are the single and active protagonists of their own existence; that their existence operates through continuous time within a consistent, causally interconnected reality; and that inside this reality events happen for explainable and meaningful reasons. Since our first ancestor stared into a fire of his own making and thought the thought, “I am,” this is how human beings have seen the world and themselves in it. Classical design is a mirror of the human mind.

经典设计是记忆和预期的模型。当我们回想过去时，我们是否会以反结构的方式将事件拼凑在一起？以简约的方式？不会。我们围绕一个大情节收集和塑造记忆，以生动地重现过去。当我们幻想未来时，我们害怕或祈祷的事情会发生，我们的愿景是简约的吗？反结构化的？不会，我们将我们的幻想和希望塑造成一个大情节。经典设计展示了人类感知的时间、空间和因果模式，而思维则反抗这些模式。

Classical design is a model of memory and anticipation. When we think back to the past, do we piece events together antistructured? Minimalistically? No. We collect and shape memories around an Archplot to bring the past back vividly. When we daydream about the future, what we dread or pray will happen, is our vision minimalistic? Antistructured? No, we mold our fantasies and hopes into an Archplot. Classical design displays the temporal, spatial, and causal patterns of human perception, outside which the mind rebels.

古典设计不是西方人对生活的看法。数千年来，从黎凡特到爪哇再到日本，亚洲的故事讲述者一直以大情节为框架，编织出充满冒险和激情的故事。正如亚洲电影的兴起所表明的那样，东方编剧借鉴了西方使用的古典设计原则，用独特的智慧和讽刺丰富了他们的故事。大情节既不是古代的也不是现代的，既不是西方的也不是东方的；它是人性的。

Classical design is not a Western view of life. For thousands of years, from the Levant to Java to Japan, the storytellers of Asia have framed their works within the Archplot, spinning yarns of high adventure and great passion. As the rise of Asian film has shown, Eastern screenwriters draw on the same principles of classical design used in the West, enriching their tellings with a unique wit and irony. The Archplot is neither ancient nor modern, Western nor Eastern; it is human.

当观众感觉到故事过于虚构时现实生活乏味无意义，观众就会感到疏远并转身离开。所有收入和背景的聪明、敏感的人都是如此。绝大多数人无法认可反情节的不一致现实、小情节的内化被动性和非情节的静态循环作为他们生活的隐喻。随着故事到达三角形的底部，观众缩小到那些喜欢偶尔扭曲现实的忠诚的电影爱好者知识分子。这是一个热情、富有挑战性的观众……但观众人数非常少。

When the audience senses that a story is drifting too close to fictional realities it finds tedious or meaningless, it feels alienated and turns away. This is true of intelligent, sensitive people of all incomes and backgrounds. The vast majority of human beings cannot endorse the inconsistent realities of Antiplot, the internalized passivity of Miniplot, and the static circularity of Nonplot as metaphors for life as they live it. As story reaches the bottom of the triangle the audience has shrunk to those loyal cinephile intellectuals who like to have their realities twisted once in a while. This is an enthusiastic, challenging audience … but a very small audience.

如果观众减少，预算也必须减少。这是规律。1961 年，阿兰·罗伯-格里耶创作了《去年在马里昂巴德》，整个 70 和 80 年代，他创作了精彩的反情节拼图——这些电影更多地是关于写作艺术而不是生活行为。我曾经问过他，尽管他的电影有反商业倾向，但他是如何做到的。他说他从未花超过 75 万美元拍电影，而且永远不会。他的观众忠诚但微薄。在极低的预算下，他的投资者将资金翻倍，并让他继续担任导演。但 200 万美元时，他们会倾家荡产，他也会失去导演的位置。罗伯-格里耶既有远见又务实。

If the audience shrinks, the budget must shrink. This is the law. In 1961 Alain Robbe-Grillet wrote LAST YEAR AT MARIENBAD and throughout the seventies and eighties he wrote brilliant Antiplot puzzle pieces—films more about the art of writing than about the act of living. I once asked him how, despite the anticommercial bent of his films, he did it. He said he’d never spent more than $750,000 to make a film and never would. His audience was faithful but meager. At an ultra-low budget his investors doubled their money and kept him in the director’s chair. But at $2 million they would lose their shirts and he his seat. Robbe-Grillet was both visionary and pragmatic.

如果你像罗伯-格里耶一样，希望写小情节或反情节，并能找到一位非好莱坞制片人以低预算工作，而且自己也对相对较少的钱感到满意，那就好。那就去做吧。但当你为好莱坞写作时，低预算的剧本就不是什么资产。经验丰富的专业人士在阅读你的极简主义或反结构化作品时，可能会对你对形象的处理表示赞赏，但会拒绝参与，因为经验告诉他们，如果故事无关紧要，观众也是如此。

If, like Robbe-Grillet, you wish to write Miniplot or Antiplot, and can find a non-Hollywood producer to work at low budget, and are happy with relatively little money for yourself, good. Do it. But when you write for Hollywood, a low-budget script is no asset. Seasoned professionals who read your minimalist or antistructured piece may applaud your handling of image, but decline to be involved because experience has taught them that if the story is inconsequential, so is the audience.

即使是好莱坞的中等预算也会达到数千万美元，而且每部电影都必须找到足够多的观众来偿还成本，并且利润要高于有担保投资所能获得的利润。投资者为什么要冒着巨大的风险冒着数百万美元的风险，他们可以把钱投入房地产，至少在完成后有一座建筑，而不是在几个电影节上放映，塞进冷藏库，然后被遗忘的东西？如果好莱坞电影公司要进行这种疯狂的冒险，你必须写一部至少有机会收回巨大风险的电影。换句话说，一部倾向于大情节的电影。

Even modest Hollywood budgets run into the tens of millions of dollars, and each film must find an audience large enough to repay its cost at a profit greater than the same money would have earned in a secured investment. Why should investors place millions at enormous jeopardy when they can put it into real estate and at least have a building when they’re done, not something that’s shown in a couple of film festivals, shoved into a refrigerated vault, and forgotten? If a Hollywood studio is going to take this wild ride with you, you must write a film that has at least a chance of recouping its huge risk. In other words, a film that leans toward the Archplot.

作家必须掌握古典形式

The Writer Must Master Classical Form

优秀作家通过本能或学习认识到，极简主义和反结构不是独立的形式，而是对古典主义的反应。小情节和反情节都诞生于大情节——一个缩小了大情节，另一个与之相反。先锋派的存在是为了反对大众和商业，直到它也变得大众和商业化，然后它就会转而攻击自己。如果非情节“艺术电影”变得火爆并大赚一笔，先锋派就会反抗，谴责好莱坞出卖肖像画，并夺取古典主义的统治权。

By instinct or study, fine writers recognize that minimalism and antistructure are not independent forms but reactions to the Classical. Miniplot and Antiplot were born out of the Archplot—one shrinks it, the other contradicts it. The avant-garde exists to oppose the popular and commercial, until it too becomes popular and commercial, then it turns to attack itself. If Nonplot “art films” went hot and were raking in money, the avant-garde would revolt, denounce Hollywood for selling out to portraiture, and seize the Classical for its own.

这些形式/自由、对称/不对称之间的循环与雅典剧院一样古老。艺术史就是复兴史：主流偶像被先锋派摧毁，而先锋派最终成为新的主流，新的先锋派使用其祖父的武器形式攻击他们。摇滚乐以黑人俚语中的性爱一词命名，最初是一场反对战后白人声音的先锋派运动。现在，摇滚乐是音乐贵族的定义，甚至被用作教堂音乐。

These cycles between formality/freedom, symmetry/asymmetry are as old as Attic theatre. The history of art is a history of revivals: Establishment icons are shattered by an avant-garde that in time becomes the new establishment to be attacked by a new avant-garde that uses its grandfather’s forms of weapons. Rock ‘n’ roll, which was named after black slang for sex, began as an avant-garde movement against the white-bread sounds of the postwar era. Now it’s the definition of musical aristocracy and even used as church music.

反情节手法的严肃运用不仅已过时，而且已沦为笑柄。从《一条安达鲁狗》到《周末》，反结构作品中始终贯穿着黑色讽刺，但现在直接面对镜头、前后矛盾的现实和另类结局已成为闹剧电影的主流。鲍勃·霍普和宾·克劳斯贝的《摩洛哥之路》开始出现的反情节笑料已融入《闪亮的马鞍》、《蟒蛇》电影和《韦恩的世界》等影片中。曾经让我们觉得危险和革命的故事技巧现在看来毫无威力却魅力无穷。

The serious use of Antiplot devices not only has gone out of fashion but has become a joke. A vein of dark satire has always run through antistructure works, from UN CHIEN ANDALOU to WEEKEND, but now direct address to camera, inconsistent realities, and alternative endings are the staples of film farce. Antiplot gags that began with Bob Hope and Bing Crosby’s THE ROAD TO MOROCCO have been worked into the likes of BLAZING SADDLES, the PYTHON films, and WAYNE’S WORLD. Story techniques that once struck us as dangerous and revolutionary now seem toothless but charming.

伟大的故事讲述者尊重这些循环，他们一直知道，无论背景或教育程度如何，每个人都有意识或本能地带着古典的期待进入故事仪式。因此，要使小情节和反情节发挥作用，作家必须玩弄或反对这种期待。只有小心而有创意地粉碎或扭曲古典形式，艺术家才能引导观众感知隐藏在小情节中的内心生活，或接受反情节的令人不寒而栗的荒谬。但作家如何才能创造性地减少或扭转他不理解的东西呢？

Respecting these cycles, great storytellers have always known that, regardless of background or education, everyone, consciously or instinctively, enters the story ritual with Classical anticipation. Therefore, to make Miniplot and Antiplot work the writer must play with or against this expectancy. Only by carefully and creatively shattering or bending the Classical form can the artist lead the audience to perceive the inner life hidden in a Miniplot or to accept the chilling absurdity of an Antiplot. But how can a writer creatively reduce or reverse that which he does not understand?

在故事三角的深处取得成功的作家知道理解的起点在顶端，并从古典主义开始他们的职业生涯。伯格曼在敢于尝试《沉默》的极简主义或《假面》的反结构之前，创作和导演了爱情故事和社会历史剧二十年。费里尼在冒险尝试《阿玛柯德》的小情节或《八十年代》的反情节之前，创作了《我的女人》和《大路》。戈达尔在《周末》之前创作了《喘不过气来》。罗伯特·奥特曼在电视剧《淘金者》和《希区柯克悬念故事集》中完善了他的故事天赋。首先，大师们掌握了大情节。

Writers who found success in the deep corners of the story triangle knew that the starting point of understanding was at the top and began their careers in the Classical. Bergman wrote and directed love stories and social and historical dramas for twenty years before he dared venture into the minimalism of THE SILENCE or the antistructure of PERSONA.
