This is why he’s been suicidal over his brother’s death. Calvin then forces the Climax: She must learn to love Conrad or leave. Beth goes to a closet, packs a suitcase, and heads out the door. She cannot face her inability to love her son.

这一高潮回答了戏剧性的主要问题：这个家庭会自行解决问题还是会分崩离析？从这一高潮开始，我们寻找激励事件，即打破卡尔文生活平衡并让他踏上征程的事件。

This Climax answers the Major Dramatic Question: Will the family solve its problems within itself or be torn apart? Working backward from it, we seek the Inciting Incident, the event that has upset the balance of Calvin’s life and sent him on his quest.

电影开头是康拉德从精神病院回家，他的自杀性神经症大概已经治愈了。卡尔文觉得这个家庭已经从失去亲人的痛苦中恢复过来，恢复了平衡。第二天早上，心情郁闷的康拉德坐在父亲对面吃早餐。贝丝把一盘法式吐司放在儿子面前。他拒绝进食。她抢过盘子，走到水槽边，把他的早餐铲进垃圾处理器，嘟囔着：“法式吐司不能留着。”

The film opens with Conrad coming home from a psychiatric hospital, presumably cured of his suicidal neurosis. Calvin feels that the family has survived its loss and balance has been restored. The next morning Conrad, in a grim mood, sits opposite his father at the breakfast table. Beth puts a plate of French toast under her son’s face. He refuses to eat. She snatches the plate away, marches to the sink, and scrapes his breakfast down a garbage disposal, muttering: “You can’t keep French toast.”

导演罗伯特·雷德福的镜头切换到父亲，他的生活崩溃了。卡尔文立刻感觉到仇恨又回来了。仇恨背后隐藏着可怕的东西。这一令人不寒而栗的事件让观众心生恐惧，他们心想：“看看她对她的孩子做了什么！他刚从医院回家，她就对他做了这种事。”

Director Robert Redford’s camera cuts to the father as the man’s life crashes. Calvin instantly senses that the hatred is back with a vengeance. Behind it hides something fearful. This chilling event grips the audience with dread as it reacts, thinking: “Look what she did to her child! He’s just home from the hospital and she’s doing this number on him.”

小说家朱迪思·盖斯特和编剧阿尔文·萨金特将卡尔文塑造成一个安静的人物，一个不会从桌子旁站起来试图强迫妻子和儿子和解的男人。他首先想到的是给他们时间和充满爱的鼓励，比如家庭照片的场景。当他得知康拉德在学校遇到的麻烦时，他为他聘请了一位心理医生。他温柔地和妻子交谈，希望得到妻子的理解。

Novelist Judith Guest and screenwriter Alvin Sargent gave Calvin a quiet characterization, a man who won’t leap up from the table and try to bully wife and son into reconciliation. His first thought is to give them time and loving encouragements, such as the family photo scene. When he learns of Conrad’s troubles at school, he hires a psychiatrist for him. He talks gently with his wife, hoping to understand.

因为卡尔文是一个犹豫不决、富有同情心的人，萨金特不得不围绕次要情节构建电影发展的动态。康拉德与自杀的斗争比卡尔文微妙的追求要活跃得多。因此，萨金​​特将男孩的次要情节放在突出位置，给予其过多的强调和屏幕时间，同时小心地增加背景中主情节的势头。当次要情节在精神病医生的办公室结束时，卡尔文已准备好将主情节推向毁灭性的结局。然而，关键在于，普通人的激励事件是由一名妇女将法式吐司从垃圾处理机中刮下而引发的。

Because Calvin is a hesitant, compassionate man, Sargent had to build the dynamic of the film’s progressions around the subplot. Conrad’s struggle with suicide is far more active than Calvin’s subtle quest. So Sargent foregrounded the boy’s subplot, giving it inordinate emphasis and screentime, while carefully increasing the momentum of the Central Plot in the background. By the time the subplot ends in the psychiatrist’s office, Calvin is ready to bring the Central Plot to its devastating end. The point, however, is that the Inciting Incident of ORDINARY PEOPLE is triggered by a woman scraping French toast down a garbage disposal.

亨利·詹姆斯在他的小说前言中对故事艺术进行了精彩的描述，并曾问过：“到底什么是事件？”他说，事件可以小到像一个女人把手放在桌子上，用“特定的方式”看着你。在正确的语境中，一个手势和一个眼神可能意味着“我再也见不到你了”，或者“我会永远爱你”——一段破碎或成功的人生。

Henry James wrote brilliantly about story art in the prefaces to his novels, and once asked: “What, after all, is an event?” An event, he said, could be as little as a woman putting her hand on the table and looking at you “that certain way.” In the right context, just a gesture and a look could mean, “I’ll never see you again,” or “I’ll love you forever”—a life broken or made.

激励事件（就此而言，任何事件）的性质必须与它周围的世界、人物和类型密切相关。一旦构思出来，作家必须专注于它的功能。激励事件是否从根本上打乱了主人公生活中的力量平衡？它是否激起了主人公恢复平衡的愿望？它是否激发了主人公对他认为可以恢复平衡的物体（物质或非物质）的自觉欲望？对于一个复杂的主人公来说，它是否也激发了他与他有意识的需求相矛盾的潜意识欲望？它是否促使主人公开始寻求他的欲望？它是否在观众心中提出了主要戏剧性问题？它是否投射出必演场景的形象？如果它做到了这一切，那么它可能只是一个女人把手放在桌子上，用“那种特定的方式”看着你。

The quality of the Inciting Incident (for that matter, any event) must be germane to the world, characters, and genre surrounding it. Once it is conceived, the writer must concentrate on its function. Does the Inciting Incident radically upset the balance of forces in the protagonist’s life? Does it arouse in the protagonist the desire to restore balance? Does it inspire in him the conscious desire for that object, material or immaterial, he feels would restore the balance? In a complex protagonist, does it also bring to life an unconscious desire that contradicts his conscious need? Does it launch the protagonist on a quest for his desire? Does it raise the Major Dramatic Question in the mind of the audience? Does it project an image of the Obligatory Scene? If it does all this, then it can be as little as a woman putting her hand on the table, looking at you “that certain way.”

制造煽动事件

CREATING THE INCITING INCIDENT

最后一幕的高潮无疑是最难创作的场景：它是故事的灵魂。如果它不起作用，故事就不起作用。但第二难写的场景是中心情节的激励事件。我们重写这个场景的次数比其他任何场景都要多。所以这里有一些问题可以帮助我们记住它。

The Climax of the last act is far and away the most difficult scene to create: It’s the soul of the telling. If it doesn’t work, the story doesn’t work. But the second most difficult scene to write is the Central Plot’s Inciting Incident. We rewrite this scene more than any other. So here are some questions to ask that should help bring it to mind.

发生在我主人公身上最糟糕的事情是什么？这怎么会变成发生在他身上最好的事情呢？

What is the worst possible thing that could happen to my protagonist? How could that turn out to be the best possible thing that could happen to him?

《克莱默大战克莱默》。最糟糕的是：工作狂克莱默（达斯汀·霍夫曼饰）遭遇了灾难，他的妻子抛弃了他和她的孩子。最好的是：这竟然是他需要的震惊，让他满足了潜意识中想要成为一个有爱心的人的愿望。

KRAMER VS. KRAMER. The worst: Disaster strikes the workaholic Kramer (Dustin Hoffman) when his wife walks out on him and her child. The best: This turns out to be the shock he needed to fulfill his unconscious desire to be a loving human being.

未婚女子。最糟糕的是：当她的丈夫说要离开她去找另一个女人时，埃丽卡（吉尔·克雷伯格饰）干呕。最好的是：他的离开竟然是一种解脱，让这个依赖男性的女人实现了她潜意识中对独立和自我控制的渴望。

AN UNMARRIED WOMAN. The worst: When her husband says he’s leaving her for another woman, Erica (Jill Clayburgh) retches. The best: His exit turns out to be the freeing experience that allows this male-dependent woman to fulfill her unconscious desire for independence and self-possession.

或者：我的主角可能发生的最好的事情是什么？它怎么会变成最糟糕的事情？

Or: What’s the best possible thing that could happen to my protagonist? How could it become the worst possible thing?

威尼斯之死。冯·阿森巴赫（Dirk Bogarde）因瘟疫失去了妻子和孩子。从那时起，他就埋头于工作，身心崩溃。医生让他去威尼斯温泉疗养。最好的是：在那里，他疯狂而无助地爱上了……但爱的是一个男孩。他对这位英俊无比的年轻人的热爱，以及这种热爱的不可能性，让他陷入绝望。最糟糕的是：当一场新的瘟疫袭击威尼斯，孩子的母亲匆忙带走儿子时，冯·阿森巴赫徘徊等待死亡，以摆脱痛苦。

DEATH IN VENICE. Von Aschenbach (Dirk Bogarde) has lost his wife and children to a plague. Since then he’s buried himself in his work to the point of physical and mental collapse. His doctor sends him to the Venice spa to recuperate. The best: There he falls madly, helplessly in love… but with a boy. His passion for the impossibly beautiful youth, and the impossibility of it, leads to despair. The worst: When a new plague invades Venice and the child’s mother hurries her son away, Von Aschenbach lingers to wait for death and escape from his misery.

《教父》第二部。精彩之处：迈克尔（阿尔·帕西诺饰）成为科里昂犯罪家族的头目后，决定带着家人进入合法世界。糟糕之处：他无情地执行黑手党忠诚守则，导致他最亲密的同伙被暗杀，与妻子和孩子疏远，兄弟被谋杀，使他成为一个心力交瘁、孤苦伶仃的人。

THE GODFATHER, PART II. The best: After Michael (Al Pacino) is made Don of the Corleone crime family, he decides to take his family into the legitimate world. The worst: His ruthless enforcement of the mafia code of loyalty ends in the assassination of his closest associates, estrangement from his wife and children, and the murder of his brother, leaving him a hollowed-out, desolate man.

一个故事可能会重复这种模式的多个循环。什么是最好的？它怎么会变成最坏的？它怎么会再次逆转为主角的救赎？或者：什么是最坏的？它怎么会变成最好的？它怎么会导致主角堕落？我们向“最好”和“最坏”延伸，因为故事——当它是艺术时——不是关于人类经验的中间地带。

A story may turn more than one cycle of this pattern. What is the best? How could that become the worst? How could that reverse yet again into the protagonist’s salvation? Or: What is the worst? How could that become the best? How could that lead the protagonist to damnation? We stretch toward the “bests” and “worsts” because story—when it is art—is not about the middle ground of human experience.

激励事件的影响为我们创造了触及生命极限的机会。这是一种爆炸​​。在动作片中，它可能实际上是一种爆炸​​；在其他电影中，它就像一个微笑一样无声。无论多么微妙或直接，它都必须颠覆主角的现状，并使其生活脱离现有的模式，从而使混乱侵入角色的世界。在这种动荡中，你必须在高潮时找到一个解决方案，无论好坏，将这个世界重新安排成一个新的秩序。

The impact of the Inciting Incident creates our opportunity to reach the limits of life. It’s a kind of explosion. In Action genres it may be in fact an explosion: in other films, as muted as a smile. No matter how subtle or direct, it must upset the status quo of the protagonist and jolt his life from its existing pattern, so that chaos invades the character’s universe. Out of this upheaval, you must find, at Climax, a resolution, for better or worse, that rearranges this universe into a new order.

9

幕设计

9

ACT DESIGN

并发症逐渐增多

PROGRESSIVE COMPLICATIONS

五部分设计的第二个要素是渐进式复杂化：从激励事件到最后一幕的危机/高潮，故事的主体部分非常庞大。复杂化意味着让角色的生活变得困难。渐进式复杂化意味着在角色面临越来越大的对抗力量时产生越来越多的冲突，从而创造出一系列无法​​挽回的事件。

The second element of the five-part design is Progressive Complications: that great sweeping body of story that spans from Inciting Incident to Crisis/Climax of the final act. To complicate means to make life difficult for characters. To complicate progressively means to generate more and more conflict as they face greater and greater forces of antagonism, creating a succession of events that passes points of no return.

不归路

Points of No Return

激励事件使主人公开始寻求有意识或无意识的欲望对象，以恢复生活的平衡。为了开始追求他的欲望，他采取了最低限度的保守行动，以激起现实的积极反应。但他的行动却激起了内心、个人或社会/环境冲突层面的对抗力量，阻碍了他的欲望，打破了期望与结果之间的差距。

The Inciting Incident launches the protagonist on a quest for a conscious or unconscious Object of Desire to restore life’s balance. To begin the pursuit of his desire, he takes a minimum, conservative action to provoke a positive response from his reality. But the effect of his action is to arouse forces of antagonism from inner, personal, or social/environmental Levels of Conflict that block his desire, cracking open the Gap between expectation and result.

当裂痕打开时，观众意识到这是一个无法挽回的转折点。最小的努力不会奏效。角色无法通过采取较小的行动来恢复生活的平衡。从今以后，所有像角色的第一次努力一样的行动，质量和规模较小的行动，都必须从故事中消除。

When the Gap opens, the audience realizes that this is a point of no return. Minimal efforts won’t work. The character can’t restore the balance of life by taking lesser actions. Henceforth, all action like the character’s first effort, actions of minor quality and magnitude, must be eliminated from the story.

意识到自己处于危险之中后，主角利用更大的意志力和能力来克服这个差距，并采取了第二，更困难的行动。但其效果再次激发了对抗力量，在期望和结果之间产生了第二道鸿沟。

Realizing he’s at risk, the protagonist draws upon greater willpower and capacity to struggle through this gap and take a second, more difficult action. But again the effect is to provoke forces of antagonism, opening a second gap between expectation and result.

观众现在意识到这也是一个不归路。像第二种这样的温和行动不会成功。因此，所有这种规模和质量的行动都必须被消除。

The audience now senses that this too is a point of no return. Moderate actions like the second won’t succeed. Therefore, all actions of this magnitude and quality must be eliminated.

面对更大的风险，角色必须适应变化的环境，采取需要更多意志力和个人能力的行动，期望或至少希望他的世界做出有益或可控的反应。但随着更强大的对抗力量对他的第三个行动做出反应，差距再次拉大。

At greater risk, the character must adjust to his changed circumstances and take an action that demands even more willpower and personal capacity, expecting or at least hoping for a helpful or manageable reaction from his world. But once more the gap flies open as even more powerful forces of antagonism react to his third action.

观众再次意识到，这又是一条无法挽回的路。更极端的行为不会让角色得到他想要的东西，所以这些也出于考虑而被取消了。

Again, the audience recognizes that this is yet another point of no return. The more extreme actions won’t get the character what he wants, so these too are canceled out of consideration.

进程需要利用人物越来越强大的能力，要求他们有越来越强的意志力，让他们面临越来越大的风险，在行动的规模或质量上不断超越不可挽回的点。

Progressions build by drawing upon greater and greater capacities from characters, demanding greater and greater willpower from them, putting them at greater and greater risk, constantly passing points of no return in terms of the magnitude or quality of action.

故事不能退回到质量或规模较低的行动，而应该逐步向前发展，达到观众无法想象的最终行动。

A story must not retreat to actions of lesser quality or magnitude, but move progressively forward to a final action beyond which the audience cannot imagine another.

您有过多少次这样的经历？一部电影开头很好，把你吸引到角色的生活中。在前半个小时里，它引起了强烈的兴趣，直到一个重大转折点。但电影放映了四五十分钟后，它开始变得拖沓。你的目光从屏幕上移开；你瞥了一眼手表；你希望自己多买点爆米花；你开始关注和你一起看的人的身体状况。也许电影再次加快了节奏，结尾也很好，但中间二十或三十分钟的乏味时间让你失去了兴趣。

How many times have you had this experience? A film begins well, hooking you into the lives of the characters. It builds with strong interest over the first half-hour to a major Turning Point. But then forty or fifty minutes into the film, it starts to drag. Your eyes wander from the screen; you glance at your watch; you wish you’d bought more popcorn; you start paying attention to the anatomy of the person you came with. Perhaps the film gains pace again and finishes well, but for twenty or thirty flabby minutes in the middle you lost interest.

如果你仔细观察许多电影中悬在腰带上的软肋，你会发现，这正是编剧的洞察力和想象力变得软弱的地方。他无法构建渐进式，所以实际上他把故事倒退了。在第二幕中间，他给予角色们一些他们在第一幕中已经做过的次要行为——不是完全相同的行为，而是类似规模或类型的行为：最小、保守，现在已变得微不足道。在观看时，我们的直觉告诉我们，这些行为并没有让角色在第一幕中得到他想要的东西，因此它们也不会让他在第二幕中得到他想要的东西。作家在重复故事，而我们在原地踏步。

If you look closely at the soft bellies that hang out over the belt of so many films, you’ll discover that this is where the writer’s insight and imagination went limp. He couldn’t build progressions, so in effect he put the story in retrograde. In the middle of Act Two he’s given his characters lesser actions of the kind they’ve already done in Act One—not identical actions but actions of a similar size or kind: minimal, conservative, and by now trivial. As we watch, our instincts tell us that these actions didn’t get the character what he wanted in Act One, therefore they’re not going to get him what he wants in Act Two. The writer is recycling story and we’re treading water.

保持影片的潮流流动和上升的唯一方法是研究——想象、记忆、事实。通常，一部长篇大情节设计围绕四十到六十个场景，这些场景共同构成十二到十八个序列，这些序列构成三个或更多的幕，这些幕连续不断，直到最后。要创作四十到六十个场景而不重复自己，你需要创作数百个场景。在勾勒出这一大堆素材后，挖掘出那些将序列和幕构建成令人难忘和感动的不归路的少数珍宝。因为如果你只设计出填满 120 页剧本所需的四十到六十个场景，你的作品几乎肯定会是反进步和重复的。

The only way to keep a film’s current flowing and rising is research—imagination, memory, fact. Generally, a feature-length Archplot is designed around forty to sixty scenes that conspire into twelve to eighteen sequences that build into three or more acts that top one another continuously to the end of the line. To create forty to sixty scenes and not repeat yourself, you need to invent hundreds. After sketching this mountain of material, tunnel to find those few gems that will build sequences and acts into memorable and moving points of no return. For if you devise only the forty to sixty scenes needed to fill the 120 pages of a screenplay, your work is almost certain to be antiprogressive and repetitious.

冲突法

The Law of Conflict

当主角走出激励事件时，他进入了一个由冲突法则统治的世界。即：故事中的一切只有通过冲突才能向前发展。

When the protagonist steps out of the Inciting Incident, he enters a world governed by the Law of Conflict. To wit: Nothing moves forward in a story except through conflict.

换句话说，冲突之于讲故事，就如同声音之于音乐。故事和音乐都是时间艺术，时间艺术家最困难的任务就是吸引我们的兴趣，让我们全神贯注，然后带我们穿越时间，却意识不到时间的流逝。

Put another way, conflict is to storytelling what sound is to music. Both story and music are temporal arts, and the single most difficult task of the temporal artist is to hook our interest, hold our uninterrupted concentration, then carry us through time without an awareness of the passage of time.

在音乐中，这种效果是通过声音实现的。乐器或声音吸引我们并带我们前进，使时间消失。假设我们正在听交响乐，管弦乐队突然安静下来。会有什么效果？首先，我们会感到困惑，想知道他们为什么停下来，然后很快我们会在想象中听到滴答作响的钟声。我们会敏锐地意识到时间的流逝，而且由于时间是如此主观，如果管弦乐队沉默了三分钟，我们就会觉得有三十分钟了。

In music, this effect is accomplished through sound. Instruments or voices capture us and move us along, making time vanish. Suppose we were listening to a symphony and the orchestra suddenly fell silent. What would be the effect? First, confusion as we wonder why they’ve stopped, then very quickly we would hear in our imaginations the sound of a ticking clock. We would become acutely aware of the passage of time, and because time is so subjective, if the orchestra were silent for just three minutes, it would seem like thirty.

故事的音乐就是冲突。只要冲突牵动着我们的思想和情感，我们就会不知不觉地度过几个小时。然后电影突然结束了。我们惊讶地看了一眼手表。但当冲突消失时，我们也消失了。赏心悦目的摄影作品的画面趣味或优美乐曲的听觉享受可能会让我们短暂地沉浸其中，但如果冲突持续太久，我们的眼睛就会离开屏幕。当我们的眼睛离开屏幕时，思想和情感也会随之消失。

The music of story is conflict. As long as conflict engages our thoughts and emotions we travel through the hours unaware of the voyage. Then suddenly the film’s over. We glance at our watches, amazed. But when conflict disappears, so do we. The pictorial interest of eye-pleasing photography or the aural pleasures of a beautiful score may hold us briefly, but if conflict is kept on hold for too long, our eyes leave the screen. And when our eyes leave the screen they take thought and emotion with them.

冲突法则不仅仅是一种美学原则，更是故事的灵魂。故事是生活的隐喻，活着就意味着永远处于冲突之中。正如让-保罗·萨特所言，现实的本质是稀缺，是一种普遍而永恒的匮乏。这个世界上任何东西都不够用。食物不够，爱不够，正义不够，时间也永远不够。正如海德格尔所言，时间是存在的基本范畴。我们生活在时间不断缩小的阴影中，如果我们想在短暂的生命中取得任何成就，让我们在死时不会觉得浪费了时间，我们就必须与否定我们欲望的稀缺力量展开激烈的冲突。

The Law of Conflict is more than an aesthetic principle; it is the soul of story. Story is metaphor for life, and to be alive is to be in seemingly perpetual conflict. As Jean-Paul Sartre expressed it, the essence of reality is scarcity, a universal and eternal lacking. There isn’t enough of anything in this world to go around. Not enough food, not enough love, not enough justice, and never enough time. Time, as Heidegger observed, is the basic category of existence. We live in its ever-shrinking shadow, and if we are to achieve anything in our brief being that lets us die without feeling we’ve wasted our time, we will have to go into heady conflict with the forces of scarcity that deny our desires.

那些无法把握我们短暂存在之真相的作家，那些被现代世界的虚假舒适所误导的作家，那些认为只要你知道如何玩游戏，生活就会变得轻松的作家，给冲突赋予了虚假的转折。他们的剧本失败的原因有两个：要么是充斥着毫无意义和荒谬暴力的冲突，要么是缺乏有意义和诚实表达的冲突。

Writers who cannot grasp the truth of our transitory existence, who have been mislead by the counterfeit comforts of the modern world, who believe that life is easy once you know how to play the game, give conflict a false inflection. Their scripts fail for one of two reasons: either a glut of meaningless and absurdly violent conflict, or a vacancy of meaningful and honestly expressed conflict.

前者是涡轮特效的练习，是由那些按照教科书命令制造冲突的人编写的，但是，因为他们对生活中的真实挣扎不感兴趣或不敏感，所以设计出虚假的、过度紧张的混乱借口。

The former are exercises in turbo special effects, written by those who follow textbook imperatives to create conflict, but, because they’re disinterested in or insensitive to the honest struggles of life, devise phony, overwrought excuses for mayhem.

后者是针对冲突本身而写的乏味的描绘。这些作家抱有乐观主义的观点，认为如果没有冲突，生活会很美好……因此，他们的电影避免了冲突，而是选择低调的描述，以表明如果我们学会更好地沟通，更仁慈一点，尊重环境，人类就能重返天堂。但如果历史教会了我们什么，那就是当有毒的噩梦最终被清除时为无家可归者提供庇护所，世界转向使用太阳能，但我们每个人仍然会被覆盖物所淹没。

The latter are tedious portraits written in reaction against conflict itself. These writers take the Pollyanna view that life would really be nice… if it weren’t for conflict. Therefore, their films avoid it in favor of low-key depictions to suggest that if we learned to communicate a little better, be a little more charitable, respect the environment, humanity could return to paradise. But if history has taught us anything, it’s that when toxic nightmare is finally cleaned up, the homeless provided shelter, and the world converted to solar energy, each of us will still be up to our eyebrows in mulch.

走在极端的作家没有意识到，虽然冲突的质量会随着层次的转变而变化，但生活中冲突的数量是恒定的。总是缺少一些东西。就像挤压气球一样，冲突的体积永远不会改变，它只是向另一个方向膨胀。当我们从生活的一个层面消除冲突时，它在另一个层面上会放大十倍。

Writers at these extremes fail to realize that while the quality of conflict changes as it shifts from level to level, the quantity of conflict in life is constant. Something is always lacking. Like squeezing a balloon, the volume of conflict never changes, it just bulges in another direction. When we remove conflict from one level of life, it amplifies ten times over on another level.

例如，如果我们设法满足了外在的欲望，找到了与世界的和谐，那么平静很快就会变成无聊。萨特所说的“稀缺”就是冲突本身的缺失。无聊是当我们失去欲望、缺乏时所遭受的内心冲突。更糟糕的是，如果我们把一个日复一日生活在平静满足中的角色的无冲突生活搬上银幕，观众的无聊感就会明显地令人痛苦。

If, for example, we manage to satisfy our external desires and find harmony with the world, in short order serenity turns to boredom. Now Sartre’s “scarcity” is the absence of conflict itself. Boredom is the inner conflict we suffer when we lose desire, when we lack a lacking. What’s worse, if we were to put on screen the conflictless existence of a character who, day-in, day-out, lives in placid contentment, the boredom in the audience would be palpably painful.

总体而言，工业化国家受过教育的阶层已经不再为生存而挣扎。这种来自外部世界的安全感让我们有时间反思内心的世界。一旦有了住处、穿衣、吃饭和用药，我们就会松一口气，意识到我们作为人类是多么不完整。我们想要的不仅仅是身体上的舒适，我们想要的，是幸福，于是内心的战争开始了。

By and large, the struggle for physical survival has been eliminated for the educated classes of the industrialized nations. This security from the outside world gives us time to reflect on the world inside. Once housed, dressed, fed, and medicated, we take a breath and realize how incomplete we are as human beings. We want more than physical comfort, we want, of all things, happiness, and so begin the wars of the inner life.

然而，如果你作为一名作家，发现心灵、身体、情感和灵魂的冲突并不让你感兴趣，那么就看看第三世界，看看人类的其他人是如何生活的。大多数人都生活短暂而痛苦，饱受疾病和饥饿的折磨，被暴政和无法无天的暴力所恐吓，他们不抱希望，他们的孩子的生活会有什么不同。

If, as a writer, however, you find that the conflicts of mind, body, emotions, and soul do not interest you, then look into the Third World and see how the rest of humanity lives. The majority suffer short, painful existences, ridden with disease and hunger, terrorized by tyranny and lawless violence, without hope that life will ever be any different for their children.

如果内心生活和外部世界的冲突深度和广度都无法触动你，那就让死亡来吧。死亡就像一列未来的货运列车，向我们驶来，一分一秒地缩短从现在到那时的时间。如果我们想生活得心满意足，就必须在列车到达之前与生命的对抗力量进行交战。

If the depth and breadth of conflict in the inner life and the greater world do not move you, let this: death. Death is like a freight train in the future, heading toward us, closing the hours, second by second, between now and then. If we’re to live with any sense of satisfaction, we must engage life’s forces of antagonism before the train arrives.

一位致力于创作持久品质作品的艺术家开始意识到，生活并不是对压力或过度冲突的微妙调整犯罪大师偷来核弹，劫持城市勒索赎金。生活就是寻找爱情和自我价值、让内心的混乱平静下来、我们周围到处都是巨大的社会不平等、时间不多了等终极问题。生活就是冲突。这就是它的本质。作家必须决定在哪里以及如何安排这场斗争。

An artist intent on creating works of lasting quality comes to realize that life isn’t about subtle adjustments to stress, or hyper-conflicts of master criminals with stolen nuclear devices holding cities for ransom. Life is about the ultimate questions of finding love and self-worth, of bringing serenity to inner chaos, of the titanic social inequities everywhere around us, of time running out. Life is conflict. That is its nature. The writer must decide where and how to orchestrate this struggle.

复杂性与复杂性

Complication Versus Complexity

为了让故事复杂化，作者会逐步构建冲突，直到故事结束。这已经够难了。但当我们将故事从单纯的复杂化提升到完全的复杂化时，任务就会成倍增加。

To complicate a story the writer builds conflict progressively to the end of the line. Difficult enough. But the task increases geometrically when we take story from mere complication to full complexity.

我们已经看到，冲突可能来自对抗的任何一个、两个或所有三个层面。简单地使故事复杂化意味着将所有冲突都置于这三个层面之一。

Conflict may come, as we’ve seen, from any one, two, or all three of the levels of antagonism. To simply complicate a story means to place all conflict on only one of these three levels.

从恐怖片到动作/冒险片再到闹剧，动作英雄只在个人层面上面对冲突。例如，詹姆斯邦德没有内心冲突，我们也不会误以为他与女性的邂逅是私人的——它们只是消遣。

From the Horror Film to Action/Adventure to Farce, action heroes face conflict only on the extra-personal level. James Bond, for example, has no inner conflicts, nor would we mistake his encounters with women as personal—they’re recreational.

复杂情况：

单一层面的冲突

COMPLICATION:

CONFLICT AT ONLY ONE LEVEL

内心冲突——意识流

INNER CONFLICT — Stream of Consciousness

个人冲突——肥皂剧

PERSONAL CONFLICT — Soap Opera

个人之外的冲突——动作/冒险、闹剧

EXTRA-PERSONAL CONFLICT — Action/Adventure, Farce

复杂的电影有两个共同的特点。首先是演员阵容庞大。如果编剧把主角限制在社会冲突中，那么他将需要广告中所说的“数千名演员”。詹姆斯·邦德要面对大反派及其手下、刺客、蛇蝎美人和军队，以及帮手角色和需要救援的平民——越来越多的角色构建了邦德与社会之间越来越强大的冲突。

Complicated films share two hallmarks. The first is a large cast. If the writer restricts the protagonist to social conflict, he’ll need, as the advertising declares, “a cast of thousands.” James Bond faces arch-villains along with their minions, assassins, femmes fatale, and armies, plus helper characters and civilians needing rescue— more and more characters to build more and more powerful conflicts between Bond and society.

其次，一部复杂的电影需要多个场景和地点。如果编剧通过肢体冲突推进剧情，他就必须不断改变环境。邦德电影可能从维也纳歌剧院开始，然后去喜马拉雅山，穿过撒哈拉沙漠，穿过极地冰盖，上到月球，下到百老汇，让邦德有越来越多的机会展现令人着迷的冒险壮举。

Second, a complicated film needs multiple sets and locations. If the writer progresses via physical conflict, he must keep changing the environment. A Bond film might start in a Viennese opera house, then go to the Himalayas, across the Sahara Desert, under the polar ice cap, up to the moon, and down to Broadway, giving Bond more and more opportunities for fascinating feats of derring-do.

仅在个人冲突层面上复杂的故事被称为肥皂剧，这是家庭剧和爱情故事的开放式组合，故事中的每个角色都与故事中的其他每个角色都有着亲密的关系——众多家人、朋友和恋人，都需要布景来安置他们：客厅、卧室、办公室、夜总会、医院。肥皂剧中的角色没有内心或个人以外的冲突。当他们得不到自己想要的东西时，他们会感到痛苦，但是因为他们不是好人就是坏人，所以他们很少面临真正的内心困境。社会从不干预他们那空调般的世界。例如，如果一桩谋杀案将一名侦探——社会的代表——带入故事中，那么你可以肯定，在一周之内，这名警察将与肥皂剧中的其他每个角色建立起亲密的私人关系。

Stories that are complicated only on the level of personal conflict are known as Soap Opera, an open-ended combination of Domestic Drama and Love Story in which every character in the story has an intimate relationship with every other character in the story—a multitude of family, friends, and lovers, all needing sets to house them: living rooms, bedrooms, offices, nightclubs, hospitals. Soap Opera characters have no inner or extra-personal conflicts. They suffer when they don’t get what they want, but because they’re either good people or bad, they rarely face true inner dilemmas. Society never intervenes in their air-conditioned worlds. If, for example, a murder should bring a detective, a representative of society, into the story, you can be certain that within a week this cop will have an intimate and personal relationship with every other character in the Soap.

仅在内心冲突层面上复杂的故事不是电影、戏剧或传统小说。它们是意识流流派的散文作品，是思想和情感内在要素的语言化。同样，演员阵容庞大。即使我们置身于一个角色之中，该角色的脑海中也充满了他曾经遇到或希望遇到的每个人物的记忆和想象。更重要的是，意识流作品（如《裸体午餐》）中的意象密度如此之高，以至于地点在一句话中会改变三到四次。一连串的地点和面孔涌入读者的想象中，但这些作品都是在一个层面上，尽管主观性很强，因此，只是复杂而已。

Stories that are complicated only on the level of inner conflict are not films, plays, or conventional novels. They’re prose works in the Stream of Consciousness genre, a verbalization of the inscape of thought and feeling. Again, a large cast. Even though we’re placed inside a single character, that character’s mind is populated with the memories and imaginings of everyone he has ever met or could hope to meet. What’s more, the density of imagery in the Stream of Consciousness work, such as NAKED LUNCH, is so intense that locations change, as it were, three or four times in a single sentence. A barrage of places and faces pours through the reader’s imagination, but these works are all on one, albeit richly subjective, level and, therefore, merely complicated.

为了达到复杂性，编剧让角色在生活的三个层面上陷入冲突，而且往往是同时的。例如，过去二十年里，任何电影中最令人难忘的事件之一：《克莱默夫妇》中的法式吐司场景，看似简单，其实很复杂。这个著名的场景涉及三个价值观的复杂关系：自信、孩子对父亲的信任和尊重，以及家庭生存。场景开始时，这三个方面都处于积极状态。

To achieve complexity the writer brings his characters into conflict on all three levels of life, often simultaneously. For example, the deceptively simple but complex writing of one of the most memorable events in any film for the last two decades: the French toast scene from KRAMER VS. KRAMER. This famous scene turns on a complex of three values: self-confidence, a child’s trust and esteem for his father, and domestic survival. As the scene begins, all three are at the positive charge.

在影片的最初几秒，克莱默发现他的妻子离开了他和儿子。他内心充满矛盾，一方面怀疑和恐惧自己无法应对，另一方面男人的傲慢告诉他女人做什么都很容易。然而，当他开始表演时，他却充满信心。

In the film’s first moments Kramer discovers his wife has left him and his son. He’s torn with an inner conflict that takes the form of doubts and fears that he’s in over his head versus a male arrogance telling him whatever women do is easy. As he opens the scene, however, he’s confident.

克莱默有个人冲突。他的儿子歇斯底里，害怕没有妈妈喂他，他会饿死。克莱默试图安抚儿子，告诉他不要担心，妈妈会回来的，但与此同时这会很有趣，就像露营一样。孩子擦干眼泪，相信父亲的承诺。

Kramer has personal conflict. His son is hysterical, afraid he’ll starve without his mother to feed him. Kramer tries to calm his son, telling him not to worry, Mom will be back, but meantime it’ll be fun, like camping out. The child dries his eyes, trusting his father’s promises.

最后，克莱默遇到了个人以外的冲突。厨房是一个陌生的世界，但他却像法国厨师一样走进去。

Finally, Kramer has extra-personal conflict. The kitchen is an alien world, but he strolls into it as if he were a French chef.

克莱默把儿子抱到凳子上，问他早餐想吃什么，儿子说：“法式吐司。”克莱默深吸一口气，拿出一个煎锅，倒上一些油脂，把锅放在炉子上，一边寻找食材，一边把火调到最大。他知道法式吐司需要鸡蛋，所以他翻遍了冰箱，找到了一些鸡蛋，但不知道该把它们打碎成什么。他在橱柜里翻找，拿出一个写着“泰迪”的咖啡杯。

Perching his son on a stool, Kramer asks what he wants for breakfast and the kid says, “French toast.” Kramer takes a breath, pulls out a frying pan, pours in some grease, puts the pan on the stove, and turns the flame to high while he looks for ingredients. He knows French toast involves eggs, so he searches the refrigerator and finds some, but doesn’t know into what to break them. He rummages in the cupboard and comes down with a coffee mug that reads “Teddy.”

儿子看到了墙上的字迹，警告克莱默，他看到他妈妈这样做，而且她不使用杯子。克莱默告诉他会成功的。他打碎了鸡蛋。有些鸡蛋确实进了杯子，其余的则弄得一团糟……然后孩子开始哭了起来。

The son sees the handwriting on the wall and warns Kramer that he’s seen his mother do this and she doesn’t use a mug. Kramer tells him it’ll work. He cracks the eggs. Some actually gets into the mug, the rest makes a gooey mess… and the child starts to cry.

煎锅里的油脂开始飞溅，克莱默慌了。他没有想到要关掉煤气，而是开始与时间赛跑。他把更多的鸡蛋打进杯子里，冲回冰箱，抓起一夸脱牛奶，把它倒满杯子边缘。他找来一把黄油刀把蛋黄打碎，弄得更粘稠了。孩子知道他今天早上不会吃饭了，哭得眼睛都肿了。锅里的油脂现在冒烟了。

The grease starts to spatter in the frying pan and Kramer panics. It doesn’t occur to him to turn off the gas; instead, he engages in a race against time. He bangs more eggs into the mug, rushes back to the refrigerator, grabs a quart of milk, and slops it up and over the brim of the mug. He finds a butter knife to break up the yolks, making an even gooier mess. The child can see he is not going to eat this morning and cries his eyes out. The grease is now smoking in the pan.

绝望、愤怒的克莱默无法控制自己的恐惧，他抓起一片神奇面包，盯着它，意识到它放不进杯子里。他把它对折，塞进杯子里，抓起一把湿漉漉的面包、蛋黄和牛奶，扔到烤盘上，溅到他和孩子身上，烫伤了他们。他从炉子上拿起锅，烫伤了手，抓住儿子的胳膊，把他推到门口，说：“我们去餐馆吧。”

Kramer, desperate, angry, losing the fight to control his fears, grabs a slice of Wonder Bread, stares at it, and realizes it won’t fit in the mug. He folds it in half and stuffs it in, coming up with a dripping handful of soggy bread, yolk, and milk that he flings at the griddle, spattering and burning him and the child. He snatches the pan from the stove, scalding his hand, clutches his son’s arm, and pushes him through the door, saying, “We’ll go to a restaurant.”

克莱默的男性傲慢被恐惧所淹没，他的自信从积极变为消极。他在受惊的孩子面前蒙羞，孩子的信任和尊重从积极变为消极。他被看似生动活泼的厨房打败，鸡蛋、油脂、面包、牛奶和平底锅一一击打，把他打得踉踉跄跄地走出门外，把家庭生存从积极变为消极。这个场景几乎没有对话，只是一个男人试图为儿子做早餐的简单动作，却成为电影中最令人难忘的场景之一——一个男人与生活的复杂性同时冲突的三分钟戏剧。

Kramer’s male arrogance is overwhelmed by his fears, his self-confidence turning positive to negative. He’s humiliated in front of his frightened child, whose trust and esteem turn positive to negative. He’s defeated by a seemingly animated kitchen, as blow by blow, eggs, grease, bread, milk, and pan send him stumbling out the door, turning domestic survival from positive to negative. With very little dialogue and the simple activity of a man trying to make breakfast for his son, the scene becomes one of the most memorable in film—a three-minute drama of a man in simultaneous conflict with the complexities of life.

除非你的目标是写动作类、肥皂剧或意识流散文，否则我对大多数作家的建议是设计相对简单但复杂的故事。“相对简单”并不意味着过于简单。它意味着故事情节优美，并受以下两个原则约束：不要增加角色；不要增加地点。不要在时间、空间和人物之间跳跃，而是将自己限制在一个合理控制的演员阵容和世界中，同时专注于创造丰富的复杂性。

Unless it’s your ambition to write in the Action genres, Soap Opera, or Stream of Consciousness prose, my advice to most writers is to design relatively simple but complex stories. “Relatively simple” doesn’t mean simplistic. It means beautifully turned and told stories restrained by these two principles: Do not proliferate characters; do not multiply locations. Rather than hopscotching through time, space, and people, discipline yourself to a reasonably contained cast and world, while you concentrate on creating a rich complexity.

行为设计

Act Design

正如一首交响乐由三、四或更多乐章展开一样，故事也是通过称为幕的乐章来讲述的——幕是故事的宏观结构。

As a symphony unfolds in three, four, or more movements, so story is told in movements called acts—the macro-structure of story.

节拍，改变人类行为模式，构建场景。理想情况下，每个场景都会成为一个转折点，其中所涉及的价值观从正面转向负面或从负面转向正面，从而在他们生活中产生重大但微小的变化。一系列场景构建了一个序列，最终形成一个对角色产生中等影响的场景，比任何场景都更大程度地扭转或改变价值观。一系列序列构建了一个动作，最终在一个场景中达到高潮，从而在角色生活中产生重大逆转，比任何完成的序列都要大。

Beats, changing patterns of human behavior, build scenes. Ideally, every scene becomes a Turning Point in which the values at stake swing from the positive to the negative or the negative to the positive, creating significant but minor change in their lives. A series of scenes build a sequence that culminates in a scene that has a moderate impact on the characters, turning or changing values for better or worse to a greater degree than any scene. A series of sequences builds an act that climaxes in a scene that creates a major reversal in the characters’ lives, greater than any sequence accomplished.

在《诗学》中，亚里士多德推断，故事的大小（阅读或表演所需的时间）与讲述故事所需的主要转折点数量之间存在关系：作品越长，重大逆转就越多。换句话说，亚里士多德以他礼貌的方式恳求道：“请不要让我们感到无聊。不要让我们坐在坚硬的大理石座椅上几个小时，听着合唱和哀叹，而实际上什么也没有发生。”

In the Poetics, Aristotle deduces that there is a relationship between the size of the story—how long it takes to read or perform—and the number of major Turning Points necessary to tell it: the longer the work, the more major reversals. In other words, in his polite way, Aristotle is pleading, “Please don’t bore us. Don’t make us sit for hours on those hard marble seats listening to choral chants and laments while nothing actually happens.”

遵循亚里士多德的原则：一个故事可以用一幕来讲述——一系列场景形成几个序列，最后形成一个重大逆转，故事就结束了。但如果这样，它必须简短。这是散文短篇小说、独幕剧，或者大约五到二十分钟的学生或实验电影。

Following Aristotle’s principle: A story can be told in one act— a series of scenes that shape a few sequences that build up to one major reversal, ending the story. But if so, it must be brief. This is the prose short story, the one-act play, or the student or experimental film of perhaps five to twenty minutes.

一个故事可以分为两幕：两次重大逆转，然后结束。但同样，它必须相对简短：情景喜剧、中篇小说或长达一小时的戏剧，如安东尼·谢弗的《黑色喜剧》和奥古斯特·斯特林堡的《朱莉小姐》。

A story can be told in two acts: two major reversals and it’s over. But again it must be relatively brief: the sitcom, the novella, or hour-length plays such as Anthony Shaffer’s Black Comedy and August Strindberg’s Miss Julie.

但当一个故事达到一定规模时——故事片、一小时电视剧、长篇戏剧、小说——三幕是最低限度。这不是因为人为的惯例，而是为了服务于一个深刻的目的。

But when a story reaches a certain magnitude—the feature film, an hour-long TV episode, the full-length play, the novel— three acts is the minimum. Not because of an artificial convention, but to serve a profound purpose.

作为观众，我们拥抱故事艺术家，说：“我想要一种诗意的体验，在广度和深度上达到生命的极限。但我是一个通情达理的人。如果我只给你几分钟来阅读或见证你的工作，如果我要求你带我到达极限，那将是不公平的。相反，我只想享受片刻的快乐，一两个领悟，仅此而已。但如果我把我生命中最重要的时刻给你，我希望你是一位能够达到经验极限的强大艺术家。”

As audience we embrace the story artist and say: “I’d like a poetic experience in breadth and depth to the limits of life. But I’m a reasonable person. If I give you only a few minutes to read or witness your work, it would be unfair of me to demand that you to take me to the limit. Instead I’d like a moment of pleasure, an insight or two, no more than that. But if I give you important hours of my life, I expect you to be an artist of power who can reach the boundaries of experience.”

为了满足观众的需求，讲述触及生命最内在和最外在根源的故事，两次大逆转永远不够。无论故事的背景或范围如何，无论故事多么国际化和史诗化，还是多么亲密和内在化，三次大逆转都是一部叙事艺术长篇作品走向终点的必要最低限​​度。

In our effort to satisfy the audience’s need, to tell stories that touch the innermost and outermost sources of life, two major reversals are never enough. No matter the setting or scope of the telling, no matter how international and epic or intimate and interior, three major reversals are the necessary minimum for a full-length work of narrative art to reach the end of the line.

考虑这些节奏：事情一开始很糟糕，然后变好了——故事结束。或者事情一开始很好，然后变坏了——故事结束。或者事情一开始很糟糕，然后变得非常糟糕——故事结束。或者事情一开始很好，然后变得非常好——故事结束。在这四种情况下，我们都觉得缺少了一些东西。我们知道第二个事件，无论是积极的还是消极的，都不是结局也不是极限。即使第二个事件杀死了演员：事情一开始很好（或很糟糕），然后每个人都死了——故事结束——这也不够。“好吧，他们都死了。现在怎么办？”我们想知道。第三个转折缺失了，我们知道在至少发生一次重大逆转之前，我们没有触及极限。因此，在亚里士多德注意到三幕故事节奏之前的几个世纪里，它一直是故事艺术的基础。

Consider these rhythms: Things were bad, then they were good—end of story. Or things were good, then they were bad— end of story. Or things were bad, then they were very bad—end of story. Or things were good, then they were very good—end of story. In all four cases we feel something’s lacking. We know that the second event, whether positively or negatively charged, is neither the end nor the limit. Even if the second event kills the cast: Things were good (or bad), then everyone died—end of story—it’s not enough. “Okay, they’re all dead. Now what?” we’re wondering. The third turn is missing and we know we haven’t touched the limit until at least one more major reversal occurs. Therefore, the three-act story rhythm was the foundation of story art for centuries before Aristotle noted it.

但它只是一个基础，而不是一个公式，所以我将从它开始，然后描述它的一些无限变化。我将使用的比例是故事片的节奏，但原则上它们同样适用于戏剧和小说。再次提醒，这些都是近似值，而不是公式。

But it’s only a foundation, not a formula, so I’ll begin with it, then delineate some of its infinite variations. The proportions I’ll use are the rhythms of the feature film, but in principle they apply equally to the play and novel. Again, I caution that these are approximations, not formulas.

第一幕，即开场乐章，通常占了故事叙述的 25% 左右，第一幕高潮发生在 120 分钟的电影中的 20 到 30 分钟之间。最后一幕应该是最短的。在理想的最后一幕中，我们希望给观众一种加速的感觉，即迅速上升到高潮的动作。如果编剧试图延长最后一幕，那么加速的速度几乎肯定会在动作中途放慢。所以最后一幕通常很短，20 分钟或更短。

The first act, the opening movement, typically consumes about 25 percent of the telling, the Act One Climax occurring between twenty and thirty minutes into a 120-minute film. The last act wants to be the shortest of all. In the ideal last act we want to give the audience a sense of acceleration, a swiftly rising action to Climax. If the writer tries to stretch out the last act, the pace of acceleration is almost certain to slow in mid-movement. So last acts are generally brief, twenty minutes or less.

假设一部 120 分钟的电影将中心情节的激励事件放在第一分钟，第一幕高潮放在三十分钟，第三幕为十八分钟，结局为两分钟，然后淡出。这种节奏使得第二幕长达七十分钟。如果一个原本讲得很好的故事陷入困境，就会发生这种情况——因为作者在漫长的第二幕中摸索前行。有两种可能的解决方案：添加次要情节或更多幕。

Let’s say a 120-minute film places its Central Plot’s Inciting Incident in the first minute, the Act One Climax at the thirty-minute point, has an eighteen-minute Act Three, and a two-minute Resolution to FADE OUT. This rhythm creates an Act Two that’s seventy minutes long. If an otherwise well-told story bogs down, that’s where it’ll happen—as the writer sloshes through the swamps of the long second act. There are two possible solutions: Add subplots or more acts.

次要情节有自己的幕结构，尽管通常很短。在上述中心情节的三幕设计之间，我们来编织三个次要情节：一个单幕次要情节 A，在电影开始 25 分钟时发生一个激励事件，在 60 分钟时达到高潮并结束：一个两幕次情节 B，其激励事件发生在十五分钟处，第一幕高潮发生在四十五分钟处，以第二幕高潮在七十五分钟处结束；三幕次情节 C，其激励事件发生在中心情节的激励事件内部（例如，恋人相遇，并在警察发现引发中心情节的犯罪行为的同一场景中开始了次情节），第一幕高潮发生在五十分钟处，第二幕高潮发生在九十分钟处，第三幕高潮发生在中心情节的最后一个高潮内部（恋人决定在他们抓获罪犯的同一场景中结婚）。

Subplots have their own act structure, although usually brief. Between the central plot’s three-act design above, let’s weave three subplots: a one-act Subplot A with an Inciting Incident twenty-five minutes into the film, climaxing and ending at sixty minutes: a two-act Subplot B with an Inciting Incident at the fifteen-minute point, an Act One Climax at forty-five minutes, ending with an Act Two Climax at seventy-five minutes; a three-act Subplot C is with its Inciting Incident happening inside the Inciting Incident of the Central Plot (lovers meet, for example, and start a subplot in the same scene cops discover the crime that launches the central plot), an Act One Climax at fifty minutes, an Act Two Climax at ninety minutes, and a third act climaxing inside the Central Plot’s last Climax (the lovers decide to marry in the same scene that they apprehend the criminal).

尽管主情节和三个次情节可能有多达四个不同的主角，但观众可以同情他们所有人，并且每个次情节都会提出自己的主要戏剧问题。因此，观众的兴趣和情感被四个故事吸引、保持和放大。更重要的是，这三个次情节有五个重大逆转，这些逆转发生在主情节的第一幕和第二幕高潮之间——足够多的故事情节让整部电影继续发展，加深观众的参与度，并收紧主情节第二幕的软肋。

Although the Central Plot and three subplots may have up to four different protagonists, an audience could empathize with all of them, and each subplot raises its own Major Dramatic Question. So the interest and emotions of the audience are hooked, held, and amplified by four stories. What’s more, the three subplots have five major reversals that fall between the Central Plot’s Act One and Act Two climaxes—more than enough storytelling to keep the overall film progressing, deepen the involvement of the audience, and tighten the soft belly of the Central Plot’s second act.

另一方面，并​​非每部电影都需要或想要一个次要情节：《亡命天涯》。那么编剧该如何解决第二幕过长的问题呢？通过创作更多幕。三幕设计是最低要求。如果编剧在故事中途建立起向重大逆转的进展，他会将故事分成四个乐章，每个乐章不超过三四十分钟。大卫在《闪亮的风采》中演奏完拉赫玛尼诺夫的第三钢琴协奏曲后晕倒就是一个极好的例子。在好莱坞，这种技巧被称为“中幕高潮”，这个术语听起来像性功能障碍，但意思是第二幕中间出现重大逆转，将设计从三幕扩展为易卜生式的四幕节奏，加快了中段影片的节奏。

On the other hand, not every film needs or wants a subplot: THE FUGITIVE. How then does the writer solve the problem of the long second act? By creating more acts. The three-act design is the minimum. If the writer builds progressions to a major reversal at the halfway point, he breaks the story into four movements with no act more than thirty or forty minutes long. David’s collapse after performing Rachmaninoff’s Piano Concerto No. 3 in SHINE is a superb example. In Hollywood this technique is known as the Mid-Act Climax, a term that sounds like sexual dysfunction, but means a major reversal in the middle of Act Two, expanding the design from three acts to an Ibsen-like rhythm of four acts, accelerating the mid-film pace.

一部电影可以有五幕莎士比亚式的节奏：四个婚礼和一个葬礼。或者更多。《夺宝奇兵》有七幕；《厨师、小偷、他的妻子和她的情人》有八幕。这些电影每十五分钟就会出现一次重大逆转或二十分钟，果断解决第二幕的冗长问题。但五到八幕的设计是个例外，因为解决一个问题会引发其他问题。

A film could have a Shakespearean rhythm of five acts: FOUR WEDDINGS AND A FUNERAL. Or more. RAIDERS OF THE LOST ARK is in seven acts; THE COOK, THE THIEF, HIS WIFE & HER LOVER in eight. These films turn a major reversal every fifteen or twenty minutes, decisively solving the long second act problem. But the five- to eight-act design is the exception, for the cure of one problem is the cause of others.

首先，高潮部分的增多容易造成陈词滥调。

First, the multiplication of act climaxes invites clichés.

一般来说，一个三幕故事需要四个令人难忘的场景：开启故事的激励事件，以及第一幕、第二幕和第三幕高潮。在《克莱默夫妇》的激励事件中，克莱默太太抛弃了她的丈夫和儿子。第一幕高潮：她回来要求孩子的监护权。第二幕高潮：法院将儿子的监护权判给了他的母亲。第三幕高潮：像她的前夫一样，她意识到他们必须无私地为他们所爱的孩子的最大利益而行动，并将男孩归还给克莱默。四个强大的转折点贯穿着出色的场景和序列。

Generally, a three-act story requires four memorable scenes: the Inciting Incident that opens the telling, and an Act One, Act Two, and Act Three Climax. In the Inciting Incident of KRAMER VS. KRAMER Mrs. Kramer walks out on her husband and her son. Act One Climax: She returns, demanding custody of the child. Act Two Climax: The court awards custody of the son to his mother. Act Three Climax: Like her ex-husband, she realizes that they must act selflessly for the best interest of the child they love and returns the boy to Kramer. Four powerful turning points spanned with excellent scenes and sequences.

当编剧增加幕数时，他强行创作了五、六、七、八、九或更多精彩的场景。这成为他力所不及的创作任务，因此他诉诸于许多动作片中常见的陈词滥调。

When the writer multiplies acts, he’s forcing the invention of five, perhaps six, seven, eight, nine, or more brilliant scenes. This becomes a creative task beyond his reach, so he resorts to the clichés that infest so many action films.

其次，幕数的增加降低了高潮的冲击力，造成了重复性。

Second, the multiplication of acts reduces the impact of climaxes and results in repetitiousness.

即使编剧觉得他能每隔十五分钟就创造一个重大反转，把生死、生死、生死、生死、生死、生死的场景变成高潮，七八次，也会让人感到无聊。不久观众就会打哈欠：“这不是一个重大转折。这就是他的一天。每隔十五分钟就会有人试图杀死他。”

Even if the writer feels he’s up to creating a major reversal every fifteen minutes, turning act climaxes on scenes of life and death, life and death, life and death, life and death, life and death, seven or eight times over, boredom sets in. Before too long the audience is yawning: “That’s not a major turn. That’s his day. Every fifteen minutes somebody tries to kill the guy.”

主线剧情与中线剧情和次线剧情是相对的。如果每个场景都大声喊叫，我们就会听不见。当太多场景都力图达到高潮时，本该是主线剧情的剧情就会变得次要、重复，最终停滞不前。这就是为什么三幕主线剧情加上次要剧情成为一种标准。它符合大多数作家的创造力，提供了复杂性，并避免了重复。

What is major is relative to what is moderate and minor. If every scene screams to be heard, we go deaf. When too many scenes strive to be powerhouse climaxes, what should be major becomes minor, repetitious, running downhill to a halt. This is why a three-act Central Plot with subplots has become a kind of standard. It fits the creative powers of most writers, provides complexity, and avoids repetition.

设计变化

Design Variations

首先，故事根据讲述过程中重大逆转的数目而各有不同：从《离开拉斯维加斯》中一幕或两幕的小情节，到《大审判》中三幕或四幕加次情节的大情节，到《生死时速》中许多动作类型电影的七幕或八幕，再到《资产阶级的审慎魅力》中混乱不堪的反情节，甚至没有主情节的多情节电影，比如《喜福会》，但其各个故事情节中可能包含十几个或更多的重大转折点。

First, stories vary according to the number of major reversals in the telling: from the one- or two-act design of Miniplots, LEAVING LAS VEGAS, through the three- or four-acts plus subplots of most Archplots, THE VERDICT, to the seven or eight acts of many action genres, SPEED, to the helter-skelter patterns of Antiplots, THE DISCREET CHARM OF THE BOURGEOISIE, and beyond to Multiplot films that have no Central Plot, THE JOY LUCK CLUB, but may contain a dozen or more major Turning Points over their various story lines.

其次，故事的形状根据激励事件的位置而变化。传统上，激励事件在故事讲述的很早的时候就发生了，然后逐渐发展成一个主要的故事。反转发生在第一幕高潮二十或三十分钟后。这种模式要求编剧在电影的前四分之一处安排两个主要场景。然而，激励事件可能在讲述二十、三十分钟甚至更长时间后才出现。例如，《洛奇》的中心情节激励事件出现得非常晚。这样做的结果是，激励事件实际上成为第一幕高潮，并起到两个作用。

Second, the shapes of stories vary according to the placement of the Inciting Incident. Conventionally, the Inciting Incident occurs very early in the telling and progressions build to a major reversal at the Act One Climax twenty or thirty minutes later. This pattern requires the writer to place two major scenes in the first quarter of the film. However, the Inciting Incident may enter as late as twenty, thirty, or more minutes into the telling. ROCKY, for example, has a very late-arriving Central Plot Inciting Incident. The effect of this is that the Inciting Incident becomes, in effect, the first act Climax and serves two purposes.

然而，这并非为了方便作者而做。推迟主情节出现的唯一原因是观众需要详细了解主角，以便充分对激励事件做出反应。如果这是必要的，那么必须有一个设置好的次情节来开启讲述。《洛基》有一个次情节，即阿德里安和洛基的爱情故事；《卡萨布兰卡》有五个次情节，其中拉兹洛、乌加特、伊冯娜和保加利亚妻子是单个主角，难民是复数主角。必须讲述故事来吸引观众，让他们等待迟到的主情节成熟。

This, however, cannot be done for the convenience of the writer. The only reason to delay the entrance of the Central Plot is the audience’s need to know the protagonist at length so it can fully react to the Inciting Incident. If this is necessary, then a setup subplot must open the telling. ROCKY has one, the Adrian/Rocky Love Story; CASABLANCA uses five with Laszlo, Ugarte, Yvonne, and the Bulgarian wife as single protagonists and refugees as the plural protagonist. Story must be told to hold the audience while it waits for a late-arriving Central Plot to ripen.

但是，假设时机成熟是在第一分钟到第三十分钟之间。那么电影是否需要一个设置好的次要情节来支撑开场？也许……也许不需要。《绿野仙踪》的激励事件发生在第 15 分钟，当时一场旋风将多萝西（朱迪·加兰饰）带到了芒奇金国。没有次要情节来设置这一点，而是通过戏剧化的展示来吸引我们，展示她渴望去“彩虹之上的某个地方”。在《亚当的肋骨》中，激励事件也在电影开始 15 分钟后出现，地方检察官亚当·邦纳（斯宾塞·屈塞饰）和他的辩护律师妻子阿曼达（凯瑟琳·赫本饰）发现自己站在审判的对立面。在本案中，影片以一个次要情节开场，被告（朱迪·霍利迪饰）发现丈夫有染并开枪打死了他。这引出了主情节的煽动事件。

Suppose, however, the ripe moment is reached somewhere between the first and thirtieth minute. Does a film then need a setup subplot to carry the opening? Maybe… maybe not. The Inciting Incident of THE WIZARD OF OZ occurs at the fifteen-minute mark when a cyclone carries Dorothy (Judy Garland) to Munchkinland. There’s no subplot to set this up, rather we’re held by dramatized exposition of her longing to go “somewhere over the rainbow.” In ADAM’S RIB the Inciting Incident also arrives fifteen minutes into the film, as district attorney Adam Bonner (Spencer Tracy) and his defense attorney wife Amanda (Katharine Hepburn) discover themselves on opposing sides of a trial. In this case, the film opens with a setup subplot as defendant (Judy Holliday) discovers her husband’s philandering and shoots him. This hooks and carries us to the Central Plot’s Inciting Incident.

既然在十五分钟时发生了一个激励事件，那么作者是否需要在三十分钟时来一个重大逆转？也许……也许不需要。在《绿野仙踪》中，多萝西受到西方邪恶女巫的威胁，得到了一双红拖鞋，并在激励事件发生十五分钟后沿着黄砖路踏上征程。在《亚当的肋骨》中，主线情节的下一个重大逆转发生在激励事件发生四十分钟后，当时阿曼达在法庭上赢得了一个关键点。然而，一段关系次要情节使这一情节变得复杂，因为作曲家（大卫·韦恩）公开向阿曼达调情，这让亚当非常恼火。

With an Inciting Incident at the fifteen-minute point, does the writer need a major reversal at the thirty-minute point? Maybe… maybe not. In THE WIZARD OF OZ Dorothy is threatened by the Wicked Witch of the West, given the red slippers, and sent on her quest along the yellow brick road fifteen minutes after the Inciting Incident. In ADAM’S RIB the next major reversal of the Central Plot happens forty minutes after the Inciting Incident when Amanda wins a key point in court. However, a relationship subplot complicates this stretch as a composer (David Wayne), to Adam’s great annoyance, flirts openly with Amanda.

幕间动作的节奏由主情节的激励事件的位置决定。因此，幕间结构千差万别。主情节和次情节的主要反转数量和位置是艺术家和素材之间创造性游戏的选择，取决于主角的质量和数量、对抗的来源、类型，以及最终作家的个性和世界观。

The rhythm of act movements is established by the location of the Central Plot’s Inciting Incident. Act structure, therefore, varies enormously. The number and placement of the major reversals for both main plot and subplots are choices made in the creative play between artist and material, depending on quality and number of protagonists, sources of antagonism, genre, and, ultimately, the personality and worldview of the writer.

假结局

False Ending

偶尔，尤其是在动作片中，在倒数第二幕高潮或最后一幕动作中，编剧会创造一个假结局：一个看似完整的场景，让我们一度以为故事已经结束。外星人死了——我们认为电影结束了。在《异形》中，我们认为蕾普莉炸毁了她的宇宙飞船并逃走了。在《异形》中，我们希望她炸毁了整个星球并逃走了。在《巴西》中，乔纳森（山姆·劳瑞饰）从暴政手中救出了金（吉尔·莱顿饰），恋人拥抱在一起，幸福的结局……还是这样？

Occasionally, especially in Action genres, at the Penultimate Act Climax or within the last act’s movement, the writer creates a False Ending: a scene so seemingly complete we think for a moment the story is over. E.T. is dead—end of movie, we think. In ALIEN Ripley blows up her spaceship and escapes, we think. In ALIENS she blows up an entire planet and escapes, we hope. In BRAZIL Jonathan (Sam Lowry) rescues Kim (Jill Layton) from a tyrannical regime, the lovers embrace, happy ending… or is it?

《终结者》设计了一个双重假结局：瑞茜（迈克尔·比恩饰）和莎拉（琳达·汉密尔顿饰）用一罐汽油炸毁了终结者（阿诺德·施瓦辛格饰），它的肉体被烧毁了。这对恋人庆祝了一番。但随后镀铬内饰这个半人半机器人的版本从火焰中升起。里斯牺牲了自己的生命，把一个管状炸弹放在终结者的腹部，把它炸成两半。但随后，这个生物的躯干复活了，用爪子向受伤的女主角爬去，直到莎拉最终摧毁了他。

TERMINATOR devised a double False Ending: Reese (Michael Biehn) and Sarah (Linda Hamilton) blow up the Terminator (Arnold Schwarzenegger) with a tankard of gasoline, its flesh burning away. The lovers celebrate. But then the chrome inner version of this half-man/half-robot rises out of the flames. Reese sacrifices his life to put a pipe bomb in the belly of the Terminator and blow it in half. But then the creature’s torso revives and crawls claw over claw toward the wounded heroine until Sarah finally destroys him.

假结局甚至可能出现在艺术电影中。在《蒙特利尔的耶稣》的高潮部分，扮演耶稣受难剧中耶稣的演员丹尼尔（洛泰尔·布鲁托饰）被掉落的十字架击中。其他演员将昏迷的他送往急诊室，但他醒了，我们祈祷他复活了。

False Endings may even find their way into Art Films. Near the climax of JESUS OF MONTREAL Daniel (Lothaire Bluteau), an actor playing Christ in a Passion Play, is bludgeoned by his falling crucifix. Other actors rush him unconscious to the emergency room, but he awakes, resurrected, we pray.

希区柯克喜欢假结局，为了达到震撼效果，他把假结局安排得非常早。玛德琳（金·诺瓦克饰）的“自杀”是《迷魂记》中幕高潮，之后她以朱迪的身份再次出现。玛丽安（珍妮特·利饰）在淋浴时被谋杀标志着《惊魂记》第一幕高潮，突然将类型从犯罪片转变为心理惊悚片，主角也从玛丽安变成了死者姐姐、情人和私家侦探的多重主角。

Hitchcock loved False Endings, placing them unconventionally early for shock effect. The “suicide” of Madeleine (Kim Novak) is the Mid-Act Climax of VERTIGO before she reappears as Judy. The shower murder of Marion (Janet Leigh) marks the Act One Climax of PSYCHO, suddenly shifting genres from Caper to Psycho-Thriller and switching protagonists from Marion to a plural protagonist of the dead woman’s sister, lover, and a private eye.

然而，对于大多数电影来说，假结局并不合适。相反，倒数第二幕高潮应该强化主要戏剧问题：“现在会发生什么？”

For most films, however, the False Ending is inappropriate. Instead, the Penultimate Act Climax should intensify the Major Dramatic Question: “Now what’s going to happen?”

表演节奏

Act Rhythm

重复是节奏的大敌。故事的动态取决于其价值负荷的交替。例如，故事中最有力的两个场景是最后两幕高潮。在银幕上，它们通常只相隔十到十五分钟。因此，它们不能重复相同的负荷。如果主角实现了他的欲望目标，使最后一幕的故事高潮成为积极的，那么倒数第二幕的高潮一定是消极的。你不能用一个向上的结局来设置一个向上的结局：“事情很美好……然后变得更好了！”相反，如果主角未能实现他的愿望，倒数第二幕的高潮就不能是消极的。你不能用一个向下的结局来设置一个向下的结局：“事情很糟糕……然后变得更糟了。”当情感体验重复时，第二个事件的力量就会减半。如果故事高潮的力量减半，影片的力量也减半。

Repetitiousness is the enemy of rhythm. The dynamics of story depend on the alternation of its value-charges. For example, the two most powerful scenes in a story are the last two act climaxes. Onscreen they’re often only ten or fifteen minutes apart. Therefore, they cannot repeat the same charge. If the protagonist achieves his Object of Desire, making the last act’s Story Climax positive, then the Penultimate Act Climax must be negative. You cannot set up an up-ending with an up-ending: “Things were wonderful… then they got even better!” Conversely, if the protagonist fails to achieve his desire, the Climax of the Penultimate Act cannot be negative. You cannot set up a down-ending with a down-ending: “Things were terrible… then they got even worse.” When emotional experience repeats, the power of the second event is cut in half. And if the power of the Story Climax is halved, the power of the film is halved.

另一方面，故事的高潮可能带有讽刺意味，即既有积极意义又有消极意义的结局。那么，倒数第二个高潮的情感负荷应该是什么呢？答案就在对故事高潮的仔细研究中，因为尽管讽刺有积极意义，也有消极意义，但它永远不应该被平衡。如果是这样，积极和消极的价值就会相互抵消，故事就会以平淡的中立结束。

On the other hand, a story may climax in irony, an ending that’s both positive and negative. What then must be the emotional charge of the Penultimate Climax? The answer’s found in close study of the Story Climax, for although irony is somewhat positive, somewhat negative, it should never be balanced. If it is, the positive and negative values cancel each other out and the story ends in a bland neutrality.

例如，奥赛罗终于实现了他的愿望：一个爱他的妻子，她从未背叛过他，与另一个男人在一起——这是积极的。然而，当他发现这一点时，已经太晚了，因为他刚刚谋杀了她——这是一个整体的负面讽刺。索菲尔夫人在监狱里度过了余生——这是消极的。但她昂首挺胸地走进监狱，因为她实现了自己的愿望，即超然的浪漫体验——这是一个整体的积极讽刺。经过仔细的思考和感受，作家研究了他的讽刺，以确保它倾向于某一方，然后设计了一个倒数第二高潮来与其整体的情感冲击相矛盾。

For example, Othello finally achieves his desire: a wife who loves him and has never betrayed him with another man—positive. However, when he discovers this, it’s too late because he’s just murdered her—an overall negative irony. Mrs. Soffel goes to prison for the rest of her life—negative. But she goes into jail with her head up because she’s achieved her desire, the transcendent romantic experience—an overall positive irony. With careful thought and feeling the writer studies his irony to make certain it leans one way or the other, and then designs a Penultimate Climax to contradict its overall emotional charge.

从倒数第二个高潮回溯到开场，前几幕高潮之间的距离更远，往往是次要情节和序列高潮在它们之间产生情感作用，形成一种独特的正反转折节奏。因此，尽管我们知道终极高潮和倒数第二个高潮必须相互矛盾，但从一个故事到另一个故事，没有办法预测其他幕高潮的节奏。每部电影都有自己的节奏，所有的变化都是可能的。

Working back from the Penultimate Climax to the opening scene, previous act climaxes are further apart, often with subplot and sequence climaxes coming into emotional play between them, creating a unique rhythm of positive and negative turnings. Consequently, although we know that the Ultimate and Penultimate Climaxes must contradict each other, from story to story there is no way to predict the charges of the other act climaxes. Each film finds its own rhythm and all variations are possible.

子情节和多重情节

Subplots and Multiple Plots

与主情节相比，次情节受到的重视和放映时间较少，但通常正是次情节的发明将一个陷入困境的剧本提升为一部值得制作的电影。例如，如果没有大城市警察和阿米什寡妇之间的爱情故事次情节，《证人》就不会是一部引人入胜的惊悚片。另一方面，多情节电影从不发展主情节；而是编织将多个子情节规模的故事串联起来。在主情节和其子情节之间，或在多重情节的各情节线之间，存在四种可能的关系。

A subplot receives less emphasis and screentime than a Central Plot, but often it’s the invention of a subplot that lifts a troubled screenplay to a film worth making. WITNESS, for example, without its Love Story subplot of big-city cop and Amish widow would be a less than compelling Thriller. Multiplot films, on the other hand, never develop a Central Plot; rather they weave together a number of stories of subplot size. Between the Central Plot and its subplots or between the various plot lines of a Multiplot, four possible relationships come into play.

可以使用次要情节来与主情节的控制思想相矛盾，从而为影片增添讽刺意味。

A subplot may be used to contradict the Controlling Idea of the Central Plot and thus enrich the film with irony.

假设你正在写一个结局美满的爱情故事，其主控思想是“爱情之所以胜利，是因为恋人为了彼此牺牲了自己的需要。”你相信你的角色，相信他们的激情和自我牺牲，但你觉得这个故事变得太甜蜜、太轻率了。为了平衡故事情节，你可能会创建一个次要情节，讲述另外两个角色的爱情以悲剧收场，因为他们出于感情贪婪而背叛了对方。这个结局悲观的次要情节与结局乐观的主情节相矛盾，使电影的整体含义更加复杂和讽刺：“爱情是双向的：当我们给予它自由时，我们拥有它，但占有欲会摧毁它。”

Suppose you were writing a happy-ending Love Story with the Controlling Idea “Love triumphs because the lovers sacrifice their needs for each other.” You believe in your characters, their passion and self-sacrifice, yet you feel the story’s becoming too sweet, too pat. To balance the telling, you might then create a subplot of two other characters whose love ends tragically because they betray each other out of emotional greed. This down-ending subplot contradicts the up-ending Central Plot, making the film’s overall meaning more complex and ironic: “Love cuts two ways: we possess it when we give it freedom, but destroy it with possessiveness.”

次要情节可用来与中心情节的主控思想产生共鸣，并通过主题的变化来丰富影片。

Subplots may be used to resonate the Controlling Idea of the Central Plot and enrich the film with variations on a theme.

如果次要情节表达了与主要情节相同的主控思想，但方式不同，也许不寻常，那么它会产生一种强化和巩固主题的变化。例如，《仲夏夜之梦》中的许多爱情故事结局都很幸福——但有些结局甜蜜，有些结局滑稽，有些结局崇高。

If a subplot expresses the same Controlling Idea as the main plot, but in a different, perhaps unusual way, it creates a variation that strengthens and reinforces the theme. All the many love stories in A MIDSUMMER NIGHT’S DREAM, for example, end happily—but some sweetly, some farcically, some sublimely.

主题矛盾和变化的原则是多情节电影的起源。多情节电影没有中心情节主线来在结构上统一叙事。相反，多条情节线要么交叉剪辑，如《捷径》，要么通过一个主题连接起来，如《二十美元》中从一个故事传到另一个故事的二十美元钞票，或《游泳者》中连接故事的一系列游泳池——一组“肋骨”，但没有单独的情节线足够强大，能够从第一幕撑到最后一幕。那么是什么支撑起这部电影呢？一个想法。

The principle of thematic contradiction and variation is the genesis of Multiplot films. A Multiplot has no Central Plot Spine to structurally unify the telling. Instead, a number of plot lines either cross-cut, as in SHORT CUTS, or connect via a motif such as the twenty-dollar bill that passes from story to story in TWENTY BUCKS or the series of swimming pools that link the tales in THE SWIMMER—a collection of “ribs” but no individual plot line strong enough to carry from first scene to last. What then holds the film together? An idea.

《为人父母》以不同的方式演绎了“为人父母的游戏，你无法取胜”这一理念。史蒂夫·马丁饰演世界上最细心的父亲，他的孩子最终还是接受了心理治疗。杰森·罗巴兹饰演世界上最疏忽大意的父亲，他的孩子在晚年需要他，然后又背叛了他。黛安·韦斯特饰演一位母亲，她试图为孩子做出所有安全的人生决定，但孩子比她更了解。父母所能做的就是爱他们的孩子，支持他们，在他们跌倒时扶起他们。但在这场游戏中，没有赢家这回事。

PARENTHOOD plays variations on the notion that in the game of parenthood you cannot win. Steve Martin plays the world’s most attentive father whose child still ends up in therapy. Jason Robards plays the world’s most neglectful father whose kid comes back late in life needing him, then betraying him. Dianne Wiest portrays a mother who tries to make all the safe life decisions for her child, but the child knows better than she does. All parents can do is love their children, support them, pick them up when they fall. But there’s no such thing as winning this game.

《DINER》反映了男人无法与女人交流这一理念。芬威克（凯文·贝肯饰）无法与女人交谈。布吉（米基·洛克饰）不停地与女人交谈，但只是为了把她们哄上床。埃迪（史蒂夫·古根伯格饰）不肯娶他的未婚妻，除非她能通过足球知识测试。当比利（蒂莫西·达利饰）面对他心爱的女人的情感问题时，他放松了警惕，与她坦诚交谈。一旦能够与女人交流，他就会离开他的朋友——这一决定与其他决定相矛盾，更添一层讽刺意味。

DINER resonates with the idea that men cannot communicate with women. Fenwick (Kevin Bacon) cannot bring himself to speak to a woman. Boogie (Mickey Rourke) talks nonstop to women, but only to get them into bed. Eddie (Steve Guttenberg) won’t marry his fiancée until she can pass a test in football trivia. When Billy (Timothy Daly) faces his emotional issues with the woman he loves, he lets his guard down and talks honestly with her. Once able to communicate with a woman, he leaves his friends—a resolution that contradicts all others to add a layer of irony.

多情节塑造了一个特定社会的形象，但与静态的非情节不同，它围绕一个想法编织了一些小故事，因此这些合影充满了活力。《为所应为》描绘了大城市种族主义的普遍性；《捷径》描绘了美国中产阶级的冷漠；《吃喝男人女人》描绘了父女关系的三联画。多情节让作家兼具了两全其美：一幅描绘文化或社区精髓的肖像，以及足够的叙事驱动力来激发兴趣。

The Multiplot frames an image of a particular society, but, unlike the static Nonplot, it weaves small stories around an idea, so that these group photos vibrate with energy. DO THE RIGHT THING depicts the universality of big-city racism; SHORT CUTS landscapes the soullessness of the American middle class; EAT DRINK MAN WOMAN paints a triptych of the father/daughter relationship. Multiplot gives the writer the best of both worlds: a portrait that captures the essence of a culture or community along with ample narrative drive to compel interest.

当中心情节的激励事件必须延迟时，可能需要设置一个子情节来开启故事叙述。

When the Central Plot’s Inciting Incident must be delayed, a setup subplot may be needed to open the storytelling.

迟到的中心情节——《洛奇》、《唐人街》、《卡萨布兰卡》——在前三十分钟留下了故事空白，必须用次要情节来吸引观众的兴趣，让他们熟悉主人公及其世界，从而引起观众对激励事件的充分反应。设置次要情节将主情节的展开戏剧化，以便观众以流畅、间接的方式吸收它。

A late-arriving Central Plot—ROCKY, CHINATOWN, CASABLANCA—leaves a story vacuum for the first thirty minutes that must be filled by subplots to engage the audience’s interest and acquaint it with the protagonist and his world in order to evoke a full reaction to its Inciting Incident. A setup subplot dramatizes the Central Plot’s exposition so that it’s absorbed in a fluid, indirect manner.

可以使用子情节来使中心情节复杂化。

A subplot may be used to complicate the Central Plot.

第四种关系是最重要的：将次要情节作为额外的对抗来源。例如，通常在《犯罪故事》中可以找到的爱情故事：在《爱之海》中，弗兰克·凯勒（阿尔·帕西诺饰）爱上了海伦（艾伦·巴金饰）。在追捕她精神病前夫时，他冒着生命危险保护他心爱的女人。在《黑寡妇》中，一名联邦特工（德博拉·温格饰）迷恋上了杀手本人（特里莎·拉塞尔）。在法庭剧《大审判》中，弗兰克（保罗·纽曼饰）爱上了对方律师事务所的间谍劳拉（夏洛特·兰普林饰）。这些次要情节增加了人物的维度，为主情节的紧张或暴力创造了喜剧或浪漫的缓解，但它们的主要目的都是让主角的生活更加艰难。

This fourth relationship is the most important: use of the subplot as an additional source of antagonism. For example, the Love Story typically found inside Crime Stories: In SEA OF LOVE Frank Keller (Al Pacino) falls in love with Helen (Ellen Barkin). While hunting down her psychotic ex-husband, he risks his life to protect the woman he loves. In BLACK WIDOW a federal agent (Debra Winger) becomes infatuated with the killer herself (Theresa Russell). In THE VERDICT, a Courtroom Drama, Frank (Paul Newman) falls in love with Laura (Charlotte Rampling), a spy from the opposing law firm. These subplots add dimension to characters, create comic or romantic relief from the tensions or violence of the Central Plot, but their primary purpose is to make life more difficult for the protagonist.

必须小心控制主情节和次情节之间的平衡，否则作者可能会失去对主要故事的关注。设置次情节尤其危险，因为它可能会误导观众对类型的判断。例如，《洛奇》的开场爱情故事就经过精心处理，因此我们知道我们正朝着体育类型发展。

The balance of emphasis between the Central Plot and subplot has to be carefully controlled, or the writer risks losing focus on the primary story. A setup subplot is particularly dangerous in that it may mislead the audience as to genre. The opening Love Story of ROCKY, for example, was carefully handled so that we knew we were heading for the Sports Genre.

此外，如果主情节和次情节的主角不是同一个人物，则必须注意不要让观众过多地同情次情节的主角。例如，《卡萨布兰卡》有一个政治剧情次情节，涉及维克多·拉兹洛（保罗·海因里德饰）的命运，还有一个以乌加特（彼得·洛饰）为中心的惊悚剧情次情节，但这两个情节都被淡化了，以将情感焦点集中在主情节中里克（亨弗莱·鲍嘉饰）和伊尔莎（英格丽·褒曼饰）的爱情故事上。为了淡化次情节，可以将其中的一些元素（激励事件、幕高潮、危机、高潮或结局）保留在屏幕外。

Additionally, if the protagonists of the Central Plot and subplot are not the same character, care must be taken not to draw too much empathy to the subplot’s protagonist. CASABLANCA, for example, has a Political Drama subplot involving the fate of Victor Laszlo (Paul Heinreid) and a Thriller subplot centered on Ugarte (Peter Lorre), but both were deemphasized to keep the emotional spotlight on the Central Plot’s Love Story of Rick (Humphrey Bogart) and Ilsa (Ingrid Bergman). To deemphasize a subplot, some of its elements—Inciting Incident, act climaxes, Crisis, Climax, or Resolution—may be kept offscreen.

另一方面，如果在剧本创作过程中，你的子情节似乎需要更多的关注和同理心，那么请重新考虑整体设计并将你的子情节转变为中心情节。

If, on the other hand, as you develop your screenplay, your subplot seems to demand greater focus and empathy, then reconsider the overall design and turn your subplot into the Central Plot.

如果次要情节在主题上不与主情节的主控思想相矛盾或产生共鸣，如果它没有为主情节的激励事件做铺垫，或者使主情节的动作复杂化，如果它只是与主情节并行，它就会把故事一分为二，破坏其效果。观众理解审美统一的原则。它知道每个故事元素的存在都是因为它与其他每个元素之间的关系。这种关系，无论是结构上的还是主题上的，都将作品联系在一起。如果观众找不到它，他们就会脱离故事，有意识地试图强行实现统一。当这失败时，它就会陷入混乱。

If a subplot doesn’t thematically contradict or resonate the Controlling Idea of the main plot, if it doesn’t set up the introduction of the main plot’s Inciting Incident, or complicate the action on the main plot, if it merely runs alongside, it will split the story down the middle and destroy its effect. The audience understands the principle of aesthetic unity. It knows that every story element is there because of the relationship it strikes to every other element. This relationship, structural or thematic, holds the work together. If the audience can’t find it, it’ll disengage from the story and consciously try to force a unity. When this fails, it sits in confusion.

在畅销心理惊悚片《原罪》的改编电影中，主线情节讲述了一名警官（弗兰克·辛纳屈饰）追捕连环杀手的故事。在次线情节中，他的妻子（费·唐纳薇饰）正在重症监护室，生命只剩下几周。侦探先追捕凶手，然后慰问垂死的妻子；他追捕凶手，然后给妻子读书；他继续追捕凶手，然后再次去医院看望她。不久，这种交替的故事设计点燃了观众强烈的好奇心：凶手什么时候会来医院？但他从来没有来。相反，妻子死了，警察抓住了凶手，主线情节和次线情节从未联系起来，观众陷入了不满的困惑之中。

In the screen adaptation of the best-selling Psycho-Thriller THE FIRST DEADLY SIN, the Central Plot takes a police lieutenant (Frank Sinatra) on the hunt for a serial killer. In a subplot, his wife (Faye Dunaway) is in intensive care with only weeks to live. The detective hunts for the killer, then commiserates with his dying wife; he hunts the killer, then reads to his wife; he hunts for the killer some more, then visits her in the hospital again. Before long this alternating story design ignited a burning curiosity in the audience: When will the killer come to the hospital? But he never does. Instead, the wife dies, the cop catches the killer, plot and subplot never connect, and the audience is left in disgruntled confusion.

然而，在劳伦斯·桑德斯的小说中，这种设计取得了巨大的成功，因为在书页上，主线情节和次要情节在主人公的脑海中相互复杂化：警察对一个精神病杀手的强烈关注与他迫切希望给妻子带来她需要的安慰相冲突，同时，他对失去妻子的恐惧和看到他心爱的女人受苦的痛苦与他在追捕一个冷酷无情但才华横溢的疯子时需要清晰、理性的推理相矛盾。小说家可以进入角色的内心，用第一人称或第三人称直接用散文描述来描绘内心冲突。编剧不能。

In Lawrence Sanders’ novel, however, this design succeeds with powerful effect because on the page main plot and subplot complicate each other in the mind of the protagonist: the cop’s fierce preoccupation with a psychotic killer conflicts with a desperate desire to give his wife the comfort she needs, while at the same time his dread of losing her and the pain of watching the woman he loves suffer contradicts his need for clear, rational deduction in pursuit of a ruthless but brilliant lunatic. A novelist can enter a character’s mind and in first- or third-person delineate inner conflict directly in prose description. The screenwriter cannot.

剧本创作是将精神转化为物质的艺术。我们为内心冲突创造视觉对应物——而不是对话或叙述描述思想和情感，而是通过人物选择和行动的形象来间接、不可言喻地表达内心的想法和感受。因此，小说的内心生活必须为银幕重新塑造。

The screenwriting is the art of making the mental physical. We create visual correlatives for inner conflict—not dialogue or narration to describe ideas and emotions, but images of character choice and action to indirectly and ineffably express the thoughts and feelings within. Therefore, the interior life a novel must be reinvented for the screen.

在改编曼努埃尔·普伊格的小说《蜘蛛女之吻》时，编剧伦纳德·施拉德也面临着类似的结构问题。同样，主线情节和次线情节只在主人公的脑海中相互复杂化。事实上，次线情节是路易斯（威廉·赫特饰）对他崇拜的蜘蛛女（索尼娅·布拉加饰）的幻想，取材于他依稀记得并大加修饰的电影。施拉德将路易斯的幻想变成电影中的电影，从而将他的梦想和愿望形象化。

In adapting Manuel Puig’s novel KISS OF THE SPIDER WOMAN, screenwriter Leonard Schrader was faced with a similar structural problem. Once again, main plot and subplot complicate one another only within the mind of the protagonist. The subplot, in fact, is Luis’ (William Hurt) fantasies of the Spider Woman (Sonia Braga), a character he idolizes, drawn from films he vaguely remembers and greatly embellishes. Schrader visualizes Luis’ dreams and desires by turning his fantasy into a film-within-the-film.

尽管如此，这两个情节无法因果互动，因为它们处于不同的现实层面。然而，它们通过使次要情节的故事反映出主要情节而相互联系。这让路易斯有机会在现实中实现他的幻想。那一刻，两个情节在路易斯的心灵中发生碰撞，观众想象着内心激烈的情感斗争：路易斯在生活中会做蜘蛛女在他梦中做的事吗？他也会背叛他爱的男人吗？更重要的是，这两条情节线讽刺了通过自我牺牲来获得爱的主导思想，并为电影增添了主题统一性。

Still, these two plots cannot causally interact because they’re on different planes of reality. They are connected, however, by making the subplot’s story mirror the Central Plot. This gives Luis the chance to act out his fantasy in reality. At that moment the two plots collide in Luis’ psyche and the audience imagines the emotional battle raging within: Will Luis do in life what the Spider Woman did in his dreams? Will he too betray the man he loves? What’s more, the two plotlines ironize the Controlling Idea of Love Through Self-sacrifice and give the film an added thematic unity.

《蜘蛛女之吻》的设计中还有另一个引人注目的例外。原则上，主情节的激励事件必须出现在银幕上。但在这里，激励事件直到中幕高潮才被揭示。在背景故事中，被关押在法西斯独裁政权下的同性恋囚犯路易斯被叫到监狱长的办公室，监狱长提出了这样的条件：左翼革命者瓦伦丁（劳尔·朱利亚饰演）将被关进他的牢房。如果路易斯监视他并获得有价值的信息，监狱长将释放路易斯。观众不知道这笔交易，在电影的第一个小时里，路易斯拜访监狱长，为生病的瓦伦丁要药和甘菊茶，直到最后才发现这个主情节。

There’s yet another revealing exception in the design of KISS OF THE SPIDER WOMAN. In principle, the Central Plot’s Inciting Incident must be onscreen. But here the Inciting Incident is not revealed until the Mid-Act Climax. In the Backstory Luis, a homosexual convict imprisoned in a fascist dictatorship, is called into the warden’s office and made this offer: A leftist revolutionary, Valentin (Raul Julia), will be put in his cell. If Luis spies on him and gets valuable information, the warden will give Luis his freedom. The audience, unaware of this deal, waits through the first hour of the film to finally discover this Central Plot when Luis visits the warden asking for medicine and camomile tea for the ailing Valentin.

对于许多人来说，这部电影的开头非常乏味，他们几乎要退出了。那么为什么不像小说一样，以常规的方式以激励事件开场，并以强有力的钩子开始故事呢？因为，如果如果施拉德将路易斯同意监视一名自由战士的场景放在电影开头，观众会立刻讨厌主角。编剧选择快速开场而不是对主角产生同情，这违背了小说的设计。虽然小说家使用内心叙述来获得同情，但编剧知道他必须先让观众相信路易斯爱瓦伦丁，然后再揭露路易斯与法西斯分子的契约。这是正确的选择。如果没有同情心，这部电影将成为一场空洞的异国摄影练习。

For many this film began so tediously they nearly walked out. So why not open conventionally with the Inciting Incident, as does the novel, and start the story with a strong hook? Because, if Schrader had placed the scene in which Luis agrees to spy on a freedom fighter at the opening of the film, the audience would have instantly hated the protagonist. With a choice of a fast opening versus empathy for the protagonist, the screenwriter violated the design of the novel. While the novelist used inner narration to gain empathy, the screenwriter knew that he would first have to convince the audience that Luis loved Valentin before revealing Luis’ pact with the fascists. The right choice. Without empathy the film would be a hollow exercise in exotic photography.

面对无法调和的选择，例如节奏与同理心，明智的作家会重新设计故事以保留重要内容。你可以自由地打破或改变惯例，但只有一个原因：用更重要的东西取代它。

Faced with irreconcilable choices, such as pace versus empathy, the wise writer redesigns the story to preserve what’s vital. You’re free to break or bend convention, but for one reason only: to put something more important in its place.

10

场景设计

10

SCENE DESIGN

本章重点介绍场景设计的组成部分：转折点、设置/回报、情感动态和选择。 第 11 章将分析两个场景，以展示节拍如何通过改变角色行为来塑造场景的内心生活。

This chapter focuses on the components of scene design: Turning Points, Setups/Payoffs, Emotional Dynamics, and Choice. Chapter 11 will analyze two scenes to demonstrate how Beats, changing character behaviors, shape a scene’s inner life.

转折点

TURNING POINTS

场景是故事的缩影——在时间和空间的统一或连续性中，通过冲突发生的行动，改变了人物生活中充满价值的状况。理论上，场景的长度或位置几乎没有限制。场景可以是无限的。在适当的背景下，一个由一只手翻动扑克牌的单个镜头组成的场景可以表达巨大的变化。相反，在战场上分布在十几个地点的十分钟动作可能效果要小得多。无论地点或长度如何，场景都围绕着欲望、行动、冲突和变化而统一。

A scene is a story in miniature—an action through conflict in a unity or continuity of time and space that turns the value-charged condition of a character’s life. In theory there’s virtually no limit to a scene’s length or locations. A scene may be infinitesimal. In the right context a scene consisting of a single shot in which a hand turns over a playing card could express great change. Conversely, ten minutes of action spread over a dozen sites on a battlefield may accomplish much less. No matter locations or length, a scene is unified around desire, action, conflict, and change.

在每个场景中，角色都会追求与他当前时间和地点相关的欲望。但这个场景目标必须是他的超级目标或主线的一个方面，超级目标或主线是贯穿故事的探索，从激励事件到故事高潮。在场景中，角色在压力下选择采取一种或另一种行动，以此来执行他的场景目标。然而，从任何或所有冲突层面都会产生他没有预料到的反应。其效果是打破期望和结果之间的差距，将他的外在命运、内心生活或两者从积极转变为消极，或者就观众理解的价值观而言，从消极到积极正面临风险。

In each scene a character pursues a desire related to his immediate time and place. But this Scene-Objective must be an aspect of his Super-Objective or Spine, the story-long quest that spans from Inciting Incident to Story Climax. Within the scene, the character acts on his Scene-Objective by choosing under pressure to take one action or another. However, from any or all levels of conflict comes a reaction he didn’t anticipate. The effect is to crack open the gap between expectation and result, turning his outer fortunes, inner life, or both from the positive to the negative or the negative to the positive in terms of values the audience understands are at risk.

场景会引起轻微但重要的变化。序列高潮是导致适度逆转的场景——变化比场景更具影响力。幕高潮是导致重大逆转的场景——变化比序列高潮更具影响力。因此，我们永远不会写出仅​​仅是平淡、静态展示的场景；相反，我们努力实现这一理想：创建一个故事设计，其中每个场景都是一个轻微、中等或主要的转折点。

A scene causes change in a minor, albeit significant way. A Sequence Climax is a scene that causes a moderate reversal— change with more impact than a scene. An Act Climax is a scene that causes a major reversal—change with greater impact than Sequence Climax. Accordingly, we never write a scene that’s merely a flat, static display of exposition; rather we strive for this ideal: to create a story design in which every scene is a minor, moderate, or major Turning Point.

颠倒乾坤：价值就是财富。受《波吉与贝丝》的启发，比利·雷·瓦伦丁（艾迪·墨菲饰）在街头乞讨，假装是滑板上的截瘫患者。当警察试图逮捕他时，一个缺口出现了，而当两位老商人杜克兄弟（拉尔夫·贝拉米和唐·阿米契饰）突然与警察干预以拯救他时，缺口又大大扩大。比利的乞讨使他的世界做出了不同且比他预期更强烈的反应。他没有反抗，而是明智地选择向缺口屈服。镜头切换到：一间胡桃木镶板的办公室，杜克兄弟让他穿上三件套西装，让他成为一名商品经纪人。在这个令人愉快的转折点附近，比利的金融生涯从乞丐变成了经纪人。

TRADING PLACES: The value at stake is wealth. Inspired by Porgy and Bess, Billy Ray Valentine (Eddie Murphy) begs on the streets, pretending to be a paraplegic on a skateboard. A gap opens when police try to bust him, then widens enormously when two elderly businessmen, the Duke brothers (Ralph Bellamy and Don Ameche), suddenly intervene with the cops to save him. Billy’s begging has caused his world to react differently and more powerfully than he expected. He doesn’t resist, but wisely chooses to surrender to the gap. CUT TO: A walnut-paneled office where the Duke brothers have dressed him in a three-piece suit and made him a commodities broker. Billy’s financial life goes from beggar to broker around this delightful Turning Point.

华尔街：财富和诚实是关键。年轻的股票经纪人巴德·福克斯（查理·辛饰演）安排了与亿万富翁戈登·盖柯（迈克尔·道格拉斯饰演）的会面。巴德靠薪水度日，但他的正直始终如一。当他提出合法的商业想法时，他的推销招致了意想不到的反感，盖柯反驳道：“告诉我一些我不知道的事情。”突然间，巴德意识到盖柯不想做诚实的生意。他停顿了一下，然后透露了他父亲告诉他的一个公司秘密。巴德选择加入盖柯的非法阴谋，在这个强大而讽刺的转折点上，他的内心从诚实变成了犯罪，他的命运从贫穷变成了富有。

WALL STREET: The values at stake are wealth and honesty. A young stockbroker, Bud Fox (Charlie Sheen), secures a meeting with billionaire Gordon Gekko (Michael Douglas). Bud lives from paycheck to paycheck, but his integrity is intact. When he proposes legitimate business ideas, his sales pitch provokes forces of antagonism he couldn’t anticipate as Gekko retorts: “Tell me something I don’t know.” Suddenly Bud realizes Gekko doesn’t want to do honest business. He pauses, then reveals a corporate secret that his own father had told him. Bud chooses to join Gekko in an unlawful conspiracy, reversing his inner nature from honest to criminal and his fortunes from poor to rich around this powerful and ironic Turning Point.

转折点的影响有四个方面：惊奇、好奇心增强、洞察力和新方向。

The effects of Turning Points are fourfold: surprise, increased curiosity, insight, and new direction.

当预期与结果出现差距时，观众会大吃一惊。世界的反应是角色和观众都没有预料到的。这一震惊瞬间激起了观众的好奇心，他们想知道“为什么？”《颠倒乾坤》：为什么这两个老人要从警察手中救出这个乞丐？《华尔街》：为什么盖柯会说：“告诉我一些我不知道的事情。”为了满足好奇心，观众会急忙回顾迄今为止看过的故事，寻找答案。在一个设计精美的故事中，这些答案被悄悄但小心地层层叠加。

When a gap opens between expectation and result, it jolts the audience with surprise. The world has reacted in a way neither character nor audience had foreseen. This moment of shock instantly provokes curiosity as the audience wonders “Why?” TRADING PLACES: Why are these two old men saving this beggar from the police? WALL STREET: Why is Gekko saying: “Tell me something I don’t know.” In an effort to satisfy its curiosity, the audience rushes back through what story it’s seen so far, seeking answers. In a beautifully designed story, these answers have been quietly but carefully layered in.

交换场所：我们的思绪回到了之前杜克兄弟的场景，我们意识到这些老人对生活感到厌倦，他们会用他们的财富来玩虐待游戏。此外，他们一定看到了这个乞丐身上的天才之光，否则他们不会选择他作为他们的棋子。

TRADING PLACES: Our thoughts flit back to previous scenes with the Duke brothers and we realize that these old men are so bored with life they’ll use their wealth to play sadistic games. Further, they must have seen a spark of genius in this beggar or they wouldn’t have picked him to be their pawn.

华尔街：盖柯的“告诉我一些我不知道的事情”引发的“为什么？”立即得到了以下见解的回答：盖柯当然是亿万富翁，他是个骗子。几乎没有人能靠诚实变得非常富有。他也喜欢游戏……一种犯罪游戏。当巴德加入他时，我们的记忆回到了之前在他办公室的场景，我们意识到巴德过于雄心勃勃和贪婪——注定要失败。

WALL STREET: The “why?” provoked by Gekko’s “Tell me something I don’t know” is instantly answered by this insight: Of course Gekko’s a billionaire, he’s a crook. Almost no one becomes immensely rich honestly. He too likes games… of a criminal kind. When Bud joins him, our memory dashes back to previous scenes at his office, and we realize that Bud was too ambitious and greedy—ripe for a fall.

观众的头脑敏捷而敏锐，在瞬间就找到了这些答案。“为什么？”这个问题推动着观众回顾整个故事，到目前为止所看到的内容立即进入了一个新的结构；观众对人物和世界有了深刻的了解，发现了一层令人满意的隐藏真相。

The nimble and perceptive mind of the audience finds these answers in a flash of understanding. The question “Why?” propels it back through the story, and what it’s seen so far instantly clicks into a new configuration; it experiences a rush of insight into character and world, a satisfying layer of hidden truth.

洞察力增加了好奇心。这种新的理解会放大“接下来会发生什么？”和“结果会如何？”的问题。这种效果适用于所有类型的小说，在犯罪故事中尤为明显。有人去衣柜里找一件干净的衬衫，结果一具尸体掉了出来。这个巨大的差距引发了一连串的问题：“谁犯了这起谋杀案？怎么发生的？什么时候发生的？为什么？凶手会被抓到吗？”作家现在必须满足他所创造的好奇心。从每一个改变价值的点开始，他必须将故事推向新的方向，以创造未来的转折点。

Insight adds to curiosity. This new understanding amplifies the questions “What’s going to happen next?” and “How will this turn out?” This effect, true in all genres, is vividly clear in Crime Stories. Someone goes to a closet for a clean shirt and a dead body falls out. This huge gap triggers a fusillade of questions: “Who committed this murder? How? When? Why? Will the killer be caught?” The writer must now satisfy the curiosity he’s created. From each point of changed value, he must move his story in a new direction to create Turning Points yet to come.

《克莱默夫妇》：当我们看到一个 32 岁的男人不会做早餐时，场景发生了转变。“为什么？”这个问题让我们回想起电影中出现空白之前的几分钟。凭借我们的生活经验和常识，我们寻找答案。

KRAMER VS. KRAMER: The moment we see that a thirty-two-year-old man can’t make breakfast the scene turns. The question “Why?” sends us back through the few minutes of film that precede the gap. Armed with our life experience and common sense, we seek answers.

首先，克莱默是个工作狂，但许多工作狂在早上五点其他人起床之前就做好了丰盛的早餐。此外，他从未为家庭生活做出贡献，但许多男人不这样做，他们的妻子仍然忠诚，尊重丈夫为赚钱所做的努力。我们更深层次的洞察是：克莱默是个孩子。他是一个被宠坏的顽童，他的母亲总是为他做早餐。后来，她的角色被女朋友和女服务员取代。现在他把妻子变成了女服务员/母亲。克莱默一生都宠坏了女人，他非常乐意让她们宠坏他。乔安娜·克莱默实际上抚养了两个孩子，由于无法建立成熟的关系，她放弃了婚姻。更重要的是，我们认为她这样做是对的。新方向：克莱默成长为男子汉。

First, Kramer’s a workaholic, but many workaholics make excellent breakfasts at five A.M. before anyone else is up. More, he’s never contributed to his family’s domestic life, but many men don’t and their wives remain loyal, respecting their husbands’ efforts to provide income. Our deeper insight is this: Kramer is a child. He’s a spoiled-rotten brat whose mother always made breakfast for him. Later her role was filled by girlfriends and waitresses. Now he’s turned his wife into a waitress/mother. Women have spoiled Kramer all his life and he’s been only too happy to let them.
