So her leaving is then toned with a positive counterpoint that ends the film on a painful, but overall negative, irony.

最后一幕的高潮是你伟大的想象力飞跃。没有它，你就没有故事。在你拥有它之前，你的角色就像受苦的病人一样等待着，祈求着治愈。

The Climax of the last act is your great imaginative leap. Without it, you have no story. Until you have it, your characters wait like suffering patients praying for a cure.

一旦掌握了高潮，故事就会以一种重要的方式向后重写，而不是向前重写。生活之流从原因流向结果，但创造力之流往往从结果流向原因。一个高潮的想法突然出现在想象中，没有任何支持。现在我们必须向后工作，在虚构的现实中支持它，提供如何和为什么。我们从结尾开始回溯，以确保通过“想法”和“反想法”，每个图像、节奏、动作或对话都以某种方式与这个盛大的结局相关或建立联系。所有场景都必须在高潮的光照下在主题或结构上得到证实。如果可以删除它们而不会影响结局的影响，就必须删除它们。

Once the Climax is in hand, stories are in a significant way rewritten backward, not forward. The flow of life moves from cause to effect, but the flow of creativity often flows from effect to cause. An idea for the Climax pops unsupported into the imagination. Now we must work backward to support it in the fictional reality, supplying the hows and whys. We work back from the ending to make certain that by Idea and Counter-Idea every image, beat, action, or line of dialogue somehow relates to or sets up this grand payoff. All scenes must be thematically or structurally justified in the light of the Climax. If they can be cut without disturbing the impact of the ending, they must be cut.

如果逻辑允许，高潮情节应该在主情节的高潮中出现。这是一个很棒的效果；主角的最后一个动作解决了所有问题。当瑞克把拉兹洛和伊尔莎送上卡萨布兰卡的飞机时，他解决了爱情故事主情节和政治戏剧副情节，使雷诺上尉转变为爱国主义者，杀死斯特拉瑟少校，我们觉得，这是赢得第二次世界大战的关键……现在瑞克又回到了战场上。

If logic allows, climax subplots within the Central Plot’s Climax. This is a wonderful effect; one final action by the protagonist settles everything. When Rick puts Laszlo and Ilsa on the plane in CASABLANCA, he settles the Love Story main plot and the Political Drama subplot, converts Captain Renault to patriotism, kills Major Strasser, and, we feel, is the key to winning World War II… now that Rick is back in the fight.

如果这种倍增效应不可能实现，那么最好先让最不重要的次要情节达到高潮，然后再是次要情节，最后形成中心情节的高潮。

If this multiplying effect is impossible, the least important subplots are best climaxed earliest, followed by the next most important, building overall to Climax of the Central Plot.

威廉·戈德曼认为，所有故事结局的关键是满足观众的需求，但不要按照观众的期望。这是一个极具煽动性的原则：首先，观众想要什么？许多制片人毫不犹豫地说，观众想要一个圆满的结局。他们之所以这么说，是因为结局向上的电影往往比结局向下的电影更赚钱。

William Goldman argues that the key to all story endings is to give the audience what it wants, but not the way it expects. A very provocative principle: First of all, what does the audience want? Many producers state without blinking that the audience wants a happy ending. They say this because up-ending films tend to make more money than down-ending films.

原因在于，一小部分观众不会去看任何可能给他们带来不愉快体验的电影。他们通常的理由是，他们的生活已经够悲惨的了。但如果我们仔细观察，就会发现他们不仅在电影中回避负面情绪，在生活中也回避负面情绪。这些人认为幸福意味着永远不会受苦，所以他们永远不会有深刻的感受。我们快乐的深度与我们所遭受的苦难成正比。例如，大屠杀幸存者不会回避黑暗电影。他们去看是因为这样的故事能引起他们的过去共鸣，并能深深地宣泄他们的情感。

The reason for this is that a small percentage of the audience won’t go to any film that might give it an unpleasant experience. Generally their excuse is that they have enough tragedy in their lives. But if we were to look closely, we’d discover that they not only avoid negative emotions in movies, they avoid them in life. Such people think that happiness means never suffering, so they never feel anything deeply. The depth of our joy is in direct proportion to what we’ve suffered. Holocaust survivors, for example, don’t avoid dark films. They go because such stories resonate with their past and are deeply cathartic.

事实上，结局悲观的电影往往能获得巨大的商业成功：《危险关系》八千万美元；《玫瑰战争》一亿五千万美元；《英国病人》二亿二千五百万美元。没人能算出《教父2》的票房。因为绝大多数人并不关心一部电影是成功还是悲观。观众想要的是情感上的满足——一个满足期待的高潮。《教父2》应该如何结束？迈克尔原谅了弗雷多，退出了黑帮，带着家人搬到波士顿卖保险？这部宏伟电影的高潮是真实的、美丽的，非常令人满意。

In fact, down-ending films are often huge commercial successes: DANGEROUS LIAISONS, eighty million dollars; THE WAR OF THE ROSES, one hundred fifty million; THE ENGLISH PATIENT, two hundred twenty-five million. No one can count THE GODFATHER, PART II’s money. For the vast majority doesn’t care if a film ends up or down. What the audience wants is emotional satisfaction—a Climax that fulfills anticipation. How should THE GODFATHER, PART II end? Michael forgives Fredo, quits the mob, and moves to Boston with his family to sell insurance? The Climax of this magnificent film is truthful, beautiful, and very satisfying.

谁能决定电影结尾时观众会感到哪种情感满足？编剧。从他一开始讲述故事的方式来看，他向观众低声说：“期待一个好结局”或“期待一个坏结局”或“期待讽刺”。既然承诺了某种情感，不兑现就会造成毁灭性的后果。所以我们给观众承诺的体验，但不是以他们期望的方式。这就是艺术家和业余爱好者的区别。

Who determines which particular emotion will satisfy an audience at the end of a film? The writer. From the way he tells his story from the beginning, he whispers to the audience: “Expect an up-ending” or “Expect a down-ending” or “Expect irony.” Having pledged a certain emotion, it’d be ruinous not to deliver. So we give the audience the experience we’ve promised, but not in the way it expects. This is what separates artist from amateur.

用亚里士多德的话来说，结局必须“既不可避免又出乎意料”。不可避免是指当激励事件发生时，一切似乎都有可能发生，但在高潮时，当观众回顾整个故事时，应该会觉得故事的发展路径是唯一的路径。考虑到我们已经理解的角色和他们的世界，高潮是不可避免的，也是令人满意的。但与此同时，它必须是出乎意料的，以一种观众无法预料的方式发生。

In Aristotle’s words, an ending must be both “inevitable and unexpected.” Inevitable in the sense that as the Inciting Incident occurs, everything and anything seems possible, but at Climax, as the audience looks back through the telling, it should seem that the path the telling took was the only path. Given the characters and their world as we’ve come to understand it, the Climax was inevitable and satisfying. But at the same time it must be unexpected, happening in a way the audience could not have anticipated.

任何人都可以创造一个圆满的结局——只要给予角色他们想要的一切。或者一个令人沮丧的结局——只要杀死所有人。艺术家给我们他承诺的情感……但伴随着意想不到的洞察力，他被保留在高潮本身的转折点。因此，当主角即兴创作他的最后一部作品时，他可能会也可能不会实现他的愿望，但从缺口中涌出的洞察力洪流传递了人们所希望的情感，但以一种我们永远无法预见的方式。

Anyone can deliver a happy ending—just give the characters everything they want. Or a downer—just kill everybody. An artist gives us the emotion he’s promised… but with a rush of unexpected insight that he’s withheld to a Turning Point within the Climax itself. So that as the protagonist improvises his final effort, he may or may not achieve his desire, but the flood of insight that pours from the gap delivers the hoped-for emotion but in a way we could never have foreseen.

《爱的小夜曲》高潮部分的转折点就是一个最近且完美的例子。这个精彩的转折点让观众回过头来看整部电影，震惊而又欣喜地看到每个场景之下都隐藏着疯狂的真相。

The Turning Point within the Climax of LOVE SERENADE is a recent and perfect example. This brilliant Gap hurls the audience back through the entire film to glimpse with shock and delight the maniacal truth that has been lurking beneath every scene.

正如弗朗索瓦·特吕弗所说，精彩电影结局的关键在于将“场面与真相”结合起来。特吕弗所说的“场面”并不是指爆炸效果，而是指为眼睛而非耳朵而写的高潮。他所说的“真相”是指主控思想。换句话说，特吕弗要求我们创造电影的关键意象——一个概括并浓缩所有意义和情感的单一意象。就像交响乐的尾声一样，高潮动作中的关键意象呼应并共鸣了之前发生的一切。这是一个与故事情节如此契合的意象，当人们回忆起它时，整部电影都会被震撼。

The key to a great film ending, as François Truffaut put it, is to create a combination of “Spectacle and Truth.” When Truffaut says “Spectacle,” he doesn’t mean explosive effects. He means a Climax written, not for the ear, but the eye. By “Truth” he means Controlling Idea. In other words, Truffaut is asking us to create the Key Image of the film—a single image that sums up and concentrates all meaning and emotion. Like the coda of a symphony, the Key Image within the climactic action echoes and resonates all that has gone before. It is an image that is so tuned to the telling that when it’s remembered the whole film comes back with a jolt.

贪婪：麦克蒂格倒在沙漠中，和他刚杀死的尸体被锁在一起。山宝藏：弗雷德·C·多布斯（亨弗莱·鲍嘉饰）奄奄一息，风将他的金粉吹回山中。甜蜜的生活：鲁比尼（马塞洛·马斯楚安尼饰）微笑着向他理想中的女人道别——但他意识到，那个理想并不存在。对话：偏执狂哈里·考尔（吉恩·哈克曼饰）为了寻找隐藏的麦克风，把公寓里的东西全部搜刮干净。第七封印：骑士（马克斯·冯·西多饰）正带领他的家人走向灭亡。孩子：小家伙（查理·卓别林饰）牵着孩子（杰基·库根饰）的手，带他走向幸福的未来。弹簧刀：卡尔·柴尔德斯（比利·鲍伯·松顿饰）默不作声地凝视着疯人院的窗外。很少能实现这种品质的关键图像。

GREED: McTeague collapsing into the desert, chained to the corpse he just killed. THE TREASURE OF THE SIERRA MADRE: Fred C. Dobbs (Humphrey Bogart) dying as the wind blows his gold dust back into the mountains. LA DOLCE VITA: Rubini (Marcello Mastroianni) smiling good-bye to his ideal woman—an ideal, he realizes, that doesn’t exist. THE CONVERSATION: The paranoid Harry Caul (Gene Hackman) gutting his apartment in search of a hidden microphone. THE SEVENTH SEAL: The Knight (Max von Sydow) leading his family into oblivion. THE KID: The Little Chap (Charlie Chaplin) taking the Kid (Jackie Coogan) by the hand to lead him to a happy future. SLING BLADE: Karl Childers (Billy Bob Thornton) staring in blood-chilling silence out of the window of the lunatic asylum. Key Images of this quality are rarely achieved.

解决

RESOLUTION

结局是五部分结构中的第五部分，是高潮之后剩下的材料，有三种可能的用途。

The Resolution, the fifth of the five-part structure, is any material left after Climax and has three possible uses.

首先，故事的叙述逻辑可能无法在主情节高潮之前或期间提供次要情节高潮的机会，因此需要在结尾处设置一个自己的场景。然而，这可能会很尴尬。故事的情感核心在主情节中。此外，观众会倾向于退出，但却被迫坐着看完一个次要场景。

First, the logic of the telling may not provide an opportunity to climax a subplot before or during the Climax of the Central Plot, so it’ll need a scene of its own at the very end. This, however, can be awkward. The story’s emotional heart is in the main plot. Moreover, the audience will be leaning toward the exits, yet forced to sit through a scene of secondary interest.

但这个问题是可以解决的。

The problem can be solved, however.

姻亲：谢尔顿·科恩佩特医生（艾伦·阿金饰）的女儿与文斯·里卡多（彼得·福克饰）的儿子订婚。文斯是一名疯狂的中情局特工，他几乎把谢尔顿从牙科诊所绑架了出去，并带他去执行一项任务，阻止一个疯狂的独裁者用二十美元的假钞摧毁国际货币体系。主线情节的高潮是文斯和谢尔顿抵挡住行刑队，打倒了独裁者，然后各自秘密地赚了五百万美元。

THE IN-LAWS: The daughter of Dr. Sheldon Kornpett (Alan Arkin) is engaged to be married to the son of Vince Ricardo (Peter Falk). Vince is a crazed CIA agent who virtually kidnaps Sheldon out of his dental office and carries him off on a mission to stop a lunatic dictator from destroying the international monetary system with counterfeit twenty-dollar bills. The Central Plot climaxes with Vince and Sheldon fending off a firing squad, bringing down the dictator, then secretly pocketing five million dollars each.

但婚姻的次要情节却悬而未决。因此，编剧安德鲁·伯格曼将镜头从行刑队切换到婚礼外的决战场景。当派对的人们焦急地等待时，父亲们穿着燕尾服乘降落伞抵达。他们各自给了自己的儿子和女儿 100 万美元的现金礼物。突然，一辆汽车疾驰而来，一名愤怒的中情局特工从车里出来。紧张气氛加剧。似乎主线情节又回来了，父亲们将因偷窃一千万美元而被捕。面色严肃的中情局特工悄悄走上前来，他确实很生气。为什么？因为他没有被邀请参加婚礼。更重要的是，他在办公室里募捐，并为新娘和新郎准备了一张 50 美元的美国储蓄债券。父亲们接受了他奢华的礼物，并欢迎他参加庆祝活动。淡出。

But the marriage subplot has been left open. So writer Andrew Bergman cut from the firing squad to a Resolution scene outside the wedding. As the party waits impatiently, the fathers arrive by parachute, wearing tuxedos. Each gives his respective son and daughter a cash gift of $1 million. Suddenly a car screeches up and an angry CIA agent gets out. Tension tightens. It looks as if the main plot is back and the fathers will be busted for stealing the ten million. The stern-faced CIA agent stalks up and is indeed angry. Why? Because he wasn’t invited to the wedding. What’s more, he took up a collection at the office and has a fifty-dollar U.S. Savings Bond for bride and groom. The fathers accept his lavish gift and welcome him to the festivities. FADE OUT.

伯格曼在《决心》中对主线情节进行了调整。想象一下，如果影片以行刑队前结束，然后切换到花园婚礼，幸福的家庭团聚。这个场景会拖沓冗长，观众会坐立不安。但通过让主线情节短暂地复活，编剧给它带来了一个喜剧性的虚假转折，将《决心》重新融入电影主体，并将紧张感保持到最后。

Bergman tweaked the main plot in the Resolution. Imagine if it had ended in front of the firing squad, then cut to a garden wedding with happy families reunited. The scene would have dragged on as the audience squirmed in its seats. But by bringing the Central Plot back to life for just a moment, the screenwriter gave it a comic false twist, yoked his Resolution back to the body of the film, and held tension to the end.

结局的第二个用途是展示高潮效果的蔓延。如果一部电影通过扩大社会来表达进程，那么它的高潮可能仅限于主要角色。然而，观众已经知道了许多配角，他们的生活将因高潮动作而改变。这激发了一场满足我们好奇心的社交活动，将整个演员阵容带到一个地方，摄影机可以跟踪向我们展示这些生活是如何改变的：生日聚会、海滩野餐，《钢木兰》中的复活节彩蛋狩猎，《动物屋》中的讽刺标题。

A second use of a Resolution is to show the spread of climactic effects. If a film expresses progressions by widening into society, its Climax may be restricted to the principal characters. The audience, however, has come to know many supporting roles whose lives will be changed by the climactic action. This motivates a social event that satisfies our curiosity by bringing the entire cast to one location where the camera can track around to show us how these lives have been changed: the birthday party, the picnic at the beach, an Easter Egg hunt in STEEL MAGNOLIAS, a satiric title roll in ANIMAL HOUSE.

即使前两种用途不适用，所有电影都需要一个结局，以尊重观众。因为如果高潮已经打动了电影观众，如果他们笑得无可奈何，被恐惧所吸引，被社会愤怒所激怒，擦去眼泪，突然变黑并滚动播放片头是不礼貌的。这是离开的暗示，他们会试图离开，情绪激动，在黑暗中跌跌撞撞，把车钥匙掉在粘着百事可乐的地板上。电影需要剧院所谓的“缓慢的幕布”。最后一页底部的一行描述，让镜头慢慢后退或跟踪图像几秒钟，这样观众就可以喘口气，整理思绪，体面地离开电影院。

Even if the first two uses don’t apply, all films need a Resolution as a courtesy to the audience. For if the Climax has moved the filmgoers, if they’re laughing helplessly, riveted with terror, flushed with social outrage, wiping away tears, it’s rude suddenly to go black and roll the titles. This is the cue to leave, and they will attempt to do so jangling with emotion, stumbling over one another in the dark, dropping their car keys on the Pepsi-sticky floor. A film needs what the theatre calls a “slow curtain.” A line of description at the bottom of the last page that sends the camera slowly back or tracking along images for a few seconds, so the audience can catch its breath, gather its thoughts, and leave the cinema with dignity.

第四部分作家

在工作



PART 4

THE

WRITER

AT WORK

任何东西的初稿都是垃圾。

The first draft of anything is shit.

-海明威​​

— ERNEST HEMINGWAY

14

对抗原则

14

THE PRINCIPLE OF ANTAGONISM

在我看来，对抗原则是故事设计中最重要、最不为人理解的原则。忽视这一基本概念是剧本和根据剧本制作的电影失败的主要原因。

In my experience, the principle of antagonism is the most important and least understood precept in story design. Neglect of this fundamental concept is the primary reason screenplays and the films made from them fail.

对抗原则：主角和他的故事只有在对抗力量的作用下才能具有智力上的吸引力和情感上的吸引力。

THE PRINCIPLE OF ANTAGONISM: A protagonist and his story can only be as intellectually fascinating and emotionally compelling as the forces of antagonism make them.

人类的天性从根本上来说就是保守的。我们从来不会做不必要的事情，不去花费不必要的精力，不去冒不必要的风险，不去改变。我们为什么要这么做？如果我们能轻而易举地得到我们想要的东西，为什么要用困难的方式去做任何事？（当然，“简单的方式”是特殊的和主观的。）因此，什么能让主角成为一个完全成熟、多维度、具有深刻同理心的角色？什么能让一个死气沉沉的剧本焕发生机？这两个问题的答案都在故事的反面。

Human nature is fundamentally conservative. We never do more than we have to, expend any energy we don’t have to, take any risks we don’t have to, change if we don’t have to. Why should we? Why do anything the hard way if we can get what we want the ease way? (The “easy way” is, of course, idiosyncratic and subjective.) Therefore, what will cause a protagonist to become a fully realized, multidimensional, and deeply empathetic character? What will bring a dead screenplay to life? The answer to both questions lies on the negative side of the story.

角色所面对的对抗力量越强大、越复杂，角色和故事就必须越完整。“对抗力量”不一定是指特定的反派或恶棍。在适当的类型中，像终结者这样的大反派是令人愉悦的，但“对抗力量”是指所有与人物的意志和愿望相悖的力量的总和。

The more powerful and complex the forces of antagonism opposing the character, the more completely realized character and story must become. “Forces of antagonism” doesn’t necessarily refer to a specific antagonist or villain. In appropriate genres arch-villains, like the Terminator, are a delight, but by “forces of antagonism” we mean the sum total of all forces that oppose the character’s will and desire.

如果我们研究主角在激励事件发生时的状况，并将他的意志力、智力、情感、社交和身体能力与他人性中的全部对抗力量以及他的个人冲突、对抗性机构和环境进行权衡，我们应该清楚地看到他是一个失败者。他有机会实现他想要的东西——但仅仅是一个机会。虽然他生活中某一方面的冲突似乎可以解决，但当他开始他的探索时，所有层面的冲突总和似乎都是势不可挡的。

If we study a protagonist at the moment of the Inciting Incident and weigh the sum of his willpower along with his intellectual, emotional, social, and physical capacities against the total forces of antagonism from within his humanity, plus his personal conflicts, antagonistic institutions, and environment, we should see clearly that he’s an underdog. He has a chance to achieve what he wants—but only a chance. Although conflict from one aspect of his life may seem solvable, the totality of all levels should seem overwhelming as he begins his quest.

我们把精力投入到故事的反面，不仅是为了让主角和其他角色得到充分实现——这些角色挑战并吸引世界上最优秀的演员——而且是为了让故事本身走向终点，达到一个辉煌而令人满意的高潮。

We pour energy into the negative side of a story not only to bring the protagonist and other characters to full realization—roles to challenge and attract the world’s finest actors—but to take the story itself to the end of the line, to a brilliant and satisfying climax.

按照这个原则，想象一下为超级英雄写作。如何把超人变成一个失败者？“氪石”是朝着正确方向迈出的一步，但还远远不够。看看马里奥·普佐为第一部超人电影创作的巧妙设计。

Following this principle, imagine writing for a super-hero. How to turn Superman into an underdog? Kryptonite is a step in the right direction, but not nearly enough. Look at the ingenious design Mario Puzo created for the first SUPERMAN feature.

普佐让超人（克里斯托弗·里夫饰）与莱克斯·卢瑟（吉恩·哈克曼饰）对决，后者策划了一场恶毒阴谋，同时向相反方向发射两枚核火箭，一枚瞄准新泽西，另一枚瞄准加利福尼亚。超人无法同时出现在两个地方，所以他必须做出两害相权取其轻的选择：拯救哪个？新泽西还是加利福尼亚？他选择了新泽西。

Puzo pits Superman (Christopher Reeve) against Lex Luthor (Gene Hackman), who engineers a diabolical plot to launch two nuclear rockets simultaneously in opposite directions, one aimed at New Jersey, the other at California. Superman can’t be in two places at once, so he’ll have to make the lesser-of-two-evils choice: Which to save? New Jersey or California? He chooses New Jersey.

第二枚火箭击中圣安德烈亚斯断层，引发地震，威胁着将加利福尼亚掀入海洋。超人跳入断层，通过自身摩擦力将加利福尼亚重新融合到大陆。但……地震夺走了路易斯·莱恩（玛戈特·基德饰）的生命。

The second rocket hits the San Andreas Fault and starts an earthquake that threatens to heave California into the ocean. Superman dives into the fault and fuses California back to the continent through the friction of his own body. But… the earthquake kills Lois Lane (Margot Kidder).

超人泪流满面地跪下。突然，乔·艾尔（马龙·白兰度饰）的面容出现，说道：“你不得干涉人类的命运。”这是一场无法调和的两难境地：他父亲的神圣规则与他心爱的女人的生命。他违反了父亲的法律，绕着地球飞行，逆转了地球的自转，让时光倒流，并复活了路易斯·莱恩——一个幸福美满的幻想，让超人从失败者变成了虚拟的神。

Superman kneels in tears. Suddenly, the visage of Jor-El (Marlon Brando) appears and says: “Thou shalt not interfere with human destiny.” A dilemma of irreconcilable goods: his father’s sacred rule versus the life of the woman he loves. He violates his father’s law, flies around the Earth, reverses the spin of the planet, turns back time, and resurrects Lois Lane—a happily-ever-after fantasy, taking Superman from underdog to a virtual god.

将故事和人物演绎到底

TAKING STORY AND CHARACTER TO THE END OF THE LINE

你的故事是否包含如此强大的负面力量，以至于正面必须获得超越的品质？下面是一种指导你进行自我批评并回答这一关键问题的技巧。

Does your story contain negative forces of such power that the positive side must gain surpassing quality? Below is a technique to guide your self-critique and answer that critical question.

首先确定故事中所涉及的主要价值。例如，正义。一般来说，主角代表这种价值的正能量；对抗力量则代表负能量。然而，生活微妙而复杂，很少是是/否、善/恶、对/错的情况。负能量有不同程度。

Begin by identifying the primary value at stake in your story. For example, Justice. Generally, the protagonist will represent the positive charge of this value; the forces of antagonism, the negative. Life, however, is subtle and complex, rarely a case of yes/no, good/evil, right/wrong. There are degrees of negativity.

首先，矛盾的价值，与积极价值截然相反。在这种情况下，不公正。法律被破坏了。

First, the Contradictory value, the direct opposite of the positive. In this case, Injustice. Laws have been broken.

然而，在正向价值和其矛盾之间，存在着相反的情况：一种有些消极但并非完全相反的情况。正义的反面是不公平，一种消极但不一定违法的情况：裙带关系、种族主义、官僚主义拖延、偏见、各种不公平。不公平的实施者可能没有违法，但他们既不公正也不公平。

Between the Positive value and its Contradictory, however, is the Contrary: a situation that’s somewhat negative but not fully the opposite. The Contrary of justice is unfairness, a situation that’s negative but not necessarily illegal: nepotism, racism, bureaucratic delay, bias, inequities of all kinds. Perpetrators of unfairness may not break the law, but they’re neither just nor fair.

然而，矛盾并不是人类经验的极限。在这条线的尽头等待着的是“否定之否定”，一种双重消极的对抗力量。

The Contradictory, however, is not the limit of human experience. At the end of the line waits the Negation of the Negation, a force of antagonism that’s doubly negative.

我们讨论的主题是生活，而不是算术。生活中，两个否定词不能构成肯定词。在英语中，双重否定不符合语法，但意大利语使用双重甚至三重否定，以便语句听起来像其含义。意大利人在痛苦中可能会说“ Non ho niente mia！ ”（我一无所有，从未拥有过！）。意大利人懂得生活。只有在数学和形式逻辑中，双重否定才会变成肯定词。生活中，事情只会变得越来越糟。

Our subject is life, not arithmetic. In life two negatives don’t make a positive. In English double negatives are ungrammatical, but Italian uses double and even triple negatives so that a statement feels like its meaning. In anguish an Italian might say, “Non ho niente mia!” (I don’t have nothing never!). Italians know life. Double negatives turn positive only in math and formal logic. In life things just get worse and worse and worse.

一个故事要想在冲突的深度和广度上发展到人类经验的极限，就必须经历一个包括对立、矛盾和否定之否定的模式。

A story that progresses to the limit of human experience in depth and breadth of conflict must move through a pattern that includes the Contrary, the Contradictory, and the Negation of the Negation.

（这种负向变格的正向镜像是从“好”到“更好”到“最佳”再到“完美”。但出于神秘的原因，使用这种进展对讲故事的人没有任何帮助。）

(The positive mirror image of this negative declension runs from Good to Better to Best to Perfect. But for mysterious reasons, working with this progression is of no help to the storyteller.)

否定之否定意味着一种复合的负面，其中生活状况不仅在数量上而且在质量上都变得更糟。否定之否定是人性黑暗力量的极限。从正义的角度来看，这种状态就是暴政。或者，用一个既适用于个人政治也适用于社会政治的短语来说：“强权即公理。”

Negation of the Negation means a compound negative in which a life situation turns not just quantitatively but qualitatively worse. The Negation of the Negation is at the limit of the dark powers of human nature. In terms of justice, this state is tyranny. Or, in a phrase that applies to personal as well as social politics: “Might Makes Right.”

想想电视侦探剧：它们会走到极限吗？《斯宾塞：雇佣》、《昆西》、《哥伦布》和《谋杀，她写道》的主角代表正义，并为维护这一理想而奋斗。首先，他们面临不公平：官僚不让昆西做尸检，政客操纵关系让哥伦布退出案件，斯宾塞的客户对他撒谎。在努力克服由不公平力量推动的期望差距后，警察发现了真正的不公正：犯罪已经发生。他击败了这些力量，恢复了社会的正义。大多数犯罪剧中的对抗力量很少超越矛盾。

Consider TV detective series: Do they go to the limit? The protagonists of Spenser: For Hire, Quincy, Columbo, and Murder, She Wrote represent justice and struggle to preserve this ideal. First, they face unfairness: Bureaucrats won’t let Quincy do the autopsy, a politician pulls strings to get Columbo off the case, Spenser’s client lies to him. After struggling through gaps of expectation powered by forces of unfairness, the cop discovers true injustice: A crime has been committed. He defeats these forces and restores society to justice. The forces of antagonism in most crime dramas rarely reach beyond the Contradictory.

将这种模式与《失踪》进行比较，这是一部基于事实的电影，讲述的是美国人埃德·霍曼（杰克·莱蒙饰）的故事，他在智利寻找在政变期间失踪的儿子。在第一幕中，他遇到了不公平：美国大使（理查德·文图拉饰）告诉他半真半假的事实，希望阻止他寻找。但霍曼坚持不懈。在第二幕的高潮中，他发现了一个严重的不公正：军政府谋杀了他的儿子……在美国国务院和中央情报局的串通下。霍曼随后试图纠正这个错误，但在第三幕中，他走到了尽头——迫害而无望得到报复。

Compare this pattern to MISSING, a fact-based film about American Ed Horman (Jack Lemmon), who searched Chile for a son who disappeared during a coup d’etat. In Act One he meets unfairness: The U.S. ambassador (Richard Venture) feeds him half-truths, hoping to dissuade his search. But Horman perseveres. At the Act Two Climax he uncovers a grievous injustice: The junta murdered his son… with the complicity of the U.S. State Department and the CIA. Horman then tries to right this wrong, but in Act Three he reaches the end of the line—persecution without hope of retribution.

智利正处于暴政的掌控之下。将军们可以在星期二将你星期一合法的行为定为非法，在星期三逮捕你，在星期四处决你，然后在星期五早上再次将其合法化。正义并不存在；暴君随心所欲地弥补。《失踪》是对不公正的最终极限的一次尖锐揭露……讽刺的是：尽管霍曼无法起诉智利的暴君，但他在银幕上将他们暴露在了全世界面前——这或许是一种更甜蜜的正义。

Chile is in the grip of tyranny. The generals can make illegal on Tuesday what you did legally on Monday, arrest you for it on Wednesday, execute you on Thursday, and make it legal again Friday morning. Justice does not exist; the tyrant makes it up at his whim. MISSING is a searing revelation of the final limits of injustice… with irony: Although Horman couldn’t indict the tyrants in Chile, he exposed them onscreen in front of the world—which may be a sweeter kind of justice.

黑色喜剧《正义为所有人》更进了一步。它追求正义的全循环，回归正轨。在第一幕中，律师亚瑟·柯克兰（阿尔·帕西诺饰）与不公平作斗争：巴尔的摩律师协会迫使他举报其他律师，而一位残忍的法官（约翰·福赛斯饰）利用官僚作风阻止柯克兰无辜客户的重审。在第二幕中，他直面不公：同一位法官被指控残忍地殴打和强奸一名妇女。

The Black Comedy… AND JUSTICE FOR ALL goes one step further. It pursues justice full cycle back to the Positive. In Act One attorney Arthur Kirkland (Al Pacino) struggles against unfairness: the Baltimore Bar Association pressures him to inform against other lawyers while a cruel judge (John Forsythe) uses red tape to block the retrial of Kirkland’s innocent client. In Act Two he confronts injustice: The same judge is charged with brutally beating and raping a woman.

但法官有一个计划：众所周知，法官和律师互相憎恨。事实上，律师最近在公共场合殴打了法官。所以法官会强迫这位律师代表他在法庭上。当柯克兰出面为他辩护时，媒体和陪审团会认为法官是无辜的，他们认为，除非律师确信被告无罪，否则不会为他辩护，而且律师的原则也是如此。律师试图摆脱这种困境，但却遭遇了“否定的否定”，即高等法院法官的“法律”暴政，他们勒索他代表他们的朋友。如果他不这样做，他们就会揭露他过去的轻率行为，并吊销他的律师资格。

But the judge has a scheme: It’s well known that the judge and attorney hate each other. Indeed, the lawyer recently punched the judge in public. So the judge will force this lawyer to represent him in court. When Kirkland appears to defend him, press and jury will perceive the judge as innocent, believing that no lawyer who hates a man would defend him unless he knew for certain that the accused was innocent, and is there on principle. The lawyer tries to escape this jam but hits the Negation of the Negation, a “legal” tyranny of high-court judges who blackmail him to represent their friend. If he doesn’t, they’ll expose a past indiscretion of his and have him disbarred.

然而，律师通过违法来对抗不公平、不公正和暴政：他站在陪审团面前，宣布他的客户“干了这件事”。他说，他知道他的客户是强奸犯，因为他的客户告诉他的。他在公众面前打败了法官，为受害者赢得了正义。虽然这一举动结束了律师的职业生涯，但正义现在像钻石一样闪耀，因为这不是罪犯入狱时带来的短暂正义，而是推翻暴君的伟大正义。

The lawyer, however, battles through unfairness, injustice, and tyranny by breaking the law: He steps in front of the jury and announces that his client “did it.” He knows that his client is the rapist, he says, because his client told him. He destroys the judge in public and wins justice for the victim. And although this stunt ends the lawyer’s career, justice now shines like a diamond, for it isn’t the momentary justice that comes when criminals are put behind bars, but the grand justice that brings down tyrants.

正义的矛盾与否定之否定之间的区别在于，违法者拥有相对有限且暂时的权力，而制定法律的人拥有无限且持久的权力。这是一个有法律的世界与一个强权即公理的世界之间的区别。不公正的绝对深度不是犯罪行为，而是政府针对其公民犯下的“合法”罪行。

The difference between the Contradictory and the Negation of the Negation of justice is the difference between the relatively limited and temporary power of those who break the law versus the unlimited and enduring power of those who make the law. It’s the difference between a world where law exists and a world where might makes right. The absolute depth of injustice is not criminality, but “legal” crimes committed by governments against their own citizens.

下面是更多例子，说明这种变格在其他故事和体裁中是如何运用的。首先，爱情：

Below are more examples to demonstrate how this declension works in other stories and genres. First, love:

憎恨他人已经够糟糕了，但即使是厌世者也会爱一个人。当自爱消失，人物厌恶自己的存在时，他就会达到否定之否定，生活变成人间地狱：《罪与罚》中的拉斯柯尔尼科夫。

To hate other people is bad enough, but even a misanthrope loves one person. When self-love vanishes and a character loathes his own being, he reaches the Negation of the Negation and existence becomes a living hell: Raskolnikov in CRIME AND PUNISHMENT.

第二种变化：

A second variation:

你更愿意和谁交往？和一个恨你并坦白承认的人，还是和一个你知道恨你却假装爱你的人？这就是《普通人》和《闪亮》登上家庭剧巅峰的原因。许多父母恨他们的孩子，许多孩子恨他们的父母，他们打架、尖叫、说出来。在这些优秀的电影中，尽管父母非常怨恨并暗中恨自己的孩子，但他们假装爱他。当反派加上那个谎言时，故事就进入了否定之否定。孩子如何能为自己辩护呢？

With whom would you rather have a relationship? With someone who hates you and honestly admits it, or with someone you know hates you but pretends to love you? This is what lifts ORDINARY PEOPLE and SHINE to the heights of Domestic Drama. Many parents hate their children, many children hate their parents, and they fight and scream and say it. In these fine films, although a parent bitterly resents and secretly hates his or her child, they pretend to love him. When the antagonist adds that lie, the story moves to the Negation of the Negation. How can a child defend himself against that?

当主要价值是真相时：

When the primary value is truth:

善意的谎言是相反的，因为它们通常被用来做善事：情侣们醒来时发现枕头上的皱纹印在脸上，互相告诉对方他们看起来有多漂亮。明目张胆的骗子知道真相，然后掩盖真相以获取利益。但当我们对自己撒谎并相信它时，真相就消失了，我们处于否定的否定：《欲望号街车》中的布兰奇。

White lies are the Contrary because they’re often told to do good: lovers waking up with pillow creases branded across their faces, telling each other how beautiful they look. The blatant liar knows the truth, then buries it to gain advantage. But when we lie to ourselves and believe it, truth vanishes and we’re at the Negation of the Negation: Blanche in A STREETCAR NAMED DESIRE.

如果积极是意识，充分活着并且有意识：

If the positive were Consciousness, being fully alive and aware:

这是恐怖电影的衰落，其中的反派是超自然的：《德古拉》、《罗斯玛丽的婴儿》。但我们不必信教就能理解诅咒的含义。无论地狱是否存在，这个世界都有自己的地狱，在这种困境中，死亡是一种仁慈，我们会乞求死亡。

This is the declension of Horror films in which the antagonist is supernatural: DRACULA, ROSEMARY’S BABY. But we don’t have to be religious to grasp the meaning of damnation. Whether or not hell exists, this world provides its own Infernos, plights in which death would be a mercy and we’d beg for it.

以《满洲候选人》为例。雷蒙德·肖（劳伦斯·哈维饰）似乎完全活着，意识清醒。然后我们得知他被催眠后暗示洗脑了，这是一种无意识的形式。在这种暗示下，他犯下了一系列谋杀案，包括杀害自己的妻子，但他这样做时还带着一定程度的无辜，因为他是一个邪恶阴谋中的棋子。但当他恢复理智，意识到自己做了什么以及别人对他做了什么时，他被打入了地狱。

Consider THE MANCHURIAN CANDIDATE. Raymond Shaw (Laurence Harvey) seems fully alive and aware. Then we learn that he’s been brainwashed by posthypnotic suggestion, a form of unconsciousness. Under this power he commits a string of murders, including that of his own wife, but does so with a degree of innocence, for he’s a pawn in a vicious conspiracy. But when he recovers his mind and realizes what he’s done and what’s been done to him, he’s taken down to hell.

他得知自己被乱伦、权力至上的母亲洗脑，她正利用他策划夺取白宫控制权的阴谋。雷蒙德可以冒着生命危险揭露他叛逆的母亲，或者杀死她。他选择不仅杀死他的母亲，还杀死他的继父和他自己，在令人震惊的“否定之否定”高潮中同时诅咒了他们三个人。

He learns he was brainwashed on the order of his incestuous, power-mad mother, who’s using him in a plot to seize control of the White House. Raymond could risk his life to expose his traitorous mother or kill her. He chooses to kill, not only his mother but his stepfather and himself as well, damning the three at once in a shocking climax at the Negation of the Negation.

如果积极的一面是财富：

If the positive were wealth:

在《华尔街》中，盖柯感到自己很贫穷，因为钱再多也不够。身为亿万富翁，他却像个饥饿的小偷，抓住一切非法机会攫取金钱。

In WALL STREET Gekko feels impoverished because no amount of money is enough. A billionaire, he acts as if he were a starving thief, grasping for money at any illegal opportunity.

如果积极的一面是人与人之间开放的沟通：

If the positive were open communication between people:

相反的情况有很多种——沉默、误解、情感障碍。“疏离”这个包罗万象的术语指的是与人相处，但感觉被切断，无法充分交流的情况。然而，在孤立中，除了你自己，没有人可以交谈。当你失去这一点，在内心深处失去沟通时，你就处于否定的否定和疯狂之中：《房客》中的特列尔科夫斯基。

The Contrary has many varieties—silence, misunderstanding, emotional blocks. The all-inclusive term “alienation” means a situation of being with people, but feeling cut off and unable to fully communicate. In isolation, however, there’s no one to talk to except yourself. When you lose this and suffer a loss of communication within your mind, you’re at the Negation of the Negation and insane: Trelkovsky in THE TENANT.

完全实现理想或目标：

Full achievement of ideals or goals:

妥协意味着“接受更少”，愿意放弃自己的理想，但不会完全放弃。然而，否定之否定是演艺界人士必须警惕的。诸如“我无法制作我想制作的优秀电影……但色情电影可以赚钱”这样的想法：《成功的甜蜜气息》和《梅菲斯特》。

Compromise means “settling for less,” the willingness to fall short of your ideal but not surrender it completely. The Negation of the Negation, however, is something people in show business have to guard against. Thoughts such as: “I can’t make the fine films I’d like to make… but there’s money in pornography”: THE SWEET SMELL OF SUCCESS and MEPHISTO.

智力：

Intelligence:

无知是由于缺乏信息而导致的暂时愚昧，但愚昧是坚定的，无论提供多少信息。否定之否定是双向的：从内心来说，当一个愚昧的人相信自己很聪明时，他就是众多喜剧人物的自负；从外表来说，当社会认为一个愚昧的人很聪明时，他就在那里。

Ignorance is temporary stupidity due to a lack of information, but stupidity is resolute, no matter how much information is given. The Negation of the Negation cuts both ways: inwardly, when a stupid person believes he’s intelligent, a conceit of numerous comic characters, or outwardly, when society thinks a stupid person is intelligent: BEING THERE.

自由：

Liberty:

约束有很多种。法律约束我们，但使文明成为可能，而监禁则完全是消极的，尽管社会认为它很有用。否定之否定有两种作用。内在的：自我奴役在性质上比奴隶制更糟糕。奴隶有自由意志，会尽一切努力逃跑。但用毒品或酒精腐蚀你的意志力，把自己变成奴隶则更糟糕。从表面上看：奴隶制被视为自由，这推动了小说和电影《1984》的创作。

Restraint has many shades. Laws bind us but make civilization possible, while imprisonment is fully negative, although society finds it useful. The Negation of the Negation works two ways. Inwardly: Self-enslavement is qualitatively worse than slavery. A slave has his free will and would do all he could to escape. But to corrode your willpower with drugs or alcohol and turn yourself into a slave is far worse. Outwardly: Slavery perceived as freedom impels the novel and films 1984.

勇气：

Courage:

勇敢的人在恐惧袭来时可能会暂时感到压抑，但最终他会采取行动。懦夫不会。然而，当懦夫采取表面上看似勇敢的行动时，就到了终点：一场战斗在散兵坑周围激烈进行。其中一名受伤的军官转向一名懦夫说：“杰克，你的伙伴们弹药快用完了。带着这些装着子弹的箱子穿过雷区，否则他们会被击溃。”于是懦夫掏出枪……射杀了军官。乍一看，我们可能会认为射杀一名军官需要勇气，但我们很快就会意识到，这是懦弱到极致的行为。

A courageous person can be temporarily stifled when fear strikes, but eventually he acts. The coward does not. The end of the line is reached, however, when a coward takes an action that outwardly appears courageous: A battle rages around a foxhole. In it a wounded officer turns to a coward and says: “Jack, your buddies are running out of ammo. Take these boxes of shells through the minefield or they’ll be overrun.” So the coward takes out his gun… and shoots the officer. At first glance we might think it would take courage to shoot an officer, but we’d soon realize that this was an act at the sheer limit of cowardice.

在《回家》中，海德上尉（布鲁斯·邓恩饰）为了逃离越南而开枪自杀。后来，在他的次要情节危机中，海德面临两害相权取其轻：生活充满屈辱和痛苦，死亡充满对未知的恐惧。他选择了更简单的道路，投河自尽。虽然有些自杀是勇敢的，比如绝食的政治犯，但在大多数情况下，自杀者走到了生命的尽头，采取的行为可能看起来很勇敢，但却缺乏活下去的勇气。

In COMING HOME Captain Boy Hyde (Bruce Dern) shoots himself in the leg to get out of Vietnam. Later, at the Crisis of his subplot Hyde faces the lesser of two evils: life with its humiliation and pain versus death with its dread of the unknown. He takes the easier path and drowns himself. Although some suicides are courageous, such as those of political prisoners on a hunger strike, in most cases the suicide reaches the end of the line and takes an action that may appear brave but lacks the courage to live.

忠诚：

Loyalty:

相反：已婚女性爱上了另一个男人，但没有付诸行动。她暗自对两个男人都忠心耿耿，但当丈夫知道后，他认为她不忠是一种背叛。她为自己辩护，辩称自己没有和另一个男人上床，所以她从未不忠。感觉和行动之间的差异往往是主观的。

Contrary: A married woman falls in love with another man, but doesn’t act on it. Secretly, she feels loyalty to both men, but when her husband learns of it, he sees her split allegiance as a betrayal. She defends herself, arguing that she didn’t sleep with the other man, so she was never disloyal. The difference between feeling and action is often subjective.

十九世纪中叶，奥斯曼帝国逐渐失去对塞浦路斯的控制，该岛很快落入英国的统治。在《帕斯卡利岛》中，帕斯卡利（本·金斯利饰）为土耳其政府做间谍，但他是个胆小鬼，他平淡的报告无人问津。这位孤独的灵魂与一对英国夫妇（查尔斯·丹斯和海伦·米伦饰）成为朋友，他们为他提供了在英国更快乐的生活。他们是唯一认真对待帕斯卡利的人，他被他们吸引。虽然他们自称是考古学家，但随着时间的推移，他怀疑他们是英国间谍（分裂效忠）并背叛了他们。直到他们被杀后，他才发现他们是盗取古代雕像的文物窃贼。他的背叛悲剧性地背叛了他自己的希望和梦想。

In the mid-nineteenth century the Ottoman Empire was losing its grip on Cyprus and the island was soon to fall to British rule. In PASCALI’S ISLAND, Pascali (Ben Kingsley) spies for the Turkish government, but he’s a frightened man whose bland reports go unread. This lonely soul is befriended by a British couple (Charles Dance and Helen Mirren) who offer him a happier life in England. They’re the only people who have ever taken Pascali seriously, and he’s drawn to them. Although they claim to be archaeologists, in time he suspects they’re British spies (split allegiance) and betrays them. Only when they’re killed does he discover they were antiquity thieves after an ancient statue. His betrayal tragically betrays his own hopes and dreams.

到期：

Maturity:

在《BIG》的激励事件中，青少年乔希·巴斯金（大卫·莫斯科饰）变成了一个三十二岁的男人（汤姆·汉克斯饰）。影片立即跳到否定的否定，然后探索了否定的灰色和黑色。当乔希和他的老板（罗伯特·劳吉亚饰）在 FAO Schwartz 的玩具钢琴上跳踢踏舞时，这是幼稚的，但积极多于消极。当乔希和他的同事（约翰·赫德饰）在手球场上玩“远离”时，这是非常幼稚的。事实上，我们意识到整个成人世界是一个游乐场，里面满是玩着企业“远离”的孩子。

At the Inciting Incident of BIG the adolescent Josh Baskin (David Moscow) is transformed into what appears to be a thirty-two-year-old man (Tom Hanks). The film jumps immediately to the Negation of the Negation, then explores the grays and blacks of negativity. When Josh and his boss (Robert Loggia) tap dance on a toy piano at F.A.O. Schwartz, this is childish, but more positive than negative. When Josh and his coworker (John Heard) play “keep away” on the handball court, this is perfectly childish. In fact, we come to realize that the whole adult world is a playground full of children playing corporate “keep away.”

在危机时刻，乔什面临着无法调和的两难境地：拥有令人满意的职业和他爱的女人，过着成年人的生活，还是回到青春期。他做出了成熟的选择，拥有童年，用一种巧妙的讽刺来表达他终于“长大了”。因为他和我们都感觉到，成熟的关键是拥有一个完整的童年。但是，由于生活在年轻时亏待了我们很多人，我们在某种程度上生活在成熟的否定中否定。《长大》是一部非常明智的电影。

At the Crisis Josh faces irreconcilable goods: an adult life with a fulfilling career and the woman he loves versus a return to adolescence. He makes the mature choice to have his childhood, expressing with a fine irony that he has at last become “big.” For he and we sense that the key to maturity is to have had a complete childhood. But because life has short-changed so many of us in youth, we live, to one degree or another, at the Negation of the Negation of maturity. BIG is a very wise film.

最后，考虑一个故事，其中的积极价值是被认可的自然性行为。被认可的意思是社会所容忍；自然的意思是为生育而进行的性行为、随之而来的快乐以及爱的表达。

Lastly, consider a story in which the positive value is sanctioned natural sex. Sanctioned meaning condoned by society; natural meaning sex for procreation, attendant pleasure, and an expression of love.

相反的是，婚外性行为和婚前性行为虽然很自然，但却不被人们所接受。社会往往做得更多比反对卖淫更令人反感，但可以说卖淫是自然的。重婚、一夫多妻、一妻多夫、跨种族婚姻和普通法婚姻在某些社会中是被宽恕的，而在另一些社会中则不被认可。贞洁可以说是不自然的，但没有人会阻止你保持独身，而与宣誓独身的人（如牧师或修女）发生性关系则遭到教会的反对。

Under the Contrary falls acts of extramarital and premarital sex that, although natural, are frowned on. Society often does more than frown on prostitution, but it’s arguably natural. Bigamy, polygamy, polyandry, and interracial and common-law marriage are condoned in some societies, unsanctioned in others. Chastity is arguably unnatural, but no one’s going to stop you from being celibate, while sex with someone who has taken a vow of celibacy, such as a priest or a nun, is frowned on by the Church.

在矛盾之下，人类似乎不知道发明的极限：偷窥狂、色情、色情狂、女性主义、恋物癖、露阴癖、摩擦癖、异装癖、乱伦、强奸、恋童癖和虐待狂，这些只是一些未经认可和违反自然的行为。

Under the Contradictory, humanity seems to know no limit of invention: voyeurism, pornography, satyriasis, nymphomania, fetishism, exhibitionism, frottage, transvestism, incest, rape, pedophilia, and sadomasochism, to name only a few acts that are unsanctioned and unnatural.

同性恋和双性恋很难界定。在一些社会中，同性恋被认为是自然的，而在另一些社会中，同性恋则被认为是不自然的。在许多西方国家，同性恋是合法的；在一些第三世界国家，同性恋仍是悬而未决的罪行。许多这样的定义似乎很随意，因为性与社会和个人观念有关。

Homosexuality and bisexuality are difficult to place. In some societies they’re thought natural, in others, unnatural. In many Western countries homosexuality is sanctioned; in some Third World countries it’s still a hanging offense. Many of these designations may seem arbitrary, for sex is relative to social and personal perception.

但普通的变态行为并非终点。它们会单调而执着地与另一个人发生性关系，甚至会使用暴力。然而，当性对象来自其他物种（兽交）或死尸（恋尸癖）时，或者当变态行为的复合体堆积起来时，心灵就会反抗。

But common perversions are not the end of the line. They’re singular and committed, even with violence, with another human being. When, however, the sexual object is from another species—bestiality—or dead—necrophilia—or when compounds of perversities pile up, the mind revolts.

唐人街：被认可的自然性行为的终点不是乱伦。这只是一个矛盾。在这部电影中，否定的否定是与你自己乱伦的后代乱伦。这就是为什么伊芙琳·穆尔雷冒着生命危险不让她的孩子与她的孩子发生性关系。父亲。她知道他疯了，还会再犯。这就是谋杀的动机。克罗斯杀死了他的女婿，因为穆尔雷不肯告诉他他的女儿藏在哪里。这就是高潮之后发生的事情，克罗斯蒙住了受惊的孩子的眼睛，把她从母亲可怕的死亡中拉出来。

CHINATOWN: The end of the line of sanctioned natural sex is not incest. It’s only a Contradictory. In this film the Negation of the Negation is incest with the offspring of your own incest. This is why Evelyn Mulwray risks her life to keep her child from her father. She knows he’s mad and will do it again. This is the motivation for the murder. Cross killed his son-in-law because Mulwray wouldn’t tell him where his daughter by his daughter was hiding. This is what will happen after the Climax as Cross covers the terrified child’s eyes and pulls her away from her mother’s horrific death.

否定之否定的原则不仅适用于悲剧，也适用于喜剧。喜剧世界是一个混乱、狂野的地方，行动必须达到极限。否则，笑声就会平淡无奇。即使是弗雷德·阿斯坦/金格尔·罗杰斯电影的轻松娱乐也触及了底线。他们转向了真相的价值，因为弗雷德·阿斯坦传统上扮演一个遭受自欺欺人的角色，告诉自己他爱上了那个光鲜亮丽的女孩，但我们知道他的心真的属于金格尔。

The principle of the Negation of the Negation applies not only to the tragic but to the comic. The comic world is a chaotic, wild place where actions must go to the limit. If not, the laughs falls flat. Even the light entertainment of Fred Astaire/Ginger Rogers films touched the end of the line. They turned on the value of truth as Fred Astaire traditionally played a character suffering from self-deception, telling himself he was in love with the glitzy girl when we knew that his heart really belonged to Ginger.

优秀作家始终明白，对立的价值观并不是人类经验的极限。如果一个故事止步于矛盾价值观，或者更糟的是，止步于相反价值观，那么它就与我们每年遭受的数百种平庸行为如出一辙。因为一个故事如果只是关于爱/恨、真相/谎言、自由/奴役、勇气/懦弱等，几乎肯定会是微不足道的。如果一个故事没有达到否定之否定，它可能会给观众留下满意的印象——但永远不会精彩，永远不会崇高。

Fine writers have always understood that opposite values are not the limit of human experience. If a story stops at the Contradictory value, or worse, the Contrary, it echoes the hundreds of mediocrities we suffer every year. For a story that is simply about love/hate, truth/lie, freedom/slavery, courage/cowardice, and the like is almost certain to be trivial. If a story does not reach the Negation of the Negation, it may strike the audience as satisfying—but never brilliant, never sublime.

在天赋、技艺和知识等所有其他因素都相同的情况下，作家对消极面的处理才是伟大之处。

All other factors of talent, craft, and knowledge being equal, greatness is found in the writer’s treatment of the negative side.

如果你的故事看起来不尽人意，或者在某些方面有所欠缺，那么就需要一些工具来洞察其中的混乱之处，发现其中的缺陷。当一个故事很弱时，必然的原因是对抗力量很弱。与其浪费你的创造力去创造主人公和世界的可爱、吸引人的方面，不如构建负面的一面，以创造连锁反应，在积极方面自然而诚实地获得回报。

If your story seems unsatisfying and lacking in some way, tools are needed to penetrate its confusions and perceive its flaws. When a story is weak, the inevitable cause is that forces of antagonism are weak. Rather than spending your creativity trying to invent likable, attractive aspects of protagonist and world, build the negative side to create a chain reaction that pays off naturally and honestly on the positive dimensions.

第一步是质疑所涉及的价值观及其发展。什么是积极的价值观？哪一个是最重要的，并成为故事的高潮？对抗力量是否探索了所有消极的层面？它们在某个时候是否达到了否定之否定的力量？

The first step is to question the values at stake and their progression. What are the positive values? Which is preeminent and turns the Story Climax? Do the forces of antagonism explore all shades of negativity? Do they reach the power of the Negation of the Negation at some point?

一般来说，第一幕的进展是从正面到反面，到后面几幕的矛盾，最后到最后一幕的否定之否定，要么以悲剧结尾，要么以巨大的差异回到正面。另一方面，《飞越未来》跳跃到否定之否定，然后阐明了所有程度的不成熟。《卡萨布兰卡》甚至更加激进。它以否定之否定开场，里克生活在法西斯暴政下，遭受自我憎恨和自我欺骗，然后以三个价值观的正面高潮收尾。一切皆有可能，但必须到达终点。

Generally, progressions run from the Positive to the Contrary in Act One, to the Contradictory in later acts, and finally to the Negation of the Negation in the last act, either ending tragically or going back to the Positive with a profound difference. BIG, on the other hand, leaps to the Negation of the Negation, then illuminates all degrees of immaturity. CASABLANCA is even more radical. It opens at the Negation of the Negation with Rick living in fascist tyranny, suffering self-hatred and self-deception, then works to a positive climax for all three values. Anything is possible, but the end of the line must be reached.

15

展览

15

EXPOSITION

展示而非讲述

SHOW, DON’T TELL

阐述意味着事实——观众需要知道的背景、传记和人物塑造的信息，以便跟进和理解故事情节。

Exposition means facts—the information about setting, biography, and characterization that the audience needs to know to follow and comprehend the events of the story.

在剧本的前几页，读者只需注意作者如何处理说明，就能判断作者的相对技巧。出色的说明并不能保证故事精彩，但它确实告诉我们作者精通这门手艺。说明技巧意味着让说明变得无形。随着故事的进展，观众会毫不费力地、甚至无意识地吸收所有需要了解的内容。

Within the first pages of a screenplay a reader can judge the relative skill of the writer simply by noting how he handles exposition. Well-done exposition doesn’t guarantee a superb story, but it does tell us that the writer knows the craft. Skill in exposition means making it invisible. As the story progresses, the audience absorbs all it needs to know effortlessly, even unconsciously.

著名的格言“展示而不是讲述”是关键。永远不要强迫角色说出关于世界、历史或人的事情。相反，向我们展示真实、自然的场景，在这些场景中，人类以真实、自然的方式说话和行为……同时间接地传递必要的事实。换句话说，戏剧化地展示。

The famous axiom “Show, don’t tell” is the key. Never force words into a character’s mouth to tell the audience about world, history, or person. Rather, show us honest, natural scenes in which human beings talk and behave in honest, natural ways… yet at the same time indirectly pass along the necessary facts. In other words, dramatize exposition.

戏剧化的解说有两个目的：其主要目的是进一步推进眼前的冲突。其次要目的是传达信息。焦虑的新手会颠倒这一顺序，将解说责任置于戏剧性需要之前。

Dramatized exposition serves two ends: Its primary purpose is to further the immediate conflict. Its secondary purpose is to convey information. The anxious novice reverses that order, putting expositional duty ahead of dramatic necessity.

例如：杰克说：“哈利，我们到底认识多久了？什么？大约二十年了，嗯？从我们一起上大学开始。那可真是很长的时间了，不是吗，哈利？那么，你今天早上好吗？”这些话毫无意义除了告诉偷听的观众杰克和哈利是朋友，二十年前一起上学，他们还没有吃午饭——这是一种非常不自然的行为。没有人会告诉别人他们都知道的事情，除非说出显而易见的事情是为了满足另一个迫切的需求。因此，如果需要这些信息，作者必须为对话创造一个比事实更重要的动机。

For example: Jack says, “Harry, how the hell long have we known one another? What? About twenty years, huh? Ever since we were at college together. That’s a long time, isn’t it, Harry? Well, how the hell are ya this morning?” Those lines have no purpose except to tell the eavesdropping audience that Jack and Harry are friends, went to school together twenty years ago, and they haven’t had lunch yet—a deadly beat of unnatural behavior. No one ever tells someone something they both already know unless saying the obvious fills another and compelling need. Therefore, if this information is needed, the writer must create a motivation for the dialogue that’s greater than the facts.

要使解说戏剧化，请应用以下助记原则：将解说转化为弹药。您的角色了解他们的世界、他们的历史、彼此和他们自己。让他们利用他们所知道的东西作为弹药，努力获得他们想要的东西。将上述内容转化为弹药：杰克看到哈利抑制不住的哈欠和充血的眼睛，说道：“哈利，看看你。同样的嬉皮士发型，中午仍然昏昏欲睡，同样的幼稚特技让你在二十年前被学校开除。你什么时候能醒来闻到咖啡的香味？”观众的目光跳过屏幕看到哈利的反应，并间接听到“二十年”和“学校”。

To dramatize exposition apply this mnemonic principle: Convert exposition to ammunition. Your characters know their world, their history, each other, and themselves. Let them use what they know as ammunition in their struggle to get what they want. Converting the above to ammunition: Jack, reacting to Harry’s stifled yawn and bloodshot eyes, says, “Harry, look at you. The same hippie haircut, still stoned by noon, the same juvenile stunts that got you kicked out of school twenty years ago. Are you ever gonna wake up and smell the coffee?” The audience’s eye jumps across the screen to see Harry’s reaction and indirectly hears “twenty years” and “school.”

顺便说一句，“展示而非讲述”并不意味着可以将镜头从壁炉架上移到一系列照片上，这些照片记录了哈利和杰克从大学时代到新兵训练营、结婚到开办干洗店的整个过程。这是讲述，而不是展示。让摄像机这样做会把一部故事片变成一部家庭电影。“展示而非讲述”意味着角色和摄像机的行为要真实。

“Show, don’t tell,” by the way, doesn’t mean that it’s all right to pan the camera down a mantelpiece on a series of photographs that take Harry and Jack from their university days to boot camp to the double wedding to opening their dry cleaning business. That’s telling, not showing. Asking the camera to do it turns a feature film into a home movie. “Show, don’t tell” means that characters and camera behave truthfully.

处理棘手的解说问题让一些作家望而生畏，他们试图尽快解决所有问题，以便工作室的剧本分析师能够专心于他们的故事。但是，当被迫艰难地读完充满解说的第一幕时，读者会意识到这是一位无法掌握基本技巧的业余作家，并直接跳到最后几幕。

Dealing with the knotty problems of exposition so intimidates some writers that they try to get it all out of the way as soon as possible, so the studio script analyst can concentrate on their stories. But when forced to wade through an Act One stuffed with exposition, the reader realizes that this is an amateur who can’t handle the basic craft, and skims to the last scenes.

自信的作家会一点一点地分析整个故事的说明，通常会在最后一幕的高潮中揭示说明。他们遵循以下两个原则：绝不包含观众可以合理且轻易地假设已经发生的事情。除非遗漏的事实会引起混淆，否则绝不省略说明。你不能通过向听众提供信息来保持他们的兴趣，而应该通过保留信息（除了那些对于理解绝对必要的信息）。

Confident writers parse out exposition, bit by bit, through the entire story, often revealing exposition well into the Climax of the last act. They follow these two principles: Never include anything the audience can reasonably and easily assume has happened. Never pass on exposition unless the missing fact would cause confusion. You do not keep the audience’s interest by giving it information, but by withholding information, except that which is absolutely necessary for comprehension.

安排好解说的节奏。像其他一切一样，解说必须有一个渐进的模式：因此，最不重要的事实先出现，次重要的事实随后出现，关键事实最后出现。解说的关键部分是什么？秘密。人物不想知道的痛苦真相。

Pace the exposition. Like all else, exposition must have a progressive pattern: Therefore, the least important facts come in early, the next most important later, the critical facts last. And what are the critical pieces of exposition? Secrets. The painful truths characters do not want known.

换句话说，不要写“加州场景”。加州场景是指两个几乎不认识对方的角色坐在一起喝咖啡，然后立即开始亲密地讨论他们生活中深藏的黑暗秘密：“哦，我的童年很糟糕。为了惩罚我，我妈妈常常把我的头冲进马桶。”“哼！你以为你的童年很糟糕。为了惩罚我，我爸爸把狗屎塞进我的鞋子里，让我就这样去上学。”

In other words, don’t write “California scenes.” “California scenes” are scenes in which two characters who hardly know each other sit down over coffee and immediately begin an intimate discussion of the deep, dark secrets of their lives: “Oh, I had a rotten childhood. To punish me my mother used to flush my head in the toilet.” “Huh! You think you had a bad childhood. To punish me my father put dog shit in my shoes and made me to go to school like that.”

刚认识的人之间毫无防备地坦诚而痛苦的告白是强迫的和虚假的。当有人向作家指出这一点时，他们会争辩说，这确实会发生，人们会与完全陌生的人分享非常私密的事情。我同意。但仅限于加州。亚利桑那州、纽约、伦敦、巴黎或世界其他任何地方都不会发生。

Unguardedly honest and painful confessions between people who have just met are forced and false. When this is pointed out to writers, they will argue that it actually happens, that people share very personal things with total strangers. And I agree. But only in California. Not in Arizona, New York, London, Paris, or anywhere else in the world.

某些西海岸人会随身携带一些事先准备好的深藏不露的秘密，在鸡尾酒会上与他人分享，以此向对方证明自己是地道的加州人——“以自我为中心”且“与内心世界保持联系”。当我在这样的派对上站在玉米饼蘸酱旁，有人告诉我他小时候在 Keds 鞋里放了狗屎，我就会想：“哇！如果这就是他边吃鳄梨酱边告诉人们的深藏不露的秘密，那真正的秘密是什么？”因为总会有其他东西。说出来的东西隐藏着不能说的东西。

A certain breed of West Coaster carries around prepared deep dark secrets to share with one another at cocktail parties to validate themselves one to the other as authentic Californians—“centered” and “in touch with their inner beings.” When I’m standing over the tortilla dip at such parties and somebody tells me about dog shit in his Keds as a child, my thought is: “Wow! If that’s the prepared deep dark secret he tells people over the guacamole, what’s the real stuff?” For there’s always something else. Whatever is said hides what cannot be said.

伊芙琳·穆尔雷的坦白“她是我的妹妹，也是我的女儿”并不是她会在鸡尾酒会上分享的。她告诉吉蒂斯这些是为了让她的孩子不落入她父亲的手中。“你不能杀我，卢克，我是你的父亲”是达斯·维德从不想告诉他儿子的真相，但如果他不这样做，他就必须杀死他的孩子，或者被他的孩子杀死。

Evelyn Mulwray’s confession, “She’s my sister and my daughter” is nothing she would share over cocktails. She tells Gittes this to keep her child out of her father’s hands. “You can’t kill me, Luke, I’m your father” is a truth Darth Vader never wanted to tell his son, but if he doesn’t, he’ll have to kill or be killed by his child.

这些是真实而有力的时刻，因为生活的压力将这些角色挤压在两害相权取其轻的境地。在一个精心设计的故事中，压力最大的地方在哪里？在故事的结尾。因此，明智的作家遵循时间艺术的第一原则：把最好的留到最后。因为如果我们过早透露太多，观众会在高潮到来之前很久就看到高潮。

These are honest and powerful moments because the pressure of life is squeezing these characters between the lesser of two evils. And where in a well-crafted story is pressure the greatest? At the end of the line. The wise writer, therefore, obeys the first principle of temporal art: Save the best for last. For if we reveal too much too soon, the audience will see the climaxes coming long before they arrive.

仅透露观众绝对需要和想要知道的内容，无需更多。

Reveal only that exposition the audience absolutely needs and wants to know and no more.

另一方面，由于编剧控制着讲述，他控制着观众的求知欲望。如果在讲述的某个时刻，观众必须知道某个情节，否则就无法理解，那么就可以通过激发好奇心来激发求知欲望。在电影观众的脑海中提出“为什么？”的问题。“为什么这个角色会这样做？为什么不发生这样或那样的事情？为什么？”有了对信息的渴望，即使是最复杂的戏剧事实也会顺利地被观众理解。

On the other hand, since the writer controls the telling, he controls the need and desire to know. If at a certain point in the telling, a piece of exposition must be known or the audience wouldn’t be able to follow, create the desire to know by arousing curiosity. Put the question “Why?” in the filmgoer’s mind. “Why is this character behaving this way? Why doesn’t this or that happen? Why?” With a hunger for information, even the most complicated set of dramatized facts will pass smoothly into understanding.

处理传记式叙述的一种方法是从主人公的童年开始讲述，然后贯穿他一生的几十年。例如，《末代皇帝》涵盖了溥仪（尊龙饰演）六十多年的人生。故事串联了他从成为中国皇帝的婴儿时期、青少年时期和青年婚姻、西方教育、堕落、成为日本傀儡的岁月、共产党统治下的生活以及他在北京植物园当工人的最后时光。《小巨人》跨越了一个世纪。《肉欲》、《霸王别姬》和《闪亮的风采》都从青年时期开始，然后跳跃式地将主人公生活中的关键事件贯穿到中年或更晚。

One way to cope with biographical exposition is to start the telling in the protagonist’s childhood and then work through all the decades of his life. THE LAST EMPEROR, for example, covers over sixty years in the life of Pu Yi (John Lone). The story strings together scenes from his infancy when he’s made Emperor of China, his teenage years and youthful marriage, his Western education, his fall into decadence, his years as a Japanese stooge, life under the Communists, and his last days as a laborer in Peking’s Botanical Gardens. LITTLE BIG MAN spans a century. CARNAL KNOWLEDGE, FAREWELL, MY CONCUBINE, and SHINE all start in youth and leapfrog through the key events of the protagonists’ lives into middle age or beyond.

然而，尽管这种设计在阐述方面可能很方便，但绝大多数主角都无法从出生到死亡，原因如下：他们的故事没有主线。要讲述一个跨越一生的故事，必须创造一个具有巨大力量和持久性的主线。但对于大多数角色来说，童年时期的激励事件所激发的单一、深刻的欲望，会几十年都得不到满足吗？这就是为什么几乎所有的故事都在几个月、几周甚至几个小时内追寻主角的主线。

However, as convenient as that design may be in terms of exposition, the vast majority of protagonists cannot be followed from birth to death for this reason: Their story would have no Spine. To tell a story that spans a lifetime a Spine of enormous power and persistence must be created. But for most characters, what single, deep desire, aroused out of an Inciting Incident in childhood, would go unquenched for decades? This is why nearly all tellings pursue the protagonist’s Spine over months, weeks, even hours.

然而，如果可以创作出富有弹性、经久耐用的Spine，那么故事就可以在几十年内讲述，而无需成为连续剧。连续剧并不意味着“涵盖很长的时间”，而是“零星的、不规则的间隔”。如果一天中发生的所有事情都与当天发生的其他事情没有联系，那么一个在二十四小时内讲述的故事很可能是连续剧。另一方面，《小巨人》围绕着一个男人阻止白人对美洲原住民进行种族灭绝的探索而展开——这场暴行跨越了几代人，因此是一个世纪的故事。《性知识》的驱动力是一个男人羞辱和摧毁女性的盲目欲望，这是他永远无法理解的一种毒害灵魂的欲望。

If, however, an elastic, endurable Spine can be created, then a story can be told over decades without being episodic. Episodic does not mean “covering long stretches of time” but rather “sporadic, irregular intervals.” A story told over twenty-four hours could well be episodic if everything that happens in that day is unconnected to everything else that happens. On the other hand, LITTLE BIG MAN is unified around a man’s quest to prevent the genocide of Native Americans by the whites—an atrocity that spanned generations, therefore a century of storytelling. CARNAL KNOWLEDGE is driven by a man’s blind need to humiliate and destroy women, a soul-poisoning desire he never fathoms.

在《末代皇帝》中，一个人用一生去回答这个问题：我是谁？溥仪三岁时被立为皇帝，但他并不知道这意味着什么。对他来说，皇宫就是游乐场。他一直坚守童年的身份，直到十几岁还在吃奶。帝国官员坚持让他像个皇帝一样行事，但他后来发现帝国并不存在。背负着虚假身份的负担，他尝试了各种身份，但没有一种适合他：首先是英国学者和绅士；然后是性爱运动员和享乐主义者；后来是国际美食家，在豪华派对上模仿辛纳屈；接下来是政治家，最后却成了日本人的傀儡。最后，共产党给了他最后的身份——园丁。

In THE LAST EMPEROR a man spends his life trying to answer the question: Who am I? At age three Pu Yi is made Emperor but has no idea what that means. To him a palace is a playground. He clings to his childhood identity until as a teenager he’s still nursing from the breast. The Imperial officials insist he act like an emperor, but he then discovers there is no empire. Burdened with a false identity, he tries on one personality after another but none fit: first English scholar and gentleman; then sex athlete and hedonist; later international bon vivant doing Sinatra imitations at posh parties; next a statesman, only to end up a puppet to the Japanese. Finally, the Communists give him his last identity—gardener.

《霸王别姬》讲述了蝶衣（张国荣饰）五十年来追求真理的历程。小时候，京剧大师们对他进行残酷的殴打、洗脑，强迫他承认自己具有女性特质——而实际上他没有。如果他承认了，就不需要酷刑了。他很女性化，但和许多女性化的男人一样，他内心是男性。因此，他被迫生活在谎言中，他讨厌一切谎言，无论是个人谎言还是政治谎言。从那一刻起，故事中的所有冲突都源于他想要说真话的愿望。但在中国，只有骗子才能生存。最后，他意识到真理是不可能的，于是自杀。

FAREWELL, MY CONCUBINE tells of Dieyi’s (Leslie Cheung) fifty-year quest to live in the truth. When he is a child, the masters of the Peking Opera ruthlessly beat, brainwash, and force him to confess that he has a female nature—when he does not. If he did, torture wouldn’t be necessary. He’s effeminate, but like many effeminate men he is at heart male. So, forced to live a lie, he hates all lies, personal and political. From that point on all the conflicts in the story stem from his desire to speak the truth. But in China only liars survive. Finally realizing that truth is an impossibility, he takes his own life.

因为终身故事很少见，所以我们采纳了亚里士多德的建议，以“事物中间”的方式开始故事。在确定主人公一生中高潮事件的日期后，我们开始尽可能接近时间。这种设计压缩了讲述的时间长度，并延长了人物在激励事件之前的生平。例如，如果高潮发生在人物三十五岁生日那天，那么我们不是在他的十几岁时开始拍摄电影，而是在他生日前一个月开始拍摄。这给了主角三十五年的时间来最大化他的存在价值。因此，当他的生活失去平衡时，他现在处于危险之中，故事充满了冲突。

Because lifelong Spines are rare, we take Aristotle’s advice to begin stories in medias res, “in the midst of things.” After locating the date of the climactic event of the protagonist’s life, we begin as close in time to it as possible. This design compresses the telling’s duration, and lengthens the character’s biography before the Inciting Incident. For example, if the Climax occurs on the day a character turns thirty-five, instead of starting the film when he’s a teenager, we open the film perhaps a month before his birthday. This gives the protagonist thirty-five years of living to build the maximum value into his existence. As a result, when his life goes out of balance, he is now at risk and the story is filled with conflict.

例如，想想写一个关于无家可归的酒鬼的故事有多困难。他有什么可失去的？几乎没有。对于一个忍受着街头无法形容的压力的人来说，死亡可能是一种仁慈，天气的变化也可能给他带来这种仁慈。目睹生命除了存在之外几乎没有任何价值是可悲的，但由于利害关系如此之小，作家只能画一幅静态的苦难画像。

Consider, for example, the difficulties of writing a story about a homeless alcoholic. What has he to lose? Virtually nothing. To a soul enduring the unspeakable stress of the streets, death may be a mercy, and a change in the weather might give him that. Lives with little or no value beyond their existence are pathetic to witness, but with so little at stake, the writer is reduced to painting a static portrait of suffering.

相反，我们讲述的是那些有东西要失去的人的故事——家庭、事业、理想、机会、名誉、现实的希望和梦想。当这样的生活失去平衡时，人物就会处于危险之中。他们在努力实现生存平衡的过程中，可能会失去他们所拥有的一切。他们的战斗冒着来之不易的价值观与敌对势力对抗的风险，从而产生了冲突。当故事充满冲突时，人物需要他们能得到的所有弹药。因此，作家很容易就能戏剧化地展开叙述，事实自然而然地、无形地融入到情节中。但当故事缺乏冲突时，作家就被迫“打扫桌子”。

Rather, we tell stories about people who have something to lose—family, careers, ideals, opportunities, reputations, realistic hopes and dreams. When such lives go out of balance, the characters are placed at jeopardy. They stand to lose what they have in their struggle to achieve a rebalancing of existence. Their battle, risking hard-won values against the forces of antagonism, generates conflict. And when story is thick with conflict, the characters need all the ammunition they can get. As a result, the writer has little trouble dramatizing exposition and facts flow naturally and invisibly into the action. But when stories lack conflict, the writer is forced into “table dusting.”

例如，19 世纪许多剧作家就是这样处理解说的：客厅布景拉开帷幕。进来两个佣人：一个在那里工作了三十年，另一个是那天早上刚雇来的年轻女仆。年长的女仆转过身对新来的人说：“哦，你不知道约翰逊博士和他的家人，对吧？好吧，让我告诉你……”当他们打扫家具时，年长的女仆讲述了约翰逊一家的整个生活史、世界和性格特征。这就是“打扫桌子”，没有动机的解说。

Here, for example, is how many playwrights of the nineteenth century handled exposition: The curtain comes up on a living room set. Enter two domestics: One who’s worked there for the last thirty years, the other the young maid just hired that morning. The older maid turns to the newcomer and says, “Oh, you don’t know about Dr. Johnson and his family, do you? Well, let me tell you…” And as they dust the furniture the older maid lays out the entire life history, world, and characterizations of the Johnson family. That’s “table dusting,” unmotivated exposition.

直到今天我们仍然能看到它。

And we still see it today.

疫情爆发：在片头，丹尼尔斯上校（达斯汀·霍夫曼饰）飞往西非，阻止埃博拉病毒的爆发。机上还有一名年轻的医务助理。丹尼尔斯转过身对他说：“你不知道埃博拉，对吧？”并详细阐述了这种病毒的病理。如果这位年轻的助理没有接受过对抗这种威胁地球上所有人类生命的疾病的训练，那么他执行这项任务是为了什么？每当你发现自己在写一段对话时，其中一个角色正在告诉另一个角色他们都已经知道或应该知道的事情，请问问自己，这是戏剧化的吗？这是在用解说来引人深思吗？如果不是，就删掉它。

OUTBREAK: In the opening sequence, Colonel Daniels (Dustin Hoffman) flies to West Africa to halt an outbreak of the Ebola virus. On board is a young medical assistant. Daniels turns to him and says, in effect, “You don’t know about Ebola, do you?” and lays out the pathology of the virus. If the young assistant is untrained to fight a disease that threatens all human life on the planet, what’s he doing on this mission? Any time you find yourself writing a line of dialogue in which one character is telling another something that they both already know or should know, ask yourself, is it dramatized? Is it exposition as ammunition? If not, cut it.

如果你能彻底戏剧化地展现故事情节，并让它变得无形，如果你能控制它的展现，只在观众需要和想要知道的时候才进行分析，把最好的留到最后，那么你就是在学习写作技巧。但是，对于初学写作者来说，问题却成了精通写作技巧的人的宝贵财富。他们不会通过赋予角色匿名的过去来避免展现故事情节，而是不遗余力地用重大事件来充实他们的传记。因为讲故事的人在讲述过程中面临的挑战是什么？如何扭转场景。如何创造转折点。

If you can thoroughly dramatize exposition and make it invisible, if you can control its disclosure, parsing it out only when and if the audience needs and wants to know it, saving the best for last, you’re learning your craft. But what’s a problem for beginning writers becomes an invaluable asset to those who know the craft. Rather than avoiding exposition by giving their characters an anonymous past, they go out of their way to salt their biographies with significant events. Because what is the challenge that the storyteller faces dozens of times over in the telling? How to turn the scene. How to create Turning Points.

背景故事的运用

THE USE OF BACKSTORY

我们只能通过两种方式之一来改变场景：通过行动或通过启示。没有其他方法。例如，如果我们有一对情侣，他们有着积极的关系，相爱且在一起，并且想将其转变为消极的关系，充满仇恨和分离，我们可以通过行动来实现：她打了他一巴掌，说：“我再也受不了了。一切都结束了。”或者通过启示：他看着她说：“过去三年我一直和你姐姐有染。你打算怎么做？”

We can turn scenes only one of two ways: on action or on revelation. There are no other means. If, for example, we have a couple in a positive relationship, in love and together, and want to turn it to the negative, in hate and apart, we could do it on action: She slaps him across the face and says, “I’m not taking this anymore. It’s over.” Or on revelation: He looks at her and says, “I’ve been having an affair with your sister for the last three years. What are you going to do about it?”

强有力的启示来自背景故事——人物生活中的先前重大事件作家可以在关键时刻揭示这一点，从而创造转折点。

Powerful revelations come from the BACKSTORY—previous significant events in the lives of the characters that the writer can reveal at critical moments to create Turning Points.

唐人街：“她是我的妹妹和女儿”是解说词，保留下来是为了创造一个惊人的启示，将第二幕推向高潮，并为第三幕的螺旋式发展奠定基础。帝国反击战：“你不能杀我，卢克，我是你的父亲”是星球大战背景故事中的解说词，保留下来是为了创造尽可能大的效果，将高潮推向高潮，并为一部全新的电影《绝地归来》奠定基础。

CHINATOWN: “She’s my sister and my daughter” is exposition, saved to create a stunning revelation that turns the second act Climax and sets up a spiraling Act Three. THE EMPIRE STRIKES BACK: “You can’t kill me, Luke, I’m your father” is exposition from the Backstory of STAR WARS saved to create the greatest possible effect, to turn the Climax and set up an entire new film, RETURN OF THE JEDI.

罗伯特·汤本可以在《唐人街》的早期就揭露克罗斯家族的乱伦，让吉蒂斯从一个不忠诚的仆人那里挖出这个事实。乔治·卢卡斯本可以让 C3PO 警告 R2D2，“不要告诉卢克，他听到这个会很难过，但达斯是他的父亲”，从而揭露卢克的父亲身份。相反，他们利用背景故事的阐述来创造爆炸性的转折点，拉开期望和结果之间的差距，并带来一股洞察力。除了少数例外，场景只能靠动作、动作、动作来展开。我们不可避免地需要动作和启示的结合。事实上，启示往往更有影响力，所以我们经常把它们留到主要的转折点，也就是高潮部分。

Robert Towne could have exposed the Cross family incest early in CHINATOWN by having Gittes unearth this fact from a disloyal servant. George Lucas could have exposed Luke’s paternity by having C3PO warn R2D2, “Don’t tell Luke, he’d really be upset to hear this, but Darth’s his dad.” Rather, they used Backstory exposition to create explosive Turning Points that open the gap between expectation and result, and deliver a rush of insight. With few exceptions, scenes cannot be turned on nothing but action, action, action. Inevitably we need a mix of action and revelation. Revelations, in fact, tend to have more impact, and so we often reserve them for the major Turning Points, act climaxes.

闪回

FLASHBACKS

倒叙只是另一种形式的阐述。像其他所有形式一样，它要么做得好，要么做得不好。换句话说，与其用冗长、没有动机、充满阐述的对话段落让观众感到无聊，我们不如用不想要的、枯燥的、充满事实的倒叙来让观众感到无聊。或者我们做得很好。如果我们遵循传统阐述的优良原则，倒叙可以创造奇迹。

The flashback is simply another form of exposition. Like all else, it’s done either well or ill. In other words, rather than boring the audience with long, unmotivated, exposition-filled dialogue passages, we could bore it with unwanted, dull, fact-filled flashbacks. Or we do it well. A flashback can work wonders if we follow the fine principles of conventional exposition.

首先，戏剧化地闪回。

First, dramatize flashbacks.

不要闪回平淡的过去场景，而要将一个迷你剧插入故事中，并有自己的激励事件、发展和转折点。尽管制片人经常声称倒叙会减慢影片的节奏，如果处理得不好，倒叙确实会起到这样的效果，而处理得当的倒叙实际上会加快影片的节奏。

Rather than flashing back to flat scenes in the past, interpolate a minidrama into the story with its own Inciting Incident, progressions, and Turning Point. Although producers often claim that flashbacks slow a film’s pace, and indeed badly done they do, a well-done flashback actually accelerates pace.

《卡萨布兰卡》：巴黎闪回出现在第二幕的开头。里克喝着威士忌哭泣，醉醺醺的，心情低落，影片的节奏故意放慢，以缓解第一幕高潮的紧张感。但当里克回忆起他和伊尔莎的恋情时，闪回他们之间的爱情故事，纳粹入侵巴黎时，影片的节奏越来越快，在伊尔莎抛弃里克的场景中达到高潮。

CASABLANCA: The Paris Flashback comes at the opening of Act Two. Rick is crying in his whiskey, drunk and depressed, the film’s rhythm deliberately retarding to relieve the tension of the Act One Climax. But as Rick remembers his affair with Ilsa, the flashback to the tale of their love affair while the Nazis invade Paris sweeps the film into an ever swifter pace that peaks around a sequence Climax as Ilsa runs out on Rick.

《落水狗：谋杀谜案的诱因》结合了两个事件：谋杀案发生；主角发现了犯罪事实。然而，阿加莎·克里斯蒂的故事只以后半部分开始——壁橱门打开，一具尸体掉出来。她从发现犯罪事实开始，从两个方面激发读者的好奇心：回顾过去，谋杀案是如何发生的，为什么发生？回顾未来，众多嫌疑人中，谁是凶手？

RESERVOIR DOGS: The Inciting Incident of a Murder Mystery combines two events: A murder is committed; the protagonist discovers the crime. Agatha Christie, however, opens her stories with only the second half—a closet door opens and a body falls out. By starting with the discovery of the crime, she arouses curiosity in two directions: Into the past, how and why was the murder committed? Into the future, which of the many suspects did it?

塔伦蒂诺的设计只是对阿加莎·克里斯蒂的重新演绎。在介绍完角色后，塔伦蒂诺跳过了激励事件的前半部分——抢劫失败——并立即切换到后半部分——逃亡。当其中一名小偷在逃亡车辆的后座上受伤时，我们立即意识到抢劫失败了，我们的好奇心奔向过去和未来。哪里出了问题？结果会如何？塔伦蒂诺创造了想知道这两个答案的需求和欲望，每当仓库场景的节奏变慢时，塔伦蒂诺就会闪回到抢劫的高速动作。这是一个简单的想法，但从来没有人如此大胆地做到这一点，这部原本可能不太有活力的电影却拥有了稳定的节奏。

Tarantino’s design simply reworks Agatha Christie. After introducing his characters, Tarantino launched the film by skipping over the first half of the Inciting Incident—the botched heist—and cut immediately to the second half—the getaway. With one of the thieves wounded in the backseat of the getaway car we instantly realize the robbery has gone bad and our curiosity runs into the past and future. What went wrong? How will it turn out? Having created the need and desire to know both answers, whenever pace in the warehouse scenes flagged, Tarantino flashed back to the high-speed action of the heist. A simple idea, but no one had ever done it with such daring, and what could have been a less than energetic film had solid pace.

其次，不要引入倒叙，除非你已经激发了观众了解情况的需要和欲望。

Second, do not bring in a flashback until you have created in the audience the need and desire to know.

《卡萨布兰卡》：第一幕高潮也是主线情节的诱发事件，因为伊尔莎突然再次出现在里克的生活中，他们在萨姆的钢琴旁进行了一次激烈的眼神交流。接下来是鸡尾酒聊天、双关语和潜台词的场景，暗示着过去的关系和激情依然存在。第二幕开始时，观众充满好奇，想知道这两个人在巴黎发生了什么。只有当观众需要并想知道时，编剧才会闪回。

CASABLANCA: The Act One Climax is also the Central Plot’s Inciting Incident as Ilsa suddenly reappears in Rick’s life and they share a powerful exchange of looks over Sam’s piano. There follows a scene of cocktail chat, double entendres, and subtext that hint at a past relationship and a passion still very much alive. As Act Two opens, the audience is burning with curiosity, wondering what went on between these two in Paris. Then and only then, when the audience needs and wants to know, do the writers flash back.

我们必须认识到，剧本不是小说。小说家可以直接侵入人物的思想和感情。我们不能。因此，小说家可以尽情享受自由联想的奢侈。我们不能。如果愿意，散文作家可以让一个角色走过一家商店的橱窗，让他往里面看，回忆起他的整个童年：“那天下午，他正走过家乡，瞥了一眼理发店，想起了小时候父亲带他去理发店的日子，他坐在老人们中间，抽着雪茄，谈论棒球。正是在那里，他第一次听到‘性’这个词，从那以后，他再也无法和女人睡觉，因为他觉得自己是在打一场本垒打。”

We must realize that a screenplay is not a novel. Novelists can directly invade the thoughts and feelings of characters. We cannot. Novelists, therefore, can indulge the luxury of free association. We cannot. The prose writer can, if he wishes, walk a character past a shop window, have him look inside and remember his entire childhood: “He was walking through his hometown that afternoon when he glanced over at the barbershop and remembered the days when his father would take him there as a boy and he’d sit among the old-timers as they smoked cigars and talked about baseball. It was there that he first heard the word ‘sex’ and ever since he’s unable to sleep with a woman without thinking he was hitting a home run.”

用散文形式来阐述故事相对容易，但摄影机是一台可以检查所有虚假事物的X光机。如果我们试图通过小说式的自由联想剪辑或半潜意识的颤动剪辑来“瞥见”人物的思想，强行将故事情节融入电影，我们会觉得这样做很做作。

Exposition in prose is relatively easy, but the camera is an X-ray machine for all things false. If we try to force exposition into a film through novel-like free associative editing or semisubliminal flutter cuts that “glimpse” a character’s thoughts, it strikes us as contrived.

梦境序列

DREAM SEQUENCES

梦境序列是穿着舞会礼服的展示。上述所有内容都适用于这些通常无力的用弗洛伊德陈词滥调来掩盖信息的努力。英格玛·伯格曼的《野草莓》是梦境的少数有效用途之一。

The Dream Sequence is exposition in a ball gown. Everything said above applies doubly to these usually feeble efforts to disguise information in Freudian clichés. One of the few effective uses of a dream opens Ingmar Bergman’s WILD STRAWBERRIES.

剪辑

MONTAGE

在美国，蒙太奇是指一系列快速剪切的图像，这些图像会大幅压缩或扩展时间，并且经常使用诸如擦除、光圈、分屏、淡入淡出或其他多重图像等光学效果。此类序列的高能量被用来掩盖其目的：传达信息的平凡任务。与梦境序列一样，蒙太奇是一种通过让观众的眼睛忙碌来使非戏剧化的解说不那么无聊的努力。除了少数例外，蒙太奇是一种懒惰的尝试，试图用装饰性的摄影和剪辑来代替戏剧化，因此应避免使用。

In the American use of this term, a montage is a series of rapidly cut images that radically condenses or expands time and often employs optical effects such as wipes, irises, split screens, dissolves, or other multiple images. The high energy of such sequences is used to mask their purpose: the rather mundane task of conveying information. Like the Dream Sequence, the montage is an effort to make undramatized exposition less boring by keeping the audience’s eye busy. With few exceptions, montages are a lazy attempt to substitute decorative photography and editing for dramatization and are, therefore, to be avoided.

画外音旁白

VOICE-OVER NARRATION

画外音叙述是另一种表达说明的方式。像闪回一样，它做得好或不好。叙述的检验标准是：问问自己，“如果我从剧本中去掉画外音，故事还会讲得很好吗？”如果答案是肯定的……那就保留它。通常，“少即是多”的原则适用：技术越经济，影响就越大。因此，任何可以删减的东西都应该删减。但是也有例外。如果可以删除叙述，故事仍然讲得很好，那么你可能只是出于一个好的理由使用叙述——作为对比。

Voice-over narration is yet another way to divulge exposition. Like the Flashback, it’s done well or ill. The test of narration is this: Ask yourself, “If I were to strip the voice-over out of my screenplay, would the story still be well told?” If the answer is yes… keep it in. Generally, the principle “Less is more” applies: the more economical the technique, the more impact it has. Therefore, anything that can be cut should be cut. There are, however, exceptions. If narration can be removed and the story still stands on its feet well told, then you’ve probably used narration for the only good reason—as counterpoint.

对比叙事是伍迪·艾伦的一大天赋。如果我们把《汉娜姐妹》或《丈夫和妻子》中的画外音剪掉，他的故事仍然清晰而有效。但我们为什么要这么做呢？他的叙述提供了其他方式无法做到的智慧、讽刺和见解。画外音添加非叙事对比可能会令人愉快。

Counterpoint narration is Woody Allen’s great gift. If we were to cut the voice-over from HANNAH AND HER SISTERS or HUSBANDS AND WIVES his stories would still be lucid and effective. But why would we? His narration offers wit, ironies, and insights that can’t be done any other way. Voice-over to add nonnarrative counterpoint can be delightful.

偶尔，简短的叙事，尤其是在开场或幕间过渡时，比如《巴里·林登》，并没有什么不妥，但整部电影都使用叙事的趋势却威胁到了我们艺术的未来。好莱坞和欧洲一些最优秀的导演越来越多地沉迷于这种懒惰的做法。他们用华丽的摄影和奢华的制作价值充斥着银幕，然后用配乐中嗡嗡作响的声音将图像连接在一起，把电影变成了曾经被称为经典漫画书的地方。

Occasionally, brief telling narration, especially at the opening or during transitions between acts, such as in BARRY LYNDON, is inoffensive, but the trend toward using telling narration throughout a film threatens the future of our art. More and more films by some of the finest directors from Hollywood and Europe indulge in this indolent practice. They saturate the screen with lush photography and lavish production values, then tie images together with a voice droning on the soundtrack, turning the cinema into what was once known as Classic Comic Books.

我们中的许多人都是通过阅读经典漫画（以卡通形象呈现的小说，配以文字说明故事情节）才第一次接触到大作家的作品。这对孩子来说没问题，但这不是电影。电影艺术通过剪辑、摄影机或镜头将图像 A 连接起来图像 B 的运动，其效果是意义 C、D 和 E，无需解释即可表达。最近，一部又一部的电影将稳定摄影机滑过房间和走廊，在街道上来回穿梭，摇摄布景和演员，而旁白则用画外音不停地说话，向我们讲述一个角色的成长经历，或者他的梦想和恐惧，或者解释故事中的社会政治——直到电影变成了价值数百万美元的带插图的录音带书籍。

Many of us were first exposed to the works of major writers by reading Classic Comics, novels in cartoon images with captions that told the story. That’s fine for children, but it’s not cinema. The art of cinema connects Image A via editing, camera, or lens movement with Image B, and the effect is meanings C, D, and E, expressed without explanation. Recently, film after film slides a steady-cam through rooms and corridors, up and down streets, panning sets and cast while a narrator talks, talks, talks voice-over, telling us about a character’s upbringing, or his dreams and fears, or explaining the politics of the story’s society—until the film becomes little more than multimillion-dollar books-on-tape, illustrated.

用解释来填充配乐不需要太多天赋和努力。“展示，而不是讲述”是对艺术和纪律的呼吁，警告我们不要屈服于懒惰，而是要设定创造性的限制，这需要最大限度地发挥想象力和汗水。将每一个转折戏剧化为自然、无缝的场景流动是一项艰苦的工作，但当我们让自己沉迷于“直截了当”的叙述时，我们会削弱我们的创造力，消除观众的好奇心，并破坏叙事动力。

It takes little talent and less effort to fill a soundtrack with explanation. “Show, don’t tell” is a call for artistry and discipline, a warning to us not to give in to laziness but to set creative limitations that demand the fullest use of imagination and sweat. Dramatizing every turn into a natural, seamless flow of scenes is hard work, but when we allow ourselves the comfort of “on the nose” narration we gut our creativity, eliminate the audience’s curiosity, and destroy narrative drive.

更重要的是，“展示而不是讲述”意味着尊重观众的智慧和敏感性。邀请他们以最好的状态参与仪式，观看、思考、感受并得出自己的结论。不要把他们像孩子一样放在膝盖上“解释”生活，因为对叙述的误用和过度使用不仅是懈怠，而且是居高临下的。如果这种趋势继续下去，电影将沦为劣质小说，我们的艺术将萎缩。

More importantly, “Show, don’t tell” means respect the intelligence and sensitivity of your audience. Invite them to bring their best selves to the ritual, to watch, think, feel, and draw their own conclusions. Do not put them on your knee as if they were children and “explain” life, for the misuse and overuse of narration is not only slack, it’s patronizing. And if the trend toward it continues, cinema will degrade into adulterated novels and our art will shrivel.

为了研究巧妙的解说设计，我建议仔细分析一下《刺杀肯尼迪》。获取奥利弗·斯通的剧本和/或视频，逐个场景地分析这部电影，列出它所包含的所有事实，无论是无可争辩的还是所谓的。然后注意斯通如何将这个如珠穆朗玛峰般巨大的信息分解成重要的部分，将每一部分都戏剧化，并控制揭露的节奏。这是一部工艺精湛的杰作。

To study the skillful design of exposition, I suggest a close analysis of JFK. Obtain Oliver Stone’s screenplay and/or the video and break the film down, scene by scene, listing all the facts, indisputable or alleged, it contains. Then note how Stone splintered this Mount Everest of information into its vital pieces, dramatized each bit, pacing the progression of revelations. It is a masterpiece of craftsmanship.

16

问题与解决方案

16

PROBLEMS AND SOLUTIONS

本章探讨了八个长期存在的问题，从如何吸引人们的兴趣，到如何适应其他媒体，再到如何应对逻辑漏洞。对于每个问题，该手艺都提供了解决方案。

This chapter examines eight enduring problems, from how to hold interest, to how to adapt from other media, to how to cope with holes in logic. For each problem the craft provides solutions.

利息问题

THE PROBLEM OF INTEREST

营销可能会吸引观众走进剧院，但一旦仪式开始，就需要令人信服的理由来吸引观众。故事必须引起人们的兴趣，并始终保持这种兴趣，然后在高潮时给予回报。除非设计能够吸引人性的两面——智慧和情感，否则这项任务几乎不可能完成。

Marketing may entice an audience into the theatre, but once the ritual begins, it needs compelling reasons to stay involved. A story must capture interest, hold it unswervingly through time, then reward it at Climax. This task is next to impossible unless the design attracts both sides of human nature—intellect and emotion.

好奇心是回答问题和关闭开放模式的智力需求。故事通过做相反的事情来满足这种普遍的愿望，提出问题并开启情境。每个转折点都会引起好奇心。随着主角面临的风险越来越大，观众想知道“接下来会发生什么？之后呢？”最重要的是，“结果会如何？”这个问题的答案要到最后一幕高潮才会出现，因此观众在好奇心的驱使下，一直待在原地。想想你看完的所有烂片，唯一的原因就是为了得到这个困扰你的问题的答案。我们可能会让观众哭或笑，但最重要的是，正如查尔斯·里德所说，我们让他们等待。

Curiosity is the intellectual need to answer questions and close open patterns. Story plays to this universal desire by doing the opposite, posing questions and opening situations. Each Turning Point hooks curiosity. As the protagonist is put at increasingly greater risk, the audience wonders, “What’s going to happen next? And after that?” And above all, “How will it turn out?” The answer to this will not arrive until the last act Climax, and so the audience, held by curiosity, stays put. Think of all the bad films you’ve sat through for no other reason than to get the answer to that nagging question. We may make the audience cry or laugh, but above all, as Charles Reade noted, we make it wait.

另一方面，关心是对生命积极价值的情感需求：正义、力量、生存、爱、真理、勇气。人类本能地排斥其认为是消极的事物，同时强烈地被积极的事物所吸引。

Concern, on the other hand, is the emotional need for the positive values of life: justice, strength, survival, love, truth, courage. Human nature is instinctively repelled by what it perceives as negative, while drawn powerfully toward positive.

故事开始时，观众有意识或本能地审视充满价值观的世界和人物，试图区分善与恶、对与错、有价值的事物和没有价值的事物。它寻找善的中心。一旦找到这个核心，情感就会流向它。

As a story opens, the audience, consciously or instinctively, inspects the value-charged landscape of world and characters, trying to separate good from evil, right from wrong, things of value from things of no value. It seeks the Center of Good. Once finding this core, emotions flow to it.

我们寻找善的中心，是因为我们每个人都相信自己是好的或正确的，并希望认同积极的一面。我们内心深处知道自己有缺陷，也许非常严重，甚至是犯罪，但不知何故，我们觉得尽管如此，我们的心还是正确的。最坏的人也相信自己是好的。希特勒认为他是欧洲的救世主。

The reason we search for the Center of Good is that each of us believes that we are good or right and want to identify with the positive. Deep inside we know we’re flawed, perhaps seriously so, even criminal, but somehow we feel that despite that, our heart is in the right place. The worst of people believe themselves good. Hitler thought he was the savior of Europe.

我曾经加入过曼哈顿的一家健身房，当时并不知道这是黑手党的聚集地，并遇到了一个有趣、讨人喜欢的家伙，他的绰号是科尼岛先生，这是他十几岁时作为健美运动员赢得的称号。然而，现在他成了“纽扣人”。 “To button up” 意思是闭嘴。 纽扣人“戴上纽扣”或让人们永远闭嘴。 有一天在蒸汽房里，他坐下来说：“嘿，鲍勃，告诉我一件事。你是‘好’人之一吗？”换句话说，我属于黑帮吗？

I once joined a gym in Manhattan not knowing it was a mafia hangout and met an amusing, likable guy whose nickname was Mr. Coney Island, a title he’d won as a bodybuilder in his teens. Now, however, he was a “button man.” “To button up” means to shut up. A button man “puts the button on” or shuts people up… forever. One day in the steam room he sat down and said, “Hey, Bob, tell me something. Are you one of the ‘good’ people?” In other words, did I belong to the mob?

黑手党的逻辑是这样的：“人们想要卖淫、吸毒和非法赌博。当他们遇到麻烦时，他们想贿赂警察和法官。他们想尝尝犯罪的果实，但他们是撒谎的伪君子，不会承认这一点。我们提供这些服务，但我们不是伪君子。我们面对现实。我们是‘好’人。”科尼·艾兰先生是一个没有良心的杀手，但他内心坚信自己是个好人。

Mafia logic runs like this: “People want prostitution, narcotics, and illicit gambling. When they’re in trouble, they want to bribe police and judges. They want to taste the fruits of crime, but they’re lying hypocrites and won’t admit it. We provide these services but we’re not hypocrites. We deal in realities. We are the ‘good’ people.” Mr. Coney Island was a conscienceless assassin, but inside he was convinced he was good.

无论观众是谁，每个人都在寻求善的中心，即同情和情感兴趣的积极焦点。

No matter who’s in the audience, each seeks the Center of Good, the positive focus for empathy and emotional interest.

至少，善良的中心必须位于主角身上。其他人也可以拥有这个中心，因为我们可以同情任何角色，但我们必须同情主角。另一方面，善良的中心并不意味着“善良”。“善良”的定义不仅取决于它是什么，还取决于它不是什么。从观众的角度来看，“善良”是在关系中做出的判断在消极的背景下，或者在消极的背景下，一个被认为或感觉“不好”的宇宙。

At the very least the Center of Good must be located in the protagonist. Others may share it, for we can empathize with any number of characters, but we must empathize with the protagonist. On the other hand, the Center of Good doesn’t imply “niceness.” “Good” is defined as much by what it’s not as by what it is. From the audience’s point of view, “good” is a judgment made in relationship to or against a background of negativity, a universe that’s thought or felt to be “not good.”
